Summary: Since the remodel some reviews were 5 stars, our experience was a 3 though. The room remodel looks good but it had dirty floors, the towels & linens were nice & clean. Shower pressure was low but the water stayed hot. Breakfast had fresh fruit and packaged danishes/muffins to go. The staff was friendly and helpful. Pulling into the hotel is confusing since to get to the hotel feels like you’re going to Jack-in-the-box. GPS routes to the back of the parking lot but the gate is locked. Overall our stay suited our purpose but wasn’t special in any way.
Manager Response: Dear havilahs2021,   Thank you for being our guest and for your review. We are glad you liked your new accommodations, breakfast, and friendly associates. However, we apologize for the cleanliness issues in your room. We will address this matter with our housekeeping associates to ensure that it does not happen again. We hope you will consider giving us another opportunity to host you in the future and to welcome you back again soon.  Angel Arteaga Assistant General Manager

All rooms were remodeled. I expected dirty carpets but got new vinyl plank floors. I expected an old bathroom but got a new tub and shower as well as a new toilet. Lights were LED and outlets were replaced with the white rectangular outlets. And the light switches were the rectangular wide on/off kind. The AC worked perfectly. Frig & Microwave also worked. Paint was new. my only complaint was the tub drain was super slow draining. I told the office and it was fixed ASAP. Parking was free and I could see my car from my window. I have no complaints. I'll definitely stay here again. Great location.  oh yeah, one

Terrible terrible terrible! Between the hotel manager having a very dramatic violent argument with what looked like her lover to the blood stains on the coffee table beside our bed, this hotel is trash. We were not supplied with the proper amenities that were supposed to be offered, like simply having the proper amount of toilet paper available upon check in. The carpet was filthy, walls were marked up all over, curtains ripped, holes in the wall, yet they want a $100 damage deposit upon check in… Ha! Don’t bother staying here just to save a buck. Manager Response: Dear Lindy, It is unfortunate to hear that your stay with us fell short of expectations. Summary: Nice place to stay big clean rooms friendly staff. Clean sheets stores are walking distance from the motel beautiful view. The pool is huge but not open at the moment. Laundry on site to wash. I recommend this place

The room is dated, but it was sufficient enough for me   I actually couldn't hear anything coming from other rooms or outside, so that was a plus.   The only real complaint I have about this place is they tried to make us change a dead lightbulb for ourselves. No stars. I was willing to overlook the crusty bathtub and dirty floors, even the lack of options for their breakfast because we were only there for three nights and going to be in Disneyland for most of our visit. Please fix this, we were good and quiet guests, even leaving a tip for housekeeping. I am willing to update my review if this issue is resolved. Myself and a friend stayed here as we were wanting to visit Disneyland while we were travelling. The accommodation was exactly what we paid for, beds were comfortable and the room was clean. We were able to do some laundry which was great and there were many food options close by. Disneyland was a $3 uber away, definitley recommend to anyone wanting an affordable stay with no extra luxuries to visit the area and Disneyland.

Good Value. I booked this hotel and was worried after reading the reviews. Stayed 2 days. The hotel is very close to Disneyland and is surrounded by many other hotels. We never heard loud arguments or even saw any panhandlers. [There were two young girls sleeping at the bus stop bench up the street]. The hotel could use some TLC and minor maintenance. However, the doors and windows were all secure and locked. The breakfast was a little skimpy compared to other hotels in segment, with only waffles, coffee, juice, two cereal bins, bread, toaster, eggs and apples.

The "double" beds were the smallest I have ever slept in. Paper thin walls.  I wouldn't go back. Even $20 more per night should get you something better.

Summary Heading: you get what you pay for

This hotel lacks intergrity. None of the pictures online were true to what it was. The pool was smaller and the room was not nearly as nice. This hotel would not have been that bad had they advertised it truthfully. However, their lack of accurate advertising made the experience unacceptable and i dont plan on staying there ever again. Being deceitful deserves no reward.

Summary Heading: Days Inn Anaheim Convention Ctr, NOT!

After night mgr tried for an hour to adjust door with a crowbar (new doors/locks/weather affected lock) was explanation, offered to help carry all my heavy luggage upstairs. But couldn't let a nice older man with a walking cane make 20 trips up and down. Hotel manager at midnight said to find another hotel or deal with it. Big 4-day convention, rooms overbooked at Days Inn, etc. No other place to stay on the weekend. Bad mgmt. Why weren't doors checked before guests arrived. Otherwise, ok. Nice staff. Homeless using property; had to call front desk.

There were homeless people using the laundry machines near the pool and I still can't get over how gross the floor was in the room. After a long day at a theme park, my friend and i couldn't walk around our room barefoot. The hotel is pretty close to Disney and pretty cheap, but I'd rather pay more for a room farther away than deal with this feet thing again. Fresh out of the shower was even worse, wet feet got stained black even faster.

Oh and late night Jack in-the Box burgers - right there were perfectly adequate as well .

I called this hotel before booking it to ask if they had a FREE shuttle and the receptionist said oh yes we do well when I checked in I was told I needed to go across the street to catch shuttle the receptionist failed to tell me I had to pay for the shuttle...

A member of the cleaning staff stole my niece's shoes and said nobody had turned anything in. The only good thing about this hotel was it was close to Disneyland and Uber was cheap.

The only good thing was uber was only $6 to Disneyland.

Stayed three nights at Days Inn. Everything was what you would expect. Everything worked. Room was cleaned. Only problem, was you can hear the people above us walking around at night. Besides that it was a great stay.

Nice room & good value. Location was good for me as it's close to the Anaheim Convention Center. My only complaint & something that should be done is the carpets in the room really need to be cleaned. They are in poor shape. Other than that, overall I was satisfied & would stay there again.

Overall this was a good stay for the price. Room was decent and WiFi was reliable. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. However, breakfast needed more fresh fruit options and there was a lot of traffic noise late at night.  We would consider staying here again in the future.

Summary Heading: Staff was nice and helpful. The carpet and the chair in our...
Summary: Staff was nice and helpful. The carpet and the chair in our room had big stains on them. The floor in the bathroom had black stains or was mold. We were told since the pool was down so was the laundry facility for two days!!!! We picked this place because it had good reviews. We will not stay here again.

This property was budget friendly. The bathroom needed some serious updating. Also would have liked better quality sheets, but mattress was okay. Front desk staff was friendly. Did not get a chance to check out complimentary breakfast.
The location is good. The continental breakfast could use better fresh fruit and not watered down orange juice

Summary Heading: Worst ever hotel I have stayed in!!!
Summary: This hotel is not worth the money you pay for, room was filthy, carpet stained and dirty, room smell was horrible, beds very uncomfortable, bathroom not clean.

Summary Heading: Good clean hotel on a budget
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel on a previous trip to Disney. The room is clean, decent decor and relatively comfortable. It is too far to walk to Disney but the Toy Story parking isn't too far and you grab their free bus. The bed is OK but not superb, but it is an inexpensive hotel. If you want a room to sleep that is clean a decently comfortable, this is a great choice. Breakfast is the basic, waffles, cereal, toast, fruit deal most hotels offer.

This room was so unclean. The carpet was so filthy I told my kids to wear socks because there feet kept getting dirty. The sheets looked like they have never been changed out. It smelt and according to the receptionist the reason the rug looked that way is because the children from Disney land. They need a professional cleaning crew to come through there and clean it.

The room was extremely musty, you could smell the mold and it wasn't hidden, there was mold on the ceiling. The beds were almost as hard as the linens. The air conditioner didn't work and fell apart when you touched it and there are no elevator access to the second floor. Paint was chipped and walls were cracked, the room was in desperate need of an overhaul. The single positive element about this hotel was the front desk staff member, Monica. She was very pleasant and professional. I will never stay here again. Wyndham is 0 and 2 for hotels thus far in the Disneyland area. The first was the Travelodge down the street and now Days Inn, both were horrible.

This property is absolutely disgusting.  We found roaches in our room, came back two consecutive days from the park to find the room hadn’t been cleaned, smelled mildew on the carpet, and didn’t bother returning to the pathetic continental breakfast a second day after smelling the rotten, hard boiled eggs.  There were mysterious stains on the drapes, and the bed is very uncomfortable (you can feel every spring in the mattress).  We had to request a replacement for the broken television remote.  The property is a good mile or so walk to the park, so do yourself a favor a spend a bit more on a closer, cleaner hotel room.
Room floor / carpet was very dirty and sticky. In addition Plumbing issue was there. Bathtub was stagnant.

Summary Heading: Carpet was gross, furniture looked beatupNo elevator at...
Summary: Carpet was gross, furniture looked beatup No elevator at this location seen for 2nd floor Overpriced for comprobable hotels nearby Would likely not stay here again.

This hotel was okay for the price. I booked it for the breakfast, but it wasn't really impressive enough for it to be worth the farther distance from Disney. my recommendation is to find a place closer to the parks.

Summary Heading: It was worst experience , water was soapy n microwave n bed lights r not working n carpets are uncleaned
Summary: It was worst experience , water was soapy n microwave n bed lights r not working n carpets are uncleaned

This was the worst hotel staying experience of my life. I first arrive at the hotel to be told that I have 2 rooms reserved under my name. I reserved 1 room in March online and got an error on the website so I called to follow up. The person on the phone confirmed that a room had been reserved for me. I think they double booked me. The manager on duty was gracious enough to "waive" the cancellation fee.  Sorry, I wouldn't have paid a cancellation fee for an internal mistake in your company, so you don't need to act like you're doing me a solid favor.  I get into the room drop my stuff off and head to the convention center. When I get back I try to shower before bed and the shower head is broken and just dribbles water everywhere instead of spraying it like a normal shower head.

Summary Heading: Wear socks or flip flops in your rooms.
Summary: CARPETS. Wear your socks or flip flops in your rooms because if you don't your feet will be BLACK. The carpets are in dire need of shampooing or just replacing. They are stained, dirty and just plain dingy. If you have a crawler....forget it. Find somewhere else. The carpets are NOT sanitary enough for your little ones to crawl on. I had a coffee maker that was rusted on the warmer, and didn't work. The staff replaced it pretty quickly. The staff was very nice from the front desk to the housekeepers. The pool and hot tub looked like there was piles of dirt sitting on the bottom. I'm sure this is because of being outside but come on, someone has to be maintaining the quality? Despite bringing our swimwear, it was not very appealing. The price was right but the man at the front

It's a place to stay, but not much more. There were stains everywhere. Counters weren't clean and there was still trash in the room. The breakfast wasn't really worth going to -- just weird tasting waffles, bread, and cereal.

The staff was friendly and welcoming.  That is the ONLY good thing I have to say about this place.  That is what earned it a 1 and not a zero.     Upon entry into our room (#208), there was a stench of urine among other issues.  I found dried blood on one of the bedspreads and very dark stains on a mattress and box spring.  There were many stains on the carpeting and furniture broken so badly that you could see the flooring behind the front paneling. The paint in the bathtub, yes paint in the bathtub, was peeling off and the bathtub overflow cover was broken off enough to expose rust and mold growing behind it. I understand that some of these issues are aesthetic but others are dangerous health issues.  Needless to say, we did not sleep much at all in fear of what we weren’t

Summary Heading: I was more than disappointed when I seen a maid leaving a...
Summary: I was more than disappointed when I seen a maid leaving a room wit .  A Disneyland bag and take it to her car, I would be devastated if I had forgotten something in our room and instead of it being returned, it was stolen. Sad situation

Convienent location near Disneyland and the price is really good! The only complaint I really have is how dirty the carpet was. It definitely needs to be shampooed! Other than that, everything else was clean. The breakfast could use a little extra items. Overall, I would stay here again because of the price.
the room was clean and comfortable. the internet was unusable very slow when I did get connected
The hotel, at first sight, doesn't look all that great but the room is good and is kinda more if you are going to the big amusement parks to spend it with family

Let’s see....a weak spot in the floor that is obviously the sub floor collapsing, our entry area carpet stained black, broken furniture, pubic hair in the shower left over from God knows when, stained sheets...all for $120.

This was pretty good for a two star hotel. It was quiet with plenty of parking. Breakfast was cereal, waffles, and hard boiled eggs. Nothing fancy but everything on the grounds was well kept, and felt safe for a family.  The room seemed clean except for the carpet. It was really dirty and stained. Don't take off your shoes in the room. The bathroom and bedding was clean and updated. The drive in the room was ancient but it was super cold so no problems there. The front desk gave us a couple extra flat sheets so we could cover the chairs which were also dirty. Overall, it was pretty much what we paid for so no real complaints. We took an Uber to Disneyland for about 6 dollars.

Summary Heading: Quality comfort at a reasonable price.
Summary: This hotel proved to be a surprisingly comfortable and affordable place to stay for a Disneyland stopover. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The only disturbing thing was the "Breakfast" offerings.. do it yourself waffles, maybe cereal, no toast facilities evident and commercial hard boiled eggs. The latter caused some interesting moments on the drive north, making 'comfort stops' at restrooms every hour were necessary .... However the coffee was good...

This has to be one of the best values in the whole area. I paid $56 including tax for a perfectly good room, excellent wifi, nice TV, fridge and microwave, quiet and convenient, parking lot seemed safe, front desk staff extremely nice. I missed the breakfast due to an early flight but I highly recommend staying here for the price and convenience. Target is down the street and plenty of other shopping and dining within easy walking distance. I understand why many are complaining about the carpets, they are a little gross, but it's a small price to pay for such a good deal.

Room was clean and adequate although this one had no fridge or microwave.  The big negative, however, was that the door lock did not work.  Inside the room, I could use the deadbolt; however, if I wanted to leave the room it was unlocked which was unsettling.  Did not report problem until morning.

Summary Heading: Spend 5 night with the family to go to Disneyland
Summary: When you realize the price for every single hotel near Disney, and you find this one with a reasonable price. You really hope there is nothing weird in their rooms. But for my happiness and tranquility its an amazing hotel. Dakota at the front desk was great with us, she speaks 8 languages all of them to help you during the process she has to do to check you in, and is really fun to talk to. The rooms are way better than what I was expecting for the price, everything worked perfectly and our room being a king size bed was pretty much new, there are ways to improve it, but for what we paid it is a great room, a restroom in perfect conditions and really good air conditioner.

Summary Heading: Good for price and distance to Convention and Disneyland
Summary: A hotel that is amazing staying at, the price ratio distance and cleaness is great. I would totally stay for more time and another time to enjoy Disneyland. The hotel works perfect for what you need it, to get a nice bed, sleep and forget about complications.
Decent breakfast options. Room was just ok, the carpet was very dirty, didn't have a bath due to the look of an old dingy bathtub. Had a pool and hot tub.

The place was ok, one thing that really got annoying was our TV kept freezing. We'd have to turn it off for a little while then turn it back on. I think TV service should be better for their guest in hotel's.

This hotel is disgusting. Right when I walked into the room, it smelled like cigs. The door to our room would not lock and it was a real pain everytime we were getting ready to leave. After already receiving our $100 deposit back, management takes the money again. AFTER WE HAD ALREADY CHECKED OUT. This hotel was trash and so was the management. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE. Rooms were nasty, as well as the free breakfast. the waffles sucked. This hotel is not even worth one star but that's the lowest the scale goes.

Wifi never worked at all, never slept in a cheaper worse bed in my life. Springs were sooo uncomfortable and dug into my back. Room was musty and air conditioner unit smelled. The shower was just a shower head on the bathroom wall with no door or tub. So when you would use it, the whole entire bathroom would flood. Good for 1 day. Don't do what I did and stay 3 days p

Summary Heading: Better than not going to Disneyland.
Summary: It's safe, there are no bugs, there is free parking, no "resort fee", and the AC works. It's really in expensive.I was able to get a room here for half the price of any other hotel in the area on Priceline. I never waited more than 3 minutes for a Uber. The front desk staff was nice.   The carpets are dirty, it smells like feet and cigarettes, and the hallways smell like urine.   If you are on a SUPER tight budget, this place will do the trick. If this is your only option, you can make it work. Bring some fabreeze, tape drier sheets to the vents on the ac, and wear flip flops in the room and you'll be fine.   People at the breakfast bar area are cranky. More so at this hotel than any other hotel I've stayed at. Jack in the Box is next door. About 30 feet from the reception desk.

Summary Heading: Pool closed the entire dAy for cleaning, but cleaning never...
Summary: Pool closed the entire dAy for cleaning, but cleaning never done. Took shower and walked across carpet,which was sticky and damp and my feet got black. Door would not latch closed unless you set the deadbolt. If going out you could not secure it shut.
I normally stay at days inn but this time was a bad experience no shampoo or hand soap.. The water in the shower did not go down

This place isn't the nicest Days Inn I have stayed at and my room could have used a little repair work but the people definitely made up for it.  Dakota was great in making sure I received a ground floor room when my mobility scooter was delivered.  They kept my bags in storage while I transitioned to my actual convention hotel.  Mike the night desk manager was especially nice and we enjoyed sharing our mutual interests.  What more can you ask for at breakfast than a selection of cereals, waffle, eggs, coffee and juice especially when it's free.  I would definitely stay there again when I come to Anaheim.  Like being able to open the window and enjoy the beautiful weather.  Housekeeping staff kept my room nice and clean.

Summary Heading: Good waffles and fireworks but rooms unclean
Summary: Upon arrival: big dead silver-fish (insect) on bathroom floor. Black hair on floor and in shower when no one in our family has black hair: we cleaned these parts of our own room on arrival day. Room didn't smell good: had to use our car air freshener in our room.  Door-hanger had 2 options: "the sun is up and so are we" or "the sun has set and so have we". I assumed the first side meant maid service would come in. We were gone all the next day and no one cleaned room. I complained to front desk and was told that staff doesn't read English and if I want maid service to leave door-hanger off door, then maids went straight to our room to clean.  But, we could partially see Disney fireworks from room and very cheap priced rooms. Breakfast area was full of people in line for waffles:

I was disappointed when we arrived. I wish I had booked for the Days Inn & Suites down the road. It felt like a motel and the rooms looked worn and dirty. It was ok for a one night stay. The breakfast wasn't worth it either. Hardboiled eggs and a long line to make waffles.

This hotel is very dirty. Walls had stains on them, side of the door to the bathroom was grey and looked like has not been clean in ages. Carpet was awful with lots of stains, we could not walk bare feet on it, our feet turned black from walking on this carpet in the room.  WiFi was constantly disconnecting. Very upsetting!

Summary Heading: This location is not a main gate hotel.
Summary: The hot tub was horribly dirty and I was charged more than I was set to pay via booking.com. The location also held an additional $50 fee which was not on the site. Also the hotel is listed as a main gate hotel. This location is no where near disneyland main gate. No wonder is is not a Disney good neighbor Property . I will not stay here again. Better off at the motel 6 on disney way. Main gate hotels should be walking distance not almost 2 miles away.
It was decent, nothing to crazy. Would have rather spent the little more money to get one that didn't feel so ghetto. Not that it was crazy ghetto though. Just not classy which is obvious.

The door for our room was slightly broken, you had to slam the door shut in order for the door to close and lock. The bath tubs inside the property were very very slippery. I slipped in the bathroom each night while I was staying here. I would recommend that the hotel staff should put non grip flooring for every bath tub. I also wish that the breakfast had more of a variety of choices to choose from. There were very few options for the complimentary breakfast.
While the hotel amenties are a bit older the value and location is great.  The beds were comfortable and the room was clean.  Super close to the transit to the parks.

The girl at the front desk appeared to be on something. She was talking about the rooms located on the back side of the hotel being in the twilight zone. She told us people have hallucinations when they stay back there in the first floor because of the wall. I was extremely shocked and frustrated with what she was saying and really did not feel comfortable having to stay here. The room was dirty, their were bugs and the beds were terrible to try to sleep on. If it wasn't so late and my boys weren't exhausted, I would have tried to find somewhere else to stay.

Summary Heading: St arrival door locked waited 25 minutes for staff
Summary: When i arrived door was locked waited 25 minutes for staff to open door Dakota was very rude. Delivery driver had to wait also . In room trash under chairs and behind night stand, coffee pot didn't work in room and refrigerator needed to be defrosted.  Ice machine didn't work either wouldn't stay again and didn't get any results when reported to staff. I think I should have gotten a discount for the 4 nights.

I first would like to say that the price and the location was the highlight of my stay at Days INN.  The staff, on the other hand was very unprofessional.   There was an incident in the room that I stayed in,  the picture that was ubove one of the bed fell on the top of my friends head.  I went down to the lobby to report the incident and all the front desk clerk said was that she wasn't surprised and if we had sage with us to cleanse the room from apparently spirits that might me haunting that hotel.  I was appalled at her response toeat had hhappen on that property on her shift.  She never filed a report or informed the other staff members about what happened.  For that reason,  me and my family and friends will no longer stay at that specific Days Inn.  It's a shame because

So terrible.. I complained since the night we arrived about the sink smelling like sewer and then it backing up in the tub.  It took 8 hours for the shower to drain after taking one, so we had to stagger our showers.  I DID complain every single day... They finally came in on my day 6 to fix it however there response was it was a bigger problem then we thought.  REALLY?????  So at 1030 at night i had to pack up 3 people one handicap and move rooms and all they would do is write off 1 night out of 8.  After living with the sewer smell for 6 days already.. Wyndham should be ashamed of this since there are a pretty popular and "fancy" chain.  Also the carpet was so dirty that you MUST wear slippers at ALL times!

Our stay started off rough. The women at the front desk was nice at first (for like 5 mins) and then got rude, condicending and weird. Our room had an outdated and broken air conditioner. The manager was great and moved us to another updated room. The women at the front acted as if we took something that belonged to her or was inconviencing her. She made sure to remind me that we got an upgrade. After moving to our new room we noticed the toilet wasn't flushing. I thought the chain had come loose from the plunger and tried to fix it but was unsuccessful. I told the gal on the way out and she began to tell me how I was fixing the toilet wrong and started to give directions on how to do it right. I told her well I've already stuck my hands in the toilet once today (she

Summary Heading: Not an enjoyable place to stay for a vacation
Summary: My family reserved multiple rooms for a family vacation of a one week stay at this hotel. The rooms were disgustingly dirty. The carpets were filthy. When getting out of the shower, if you walked on the carpets, the bottoms of your feet were instantly blackened. There were dirty finger prints all along the bathroom walls, something red splattered on the ceiling of the sleeping area and on the bathroom ceiling. Small children were roomed above us and literally ran and jumped on our ceiling all hours of the night. The front desk was notified multiple times. When attempting to contact the front desk multiple times throughout our stay, the doors were frequently locked with a "Back in 5 minutes" sign. The female attendant would come from the back office only when the doorbell was

First and last time here. The room was really outdated and aged. The carpet had traffic stains from the parking Lot (black) in the entrance. The a/c was outdated and filthy with dust and clogged filter. The bathroom looked like it was all turning yellow from age and overall had a humid smell in the room. I will gladly pay an extra $50-$100 to get a better hotel.
The location was the only good thing about this hotel. The floors were filthy, the bed was old and uncomfortable and the breakfast was almost non existent

The young lady working the front desk has a wonderful personality. The Breakfast are was kept stocked and clean. It's the room that was in poor condition. The Carpet was dirty black as is it was water damaged.The mini fridge sitting on the floor had the outside peeled away and rusted. Shower wall had someones hair on the wall.The Tub was chipped and worn out. The all along the floor are was all chipped away. Could have used trim to cover. BUT THERE WASN'T any BUGS. And walls are not so thin you hear the neighbors. Loved the Cable new TV. I've paid less for a better room. Glad they didn't spray the rooms with fragrance and incense.
I enjoyed my stay at the Days Inn.   It was convenient to everything I wanted to do, clean, and the staff were very helpful.

Summary Heading: Run-down Property with Extremly Dirty Carpets and Very Poor Quality breakfast.
Summary: Run-down Property with Extremely Dirty Carpets and Very Poor Quality breakfast.  We were extremely disappointed with every aspect of our stay - the conditions of this property were terrible.
The carpet was so dirty our feet were gross after a shower, the room smelled bad and the breakfast was limited and they often ran out before 9, no fruit no eggs or bread.

Summary Heading: Toilet would not flush...i had to fix it myself several...
Summary: Toilet would not flush...i had to fix it myself several times and it had been Jerry rigged by a previous guest. The bathtub would have eight inches of gross water by the end of the shower. They moved us and everything was pretty nice.

The location was great to take the bus to Disneyland.  We had to move rooms twice. The air conditioner wasn't working in the first room, then we had a draining in the tub issue in the second room and the main ceiling light was burned out and there was no fridge or microwave as stated online for the hotel before we made it to a room that had a tub surface that was peeling.    The floors have heavy soiled from traffic that blackened your feet or socks.   Another person in our group had to move rooms due to a broken shower also.  A few of our rooms had issues with the safe being locked or dead batteries.  The breakfast only had waffles, oatmeal, toast and cereal. No hot breakfast other than the waffles.

Summary Heading: Noisy Hotel, had to call a bunch, and they wouldn't let me check out early
Summary: I stayed there for a business conference on the first floor.  The group above me was very noisy, dancing , moving furniture and I began calling management at 11 pm, then 1 pm, then 4 pm to ask that the noise be addressed.  It wasn't and continued each night of my stay, after 3 nights I called at 2 am and said I would like to check out the next morning and be refunded my last day.  They would not let me, and in fact picked a fight with Expedia about it, and with me.  They did NOT offer me another room - they were fully booked, but promised they would ask the guests to be quiet, but that never worked.  Early in the morning there was a child down the way on the first floor that would bounce a tennis ball against the side of the hotel -- which made is so i couldn't sleep in after
Overall property was dingy and the room wasn't the cleanest, major stains on the floor and overall rundown.
Has the essentials for a place to stay. Friendly staff and easy walk to convention center. Right across from fun ice cream spot. Slow/poor wifi connection and minimal breakfast offerings.
Decent location but very underwhelming hotel. Room had stains all over floor and I was pretty nervous to sleep in the bed due to the lack of overall cleanliness.
The carpet in our room was disgusting. It was quite worn, appeared dirty, and was definitely in need of being replaced.

homeless person outside my room on 2nd level yelling profanities . drug deal also along with prostitute pimping in room next door and drug deal same time wow. and the pimp/ dealer also charged the person for the room and they got wyndham days inn to reimburse that fellow for bad room . wow the pimp made out with big money does the establishment knows this goes on could not leagve room for 4 to 5 hours because of what was going on outside of my room staying in

Room was extremely dirty and the shower constantly leaked.  Carpet by the bathroom was soaking wet and emitted a sour, mildew smell.  Doors and molding around the doors looked like they hadn't been cleaned for months; filthy.  Pool area was dirty, no towels were available, and the Jacuzzi was gross; it looked like a green lagoon.  When your first impression of the room is disgust, you question if the very sheets and bed spread you sleep on have even been cleaned; I won’t return.

This review is soley in regards to the actual facility not the staff. The staff was very helpful, friendly and kind. I was always greeted with a smile. The low rating is for the rooms and outside of the facility. Overall room was clean, some here and there misses but ok. The outside of the facility was very dirty and uninviting, parking with a large pick up truck was difficult, spaces are small.

Dirty dirty dirty. Our hockey team booked 17 rooms and every single person had to keep their shoes on cause your feet would turn black from the carpets In the room. Internet was terrible. Barely worked at all. The pool at Cut the kids feets  and the hot tub was brown! Gross!   Would not go back again! Hotel is very run down and needs a major revamp!

Hotel was about 5mins. to Disneyland. Staff provided great knowledge about surrounding places, things to do, etc. The room itself could have been much more cleaner. The bathroom was good, cleanliness wise. Had a bottom room, so we could hear all the noise and stomping from the people in the room above us (it was a family with kids).   Breakfast wise, there pretty much was slim pickings among what was offered (boiled eggs, toast, make-your-own-waffle, orange juice/apple juice, coffee, cereal & apples only). This may be a bit of an issue when you are someone like me who doesn't like waffles or hard boiled eggs and can't eat cereal/milk or apples. Ended up just having toast and orange juice. However, this hotel is right next to a Jack in the Box and just 3 mins. down the street

Can't believe this was part of Wyndham family. Bathtub did not drain in fact backed up dirty water. Burnt out lights, floors dirty. Pool was dirty hot tub was worse with brown water. Beds very uncomfortable.

I went on a Tuesday and checked out on Wednesday. I arrived two hours early and was not allowed to check in until it was exactly 3pm. That did bug me a little but I can also understand that the hotel has its policies it needs to follow.  My family and I stayed in the king size bedroom. It was a fairly small room with a big enough bathroom. It also came with a microwave, mini fridge, a/c and tv. It did only have two available sockets in the whole room which was pretty funny to me. Complimentary parking was given to us for staying the night. And was over by the time we had to check out. It was walking distance of about 1 mile to the Disney theme park. But my family and I just walked to the toy story parking lot and took the tram from their.  My over all stay I would say was fair.
The problem with the breakfast at this location was they didn't give you enough to choose from
Bad customer service . The rooms are dirty .specially the carpet . I did even want to take my shoes off.

Summary Heading: stay overnight at Days Inn Anaheim
Summary: the Inn was clean and acceptable for the price.  I was satisfied.  I would have preferred more help at the front desk on transportation to and from Disneyland.  I asked about it twice and the front desk said yes but did not have the details.  You need to go to the Hotel across the street, buy tickets $7.00 each for the shuttle and wait at that location. You can leave your car at the Inn.

The room smelt like cigarettes when we walked in. The bath tub was dirty and the water wouldn't go down while taking a shower. The floor was uneven. It felt like you were going to fall through. In spots you could feel the beams. This was the worst stay we've ever had.

The representative at the hotel was very rude in addition to the manager who was also unfriendly. I booked a king room and was given two queens I told them about the issue and the manager flipped out on me because I used booking.com she said the room I want costs ten dollars more. I could tell they were gossiping about me when I had a problem. I had already paid the room and they made me pay again. It was very frustrating they weren't nice at all!

Summary Heading: Good south a couple of issues
Summary: The rooms were adequate.  It was close enough to a disneyland shuttle stop. We had necessities.  The toilet seat was broken and it wasnt fixed after reporting it.  Also, breakfast was poor so we ate at   a near by jack in the box.  The staff was friendly and helpful when we needed extra blankets.  It was nice to stay near the park.

Summary Heading: Good Location, Comfortable for a couple nights
Summary: We stayed here two nights on a visit to Disneyland.  The beds and pillows were very comfortable and we had the best nights sleep so far on our holiday.  The room was clean and the location was perfect for Disney.  You could walk if you wanted or drive to nearby parking.  We booked two rooms and had a one year old travelling with us.  In both rooms the safe was locked so we couldn't access it immediately.  We actually had to change one of the rooms because the bathroom light didn't work at all but after this the stay was pleasant.  Don't expect much for breakfast, apples, two types of cereal and a waffle maker.
I get broken towels and charger 8$. I can't check out 6:50am because the girl didn't check the room everything is fine and I must've waited 20 minutes give back my deposit.
The only real issue I had with this visit is the email notifications were all in spanish. I speak English.

It was in a good location , very cheap but dirty when we got back from the Disney park there were crumbs on the bed , our air conditioner was turned off we asked for towels they literally made us give back the ones we had in the room before we could get new ones but there wasn't enough , we hung some wet clothes Outside to dry for a few minutes But one of the staff came to tell us to Remove it like as if there motel was nice , No the online reason why we actually slept was because of how tired we were from spending a whole day at the park ,  this motel is really the diffinition of "you get what you pay for " never again yes we just need a place to sleep but even the beds sucked
Location can not be beat! The room was clean. Front Desk SUPER HELPFUL. Hotel is older but well maintained! Pool was a lifesaver -- Seriously...  Will Stay here again!

Positives: hotel staff was friendly and as accommodating as they could be.  Parking was free  Negatives: Hotel room was dirty. The towed had lipstick on them from a previous guest. Sheets were dirty. Floor left our socks and feet black.  The curtains do a poor job of blocking out light  Not every room has a fridge.  Thankfully I called ahead and discovered this, as room was advertised with fridge.

Summary Heading: Worst hotel I've ever stayed in.
Summary: I booked two rooms for a long anticipated family trip that took us over a year to plan. Seeing the previous reviews online I thought surely this would be the right booking for us. Immidiately upon arriving, we noticed the carpet was so disgusting, we could literally run our fingers across it and they would be black. Just from being barefoot for 2 seconds our children's feet were black!! And the carpet was so sticky and nasty feeling we had to make sure we had shoes on for the entire duration of our stay. Which was 9 nights!!! My parents were thoroughly disgusted as their room was in the same condition so they asked to be moved into another room. And the room they were moved to was in the exact condition as the one they were moved from,Which was a ridiculous process that showed

Stayed here for a weekend and was very disappointed. While staying here I met two of the receptionist's who were both outside smoking and then rushed in to assist me. From that moment on I knew I'd made a mistake by booking a non-refundable room at this Hotel. My husband was already irritated and the receptionist added fuel to the fire by telling him to "chill out." She was friendly but very unprofessional. The snack bar consisted of only about 6 bags of chips, (which was not her fault but managements.) In the description of the room it stated the room would have a bath tub which was a big reason I booked that room and when I got there I was informed that there were no more rooms available with a bathtub except for a room with one more bed than I needed which also costed me an

Summary Heading: Ony if you're looking for a bed
Summary: Don't except anything a bed if staying here.  No place to hang anything.  Continental Breakfast was a joke, white bread and cereal (did have waffles if you could get to one of the makers) and the dining room held 4, yes 4 tables.  Paid $95.00 for our one night - shame on me! The only plus was the room was very clean and carpet seemed new.

Price Good.  Floor in room was so dirty our feet were black. Wondering if they hadn't vacuumed or if the carpet was bad and needed to be replaced.  Shower curtain rod was broken and unstable. Bed was good, and everything else was clean. Filter in A/C unit needed cleaning desperately.  Breakfast wasn't great. Only protein was hard boiled eggs swimming is goo.  We weren't there much so that was good. Hotel was quiet and good enough for a business trip.

Stayed there so we can attend Disneyland and a concert at house of blues, it's really close to it, used Uber for 6 bucks one way from hotel to venue. Staff was super friendly and helpful,  the room was ok, not the greatest but prices were fair not to expensive as the other ones around that area.

The front desk clerk was friendly and that's about it... the area if you have a family not a recommended place.  The room smelled even tho it was a non smoking room... towels yuck had hair still on it and not the kind that grows on your head.. the area not very nice parking near your rooms fills up quick then you have to park across near but the lot is also used by a mechanic shop and jack in the box.  I would definitely would not recommend and would not stay there again!!!
When I reported that my tub was clogged they immediately came to check out the problem them changed me to another room.  Had laughs about service animals and horses since I brought mine.

I did not like my stay at days in the room carpet was greezy and smelled like oil dirty blankets on bed I had to request for two and front desk attendant had issues with me getting two clean ones when I told them about the carpet he said the hotel was full and not able to accomidate me with something better the sink was sticky and no menu in room. very lousy room. bad experience I had hoped for it to be better for the amount I paid for the 2nights. was very disapointed

We were within walking distance of Anaheim Convention Centre, and the hotel was more affordable than others in the area, which was really great. The staff were very friendly and polite. The breakfast was often running out of food and didn't have much selection, you couldn't eat there if you were gluten / vegan. The internet was very slow and seemed to have network error one of our mornings there, saying there was a problem with the modem, this was unfortunate as we were trying to plan our day / plan our bus schedule, of which the front desk had no knowledge of / couldn't help us with.
Easy check in. Cleanliness of room average. Easy parking. Just wish lady would have told us where our room was out so we won't be wandering all over.

Summary Heading: Fair choice compare with the price you pay
Summary: My stay was ok. It's a good choice if you just need a place to sleep and take a bath like me. We had a non-smoking room with 2 queen beds.Good location with parking lot - you will have to register your vehicle with the staff. Room has fridge, microwave, ion table, hair dryer, coffee machine. Fresh towels and cleaning room everyday. Only has soap no body wash. Staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast complimentary is from 6 am to 9 am, food is just ok. We had noisy customers next door though. Overall, this is a cheap place so you can't ask for more.

Summary Heading: Not bad but not amazing either.
Summary: The room was clean, bed was comfy. The breakfast wasn't great but there are fast food joints super close.

I had booked this hotel through booking.com.  It was a pretty good price for the area.  The check-in was quick.  Our room was adequate.  The beds were comfortable with clean sheets.  There were plenty of clean towels. There were minimal toiletries provided.  But we always bring our own so that wasn't much of an issue.  It was two very long blocks to Disneyland.  It would be a bit of a walk if you didn't want to pay for parking since it's free at the hotel.  They provided a very nice breakfast which included a waffle bar, cereal, toast, coffee and juice.  If I were going to spend much time in the room, I'd pick another hotel.  But we were gone all day and only there to sleep.  The one negative thing I will say is the toilet seat was not clean.  It looked as if someone used the

On day 1 of our stay, sink clogged and was not draining. Reported the issue to front-desk who assured that it will be fixed next day. Next day when we returned in the evening, issue was not fixed. When I went to front-desk to report the issue, lady at the desk was very rude. Instead of apologizing or even acknowledging the issue, she threatened that she will throw me out of the place. Another guest standing by mediated and through his intervention, lady at reception gave me key for adjacent room so that we can use the sink of that room. Third day when we returned, issue was not still fixed and the same lady now told us that I have to return the keys for adjacent room. According to her that was a favor given to us totally disregarding the fact that it was their facility and

Fair prices for a fair room, which came with microwave and fridge (rare!) Parking is plenty, even though you may have to walk a little bit. Front desk were friendly and efficient, even with my 3AM check-in. Room was clean. You can't beat this location--minutes walk to Toy Story parking lot, save $20 parking per day! I usually don't care about this, but the mattress was wonderful for such a budget place!

I enjoyed my stay at Days Inn.  The room was clean.  The different staff were friendly.  There was ample parking and I was allowed to park past my check-out time until the convention I was attending was over about 5 hours later.  The only problem I had was that the refrigerator did not work when I checked in but it was fixed by the next morning.

When we got to our room we noticed that the fridge was leaking water and didn't work. We notified the front desk and the manager came over and brought some towels and offered to take some money off of each night for the inconvenience. That has not been done as of 4/6/17. Also when I made my reservations online through days inn website it confirmed a price of $231.66 and I was charged $234 without notice. I stay at the days inn and have not had problems like this. I feel like i am getting the runaround.

Summary Heading: From day 1 Plumbing in sink was back up for 3 day's in my...
Summary: From day 1 Plumbing in sink was back up for 3 day's in my room asked many times to have it fixed or to get a different room. They would do nothing tell I call there headquarters and also told them I would call the health department. After that the manager got mad and was going call the police and kick my kids and wife out. After letting him think about it for awhile he put us in room and the air-conditioned room that did not work

Summary Heading: Great if you need a bed and a shower
Summary: The guy that worked up front in the lobby wasn't very helpful. We got there around 2:30pm and it seemed to us that he wasn't sure what to say. So we just said we will come back later on that night after going to Disney. We got back to the hotel around 11pm to check in again and the lady just started her shift and she was very welcoming and gave us tons of information about the the hotel and where everything is and what time is check out and breakfast. The room was meh. It is in need of paint really bad. Location to the Disney parks was nice and the price was great for a bed to sleep in. The breakfast room was tiny. We put down money for a deposit and the next morning the guy was there again and he said someone has to go check the room out before giving us the deposit back and we

Summary Heading: Great price, great location, bad bugs...
Summary: This was the cheapest stay and closest location to Disneylands, so the price was unbeatable.  Would have been 5 stars except for the two cockroaches I saw the 2nd and 3rd nights stay.  I chose not to report it at the time because I didn't want the hassle and inconvenience to move to another room with the same issue.

Recently had a five night stay here and really enjoyed it. It's the perfect location for Disney, about a 25 minute walk and the hotel offered free parking.   The hotel was clean and the staff were really friendly and helpful as I had an issue with the car I rented and they let me use the hotel phone and nothing seemed too much trouble.   The safe in the room was not working but the hotel let me use theirs at no cost, which again was done with no issues.  The breakfast was basic and the breakfast room is quite small and it offers toast, waffles and cereal along with coffee and juice but there's enough there and there is extra seating outside.   Not a criticism on the hotel at all but if you want luxury then you would be better going elsewhere but certainly for what we paid, it
Hotel charged me twice and I got fees from bank that they wouldn't clear up and hotel refuses to pay for their mistake Manager never returns calls very poor customer service

Old room furnishings and what was there was not kept up. Grout in bathroom was discolored. Picture was missing from wall and all hardware was left in wall. Carpets were dirty  housekeeping didn't speak English

It is 10-15 min. walking distance to the shuttle bus so you can save parking fee of $20 per day if you want.  Compare to the price of other hotels that are closer to the entrance, this one is a good deal.  The breakfast is from 6:00am so good to plan Magic Morning entrance.  Room layout is also easy to use.  Good price value.  Internet was a bit slow--probably due to the high volumn of usage in certain time.

The front desk people are very rude. They use bait and switch to get you to stay there. On their website they say rooms have mini refrig. and microwave. But when I arrive was told not all rooms have and since I had queen bed my room did have one. Also the heater in my room didn't work. But they said they were sold out and couldn't move me...Next day I spent a little extra and move across the street to embassy suites for only $25.00 a night...don't waste your money on this old run down hotel with very rude staff.

The staff is really nice but they do not have the resources to keep the place up to what they promise.  For example, they advertise that they have a desk in the room for computer work, but no empty AC outlets to plug in your devices.  Computer, ipad, phone etc.  The one plug by the desk had both the desklamp and the refrigerator plugged into it.  I asked for an extension cord and they did not have one.  (same problem as last year.)  Fortunately I remembered to  bring my own extension cord.  Also, the desk lamp bulb was not working.  I had to ask 4 times to get a replacement that I received on the 3rd day.  The wi-fi would stall off and on and since this was a business trip I needed it.  Therefore I needed to use my own Hot Spot on my phone which caused me to add more bandwidth
terrible, incredible if the door don't close right the room still assigned to by rented! and you make a report and then just tell you how to pull up and close no problem.

Needed something quick just for a short stay, a little pricey for the looks of the hotel. The room keys deactivate way to easy and it was a hassle going to re key it. Breakfast wasn't great but overall things were good.

The staff were great the night gal was so sweet she made my check in fast and easy and she even fixed the remote to the TV, The bed was the greatest my girls wanted to take them with us so comfortable. The downside was that the neighbors upstairs just wanted to run and jump all night long and I could not sleep. The other issue was the tub would not drain it took it  20 mins in between showers but overall everything was great they made sure I was comfortable and even told me where I could walk my service dog great people at night. Breakfast could be alot better room was hot and not alot to choose from but not bad.
Hospitable staff.  Quiet and comfortable environment.  Walking distance from anything you may want or need.  Booked room for three days, ended up staying for five.
It was great only had my paper is because my hard copy fell in the ocean and was able to still get my room. Very accommodating

We are nearing the end of a 6 week trip around the US and Canada and this place was by far the worst place we have stayed. Believe all of the other negative reviews you read. The place is a dive. We walked into our room and were confronted with a rank, damp smell in the room. The carpet was putrid and black (probably the cause for the smell). We wore our shoes at all times. The shower drain backed up every time we use it leaving our feet ankle deep in water. The pool and spa looked disgusting so we never used it. You could hear every foot step and word from upstairs and in our case, it was a family with kids running around until midnight every night. Garbage trucks came every morning to clean out the fast food restaurant trash which is only a few metres away. The sound was loud

Summary Heading: Days Inn Anaheim - reasonable cost, good location
Summary: Days Inn Anaheim is a reasonable cost hotel, clean rooms, in a good location for access to tourist venues.
There was a bad smell in the room when we arrived. Maybe because of the broadloom. Otherwise ok.

Summary Heading: Days Inn Anaheim Near Convention Center
Summary: It was clean and reasonably priced. Upstairs neighbor was a little bit noisy. Should have taken the upstairs rooms.

All staff were very friendly and helpful.  Especially the person who checked us in on the first day.  The breakfast was satisfactory in comparison to other locations.  The space was a bit limited in that area.  Overall it was a good stay.

Summary Heading: After years of excellent ratings, this year a complete failure.  We will not be staying there next year during Congress.
Summary: At check in: phone did not work; bathtub did not drain.  Every day we needed to go back to activate our key.  Breakfast was poorly presented; only 12 eggs for a 'full house' of guests.  Something missing every day when we returned:  facecloths; coffee; paper coffee cups and so on and so on.
This hotel may not be the fanciest but it sure does it for a great place to stay and sleep in. Very good area to stay around and hotel services were great!

Summary Heading: Not super nice, but not super bad.
Summary: It is about 2 miles away from Disneyland. We walked the two miles there when we would go to the park, and it wasn't that bad. They do not offer shuttle services, so that was a little disappointing. The room was pretty clean and well maintained besides the bathroom. The bath tub does not plug, it is constantly draining out water. The room includes a fridge, microwave, and TV so those were very convenient for us. The pool is not very well maintained and was pretty gross, so we did stay away from there. They offer a light breakfast, but nothing special. The staff were pretty rude. We were on the bottom floor and could hear every single movement of the people above us, which was extremely obnoxious--especially in the middle of the night when you are trying to sleep. One thing I

This motel was a fair stay for the price. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I took away two stars because it seemed that there were some shady activities going on that made me feel uneasy (unfortunately that comes with a low price). One day, I had a man watch me walk to my room from retrieving some towels; he knocked on my door (I was thinking it was room service), I answered and he basically asked me if I was a prostitute. I was appalled and mortified and felt unsafe with my sisters and baby boy. My husband and I complained and they were very accommodating and apologetic. Since we were not able to find another room on a Saturday night, they moved us right next to the lobby and did some investigating which made us feel more at ease.

Simple, older hotel, nothing fancy but served our purpose being there at the Lego World War Brick event that was directly across the street for half the cost and we had a free breakfast and easy free parking and the shower was great pressure. We used the in room fridge. Need way more electrical sockets though LOL. Desk personnel and house keepers were friendly.

There was blood on the bathroom walls, the tub's drain leaked (in both rooms), the drain wouldn't drain in the sink - and when we asked for that to be fixed with some draino, they kept stalling.  2 days they stalled!  Then they moved us to another room so they wouldn't have to fix things.  They were rude during this whole process!!!  Will NEVER stay there again.  I know you get what you pay for, but even then... BLOOD ON THE WALLS.  Really?!  Avoid this place like the plague.

The location was a bit tricky because there was no bus to Disneyland right outside and we were told there was. On top of that when the shower above us was on the dirty water would come through our sink. And if used to much it would flood the sink and flow on to the floor. I was disgusted.
The only problem I seen is there was no easy way to get to the rooms to the back if u have luggage your not a happy camper carrying them all the way to ur room

This was so much more in my budget for a conference within walking distance. Got a good rate, clean room and helpful staff.  The TV was not working very good but I had it on so few times and when I did was so tired that I did not bother to ask if it could be fixed or what I might be doing wrong.

This hotel is located close to the park (not walking distance) so that's nice. They do offer a nice breakfast. The carpet is filthy and has an odd odor, no drain plug in the tub so if you have small children you can not give them a bath, also having no drain plug leads to bugs coming up from the drain like the huge roach that was crawling around our bath room one morning. The furniture is very dated and some pieces are also damaged.
Horrible hotel, carpet was filthy, drain in the shower was clogged and the beds covers looked old and dingy!

My room was immaculate, clean all around. perhaps recently redone/upgraded but the only thing missing was a shower curtain liner which i did not notice after my first shower but was rectified by housekeeping afterwards.  If you have a ton of luggage or equipment there is NO elevator at this location so a good idea is to get a room on the ground level.  My stay was quiet, private and no noise from the street or from neighbors. I would stay here again.

Once entered room, could smell smelly carpet; breakfast decent-free; value good for that day of week; customer service just needs to be clear or on same page,as to which door to enter for breakfast; got two different set of instructions. Pull the carpet up and replace with linoleum; yes!! I would stay again for the value an free breakfast

Summary Heading: Problem with accepting my Wyndham memership
Summary: Gave me a room in the back and all open rooms in front with no occupancy. Had to get soaked in the rain to bring my things in.

I checked in & mistakenly chose a smoking room. Checked into room really late, around past 10 PM & was assigned a smoking room. Called the front desk to verify room type & all, wondered if I can change into a Non-smoking room instead. Staff immediately said no. Requested for 2 extra pillows & blankets, was only given 1 of each saying that, that's all we have. Will not book & stay here ever. Will take my business some place else.
Your avaerage Days Inn, but the extra of microwave and fridge are excellent. Breakfast not so great, and wifi didn't work so well, but good value for the cost.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Breakfast left something to be desired. They have waffle makers, fruit loops, Frosted Flakes, toast and oranges or apples. They didn't provide conditioner or lotion and they didn't have any available at desk in lobby. Carpets were nasty!  In need of updating and repair. Tub had moldy looking stains all around. We were not in the room much and it surved its purpose. In the plus side, the staff were very friendly and that goes a long way in my book.

Summary Heading: Floors were saturated and slightly sticky. Large dark...
Summary: Floors were saturated and slightly sticky. Large dark mystery stain on seat of one of the chairs. Big black skid marks on bathroom floor. Remote control did not work.

Summary Heading: You Receive That For Which You Pay
Summary: This is a motel that is long in the tooth.  It has a fantastic location and was less than half the price of other hotels in the same area.  It was an easy 15min walk to Disney and I appreciated the good parking.  I had limited contact with the staff, but they were super cheerful in those interactions (well, except for the off-going desk clerk who interrupted my check-in to gab with the on-duty clerk who was trying to check me in).  The towels and sheets were clean and of reasonable quality.  The rooms are long overdue for a renovation.  The carpet was so dark that it sucked the light out of the room and it was impossible to tell if it was clean.  The latest paint job was not well masked and there was overspray on the carpet and tile.  The mattress was "well-used" and marginally

Make sure if single woman to ask to be upstairs or inside corridor room or closer to the office, not last room in back.  I was nearly attacked and it was shocking to had to walk to my room in the back.  Check your check in to see if single and accommodate for their safety.

Summary Heading: Great price for a place to sleep
Summary: This hotel is reasonably close to Disneyland, was a great price, ad the free breakfast was nice.  The first night we were there three cars were broken into, so another lesson on not leaving things in your car.  The beds were fine, the bathroom was moldy and had a clogged bathtub.  Overall the low price worked great for us so we would probably return to this hotel if it is the lowest price again for our next trip.

We booked this for our stay at Disneyland when everything else was booked or too exorbitant in price.  It's a little over a mile to the park entrance.  The walk was completely safe and fine, large wide sidewalks.  We ended up taking a cab the remainder of the time (there is a passenger drop off and taxis waiting at Disneyland entrance).  Each time it was $10 give or take.  Really made a huge difference after walking all day in the park.  Given the savings on this (even adding in cab fares) I'd say this is my new favorite for the park.
Pleasant stay at this Days Inn. Melissa, manager, is very helpful. Moved us to another room when the air con in first room did not work properly
I don't give it a excellent because the internet always lag out or just disconnect from my device but otherwise it a good place.

Summary Heading: Poor experience staying at Days Inn.
Summary: Starting From very dirty carpet, unhelpful staff, poor breakfast choice, the over all experience was poor.
Very good service was good and there is a Italian ice cream shop across the street it's really good the breakfast was ok but u get what u pay for

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for.
Summary: I was a little disappointed. I knew I wasn't getting a nice hotel because of the brand name and price, and the location wasn't too terrible if you're trying to stay on a budget. It was nice that there was a fridge and microwave, but they don't supply soap, shampoo, conditioner, creamer or stir sticks. Staff was friendly. Cleanliness wasn't too gross, mostly just some stains which I expected.

I was surprised when I read the not so good reviews...our stay was pleasent...Andrew greeted us and took care of us..Evan allowed us to check in early...the room was clean and the bed was so comfortable. I forgot where I was the next morning...

Quick trip to Disney/ So Cal.  We were looking for a place that was way under budget.  Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable.  Carpet definitely needs to be cleaned, better yet changed, we kept our slipper/shoes the whole time.   Bathroom was clean, but the shower head was not up to par.  The room was fine.  The free breakfast, waffles & cereal was a hit with the kids.   A fine place for someone planning a trip that is on a budget.

Was happy with my stay at the Days Inn. Lots of places to eat and the Target just down the road was ideal too. Beds were comfortable, linen was clean. Pillows were quite lumpy but I managed to sleep well. The lighting in the rooms was kind of average, there was no main ceiling light, just lamps/wall lights scattered all around the room. The vanity area did have good lighting though, so the lack of main light was tolerable.
My only complaint would be that breakfast is too carby. Maybe offer yogurt or peanut butter (for the toast). Or boiled eggs. Otherwise great!

Room is very clean but could not find the charging point in the room.Cleanliness wise good. Very near to Disneyland and there is no shuttle from hotel. Overall you can stay . Continental break fast is also good.You get waffles,apple,orange,cookies,water,coffee,etc.

We booked 2 nights. The first night was ok, but the second was horrible because we couldn't sleep. We stayed on the first floor and the people on the second floor above us kept walking back and forth until we checked out. Every time they walked, we could hear them.  It seemed like they didn't sleep at all. We called the front desk and it didn't help.  In conclusion, the hotel is old.

Summary Heading: This hotel was not very clean and the beds are not...
Summary: This hotel was not very clean and the beds are not comfortable at all. It was like sleeping on the coils. The carpet was so soiled we were afraid to walk around without our shoes.  The shower head was really low and the drain clogged. I would not recommend this place to anyone regardless of price
We had a business conference to attend. We chose to stay just a few blocks away from the conference center. It worked out perfectly

Our family enjoyed relaxing in our room, and hanging out by the pool. We loved the fact the pool was open until 11:00 P.M. giving us plenty of time to enjoy Disneyland, and get back to enjoy the hot tube!
Light tan clean socks blackened walking across the room. The carpet was horrifyingly dirty. But the beds were clean and the rest of the room was good
The room was ok. Location was very close to Disney. $2 shuttle bus to there. Breakfast was less than appealing.

In town for business for a night and chose Days Inn for proximity and cost. Was pleasantly surprised with cleanliness, comfort, and courtesy. In my recent travels, I have spent a lot more for much much less. Very happy and very satisfied with the Days Inn Anaheim Convention.  I would recommend it to all and will not consider other hotels if staying in the area again.

I was told that the distance to Disneyland was only .5 miles when it was almost 1.5 miles. I had to pay for parking at the resort which added significantly to the overall cost of the trip. The room was dirty and the breakfast was ridiculously pathetic. I will never stay here again.

The floors in this hotel are disgusting, we couldn't even walk on the floor without our feet turning black. Then after we leave they charged me for a damaged comfortor that had a pen mark on it when we arrived to the room. Wouldn't recommend staying here.

This Hotel is a decent hotel for the price. It's close to Disneyland. The room was clean, except the carpet was dirty. But, this is a good hotel to stay for the night if your looking for cheap and close to Disneyland.

This hotel has some pretty mixed reviews, so I was a little hesitant to book. But I figured we would give it a try, and we were pleasantly surprised! The room was nice and very clean. It had a microwave and fridge, which is always a plus. Everything was in good working order. The only somewhat con I can think of is the limited breakfast, and the small breakfast room. There were waffles, which was nice, but they had a long line always. Other than the waffles, you could make toast, cold cereal, or they had apples and oranges. To drink, there was juice or coffee. Some breakfast is better than none, and was appreciated, but that is one of the more limited breakfasts I have seen. We still had a good stay though, and would stay there again!

I stayed here for 4 nights and the location is great. Everything is walking distance. The customer service is superb although their check-in is strictly 3pm or 15 min. before 3pm. I did not have any problems.

Summary Heading: it was a good place with a new updated room ...mostly
Summary: I booked some time ago and got a super rate for this place , this is the third time we stayed there in 4 years. we got a nice room with new bed( it was a bit hard) got a foam topper from Costco for our 12 day stay. Well worth it.... no problems with anything ...no bathtub in this room but large shower, yes some fixtures could be updated but all together it was a very nice room.  just like all places that have parking outside the door it gets noisy in the morning. you get what you pay for yes its true, its a simple and clean place..the pool was under renovation so that was to obnly drawl back but the have a sister motel only across the street if you really need to use a pool.
Everyone was very nice and everyone that worked in the hotel were so friendly and very nice.. The room was always clean and it was great to stay there..

Summary Heading: Poor customer service and manager is never available
Summary: The location and room were nice enough, basically what you would expect for the price.  Good location, mostly clean, breakfast was fine, but a little confusing and chaotic. However, I had an issue with trying to cancel my first night, and was never able to speak to the manager to try to resolve it.  However, in the meantime, while trying to reach a manager, I was insulted by several staff members.  Some staff members were very helpful, some were not at all friendly, looked at you as if you were bothering them, and even rude and insulting.  I am still trying to reach the manager to discuss my concerns.
Excellent price. Breakfast was good just needed eggs or some kind of meat and it would be amazing.

You can't beat the location to the Disney Parks! Lots of stores and restaurants around too. Room is spacious, has free WiFi and breakfast is Free. Very few options in the kitchen, but woman working that area was really helpful and friendly. Would have given a better rating, but we noticed that the rug in the room was filthy. We had all kicked off our socks and shoes and discovered our feet turned black from walking barefoot on the rug. If you just plan to stay the night, this can be an okay option, but to stay for a few days, I would stay elsewhere.

Summary Heading: good service during our stay the staff Maribel and her...
Summary: good service during our stay the staff Maribel and her sister in law were very helpful not only to us but with the other guest too every breakfast

Room was comfortable and clean.  Staff was courteous and helpful.  Room are dated and dark.  Complementary breakfast was adequate and convenient.  Over all value for the price is great and easy to access rooms.

The location was great and so was the staff- and the room was as clean as it could have been, but the property needs updating. I have terrible allergies and the carpets are beyond filthy and old, the shower did not drain properly.. but you get what you pay for, if it weren't for my allergies and the tub- I would stay there again.
It's close by to Disney but not expensive. It's nearby other restaurants and a target if you need anything. Staff is friendly and the place is clean.
Comfortable and clean rooms. good beds for sleeping. 20 minute walk to Convention Center. Good restaurants nearby.

The hotel had stains on the carpet and had a musty overall feel. There was also no breakfast served. If you are looking for a family vacation, it's better to spend 50$ more on a hotel that doesn't have random disgusting stains everywhere.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here. First and last time
Summary: Book this hotel last min Disneyland trip booked at 10pm and Got there 5am they already did no show and charged my card saying I didn't check in at 3pm!! Um I booked it after 3pm?? Just needed to check in at 5am cause I have two toddlers and can't wait till 3pm to check in when we arrived at 5am! Have an annual pass for over 2 years never had that happen but my regular hotels across Disney were all booked since we just came up spontaneously. Then they gave us a room it smelled and curtains were burnt, chair was stained, ironing board was stained and the fridge was an outdated plaid fridge that smelt funny. I was horrified but my mom told me try to stick it out for one night. Breakfast was ok just cereal and waffles but jack n the box is right next door. And wanted to use iPad had

We had a bad experience on our first night as the sheets were dirty. Obviously one expects the sheets to be changed when someone checks out. But that wasn't the case. Next morning we requested clean sheets. It was changed immediately. Overall stay was good. We had no other issues. Reception staff were nice and friendly and even helped us book a shuttle to LAX.
It's an ok property. Very basic. Decent bed. Room was clean. Just needed a place to sleep for the night.   Light coming through under door.

One night I woke up with a spider crawling on my arm. There wasn't enough parking if you came back late from theme parks. The carpet turned my white socks black. The check in and check out process was way too long with clueless people both times. The mini fridge froze all of our drinks no matter how low we turned it. The AC made the room stuffy and was loud.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, lower your expectations
Summary: Cons: High speed internet constantly dropped out. Carpet turned my feet black after a minute (wear socks/shoes all the time!), on site laundry wasn't advertised.  Pros: Bed was very comfortable. Air conditioning was a blessing, Fridge cooled things very quickly. Shuttle to Disneyland & around Anaheim right outside hotel.

The room was what we paid for... cheap.. the pool was dirty... got past swimmers hair clump stuck to my arm... the pool was not chlorinated. Or if it was it was weakly done. Weird rash came to my ankles and feet after sticking them in the jacoozie. (Sp?) Seemed to be under construction. There was not a line when we were there and people started showing up at 8am so I don't see how the food was gone other than white toast cereal or make my own waffles. Next year we will

We were hoping to grab a muffin and head to Disney... that was not an option. We had to cook our breakfast. The pool was not clean at all and did not even have a hint of chlorine which was scary to us... I had to get out due to other peoples hair stuck on me in clumps. They do have a bus out front that will take you right to Disney entrance which was great. However get your passes from the bus if you're doing more than one day at Disney. Summary: blood stain on the sheet and replacement was brought to our room around mid night.  Very poor continental breakfast (the worst coffee ever)
This location was only ok. The top lock on the room door was missing. All night there was banging metal sounds and the alarm clock made noise despite being off. The staff brushed it off.

Cockroaches!!!! Worst hotel and experience ever!!! The hotel is filthy, Cockroaches in rooms.  When we tried to talk to management he wouldn't talk to us.  We called and had Expedia reimburse us and manager made me wake up my kids and leave within 20 minutes STAY AWAY! Funny how then he would 'talk' to us.

Summary Heading: Poor hotel with smelly room and dirty carpet
Summary: Poor hotel with smelly room and dirty carpet.   The room has an old smell of leftover cigarette and garbage.  Carpet is dirty.  Bathroom is dated, could use some updating and refreshing.

Recently stayed at Days Inn in Anaheim, CA, we were very disappointed do not know what to mention first.  The floor... The carpet was so dirty it stunk, always felt damp, could NEVER walk barefoot would turn your feet black - couldn't even have socks! Trimming around door was coming off & door was very hard to close tight. The toilet leaked at bottom which made floor constantly wet. Very minimal continental breakfast. Microwave was old, missing tray that spins. Mattress is very thin & uncomfortable. Had problems staying connected to Internet constantly.  Plan to visit Disneyland again but I will NOT be staying at this place!!!

Hotel was mediocre, breakfast was mediocre, staff were mediocre. They did exactly as they said they would and not an ounce more. It's a fine place to stay if you get a decent price. Free wifi, free parking, free breakfast (that always seems to be mostly gone), and 2 blocks from disneyland.
The carpet floors were wet and the room smelled of mold. The wrong credit card was used at check in;was told it was a system error. The police were there one night which was not comforting.
