Think twice,  not clean. Not enough towels. Floors dirty, pool junk in bottom, spa green water.

We had booked 3 nights. Slow check in. Room was clean,  we were given 2 double beds but had booked a King,  we did change rooms the next day but the girl at reception was not happy. Show me your booking! Not the way to treat or speak to your guests. Lots of traffic noise and cars screeching during the night. This place must have around 64 rooms all doubles or more; however the breakfast while good, the actual breakfast area has only 4 tables for 16 people and an outside table with a few chairs, many morning smokers outside the breakfast room which was terribly. The laundry consists of 1 washing machine and 2
Hotel was clean for the most part. Smelt like they just did the carpets but also felt that way. Carpets were still wet when we walked in.  Beds were comfy. Air was ok but not great.
Well expedia said the hotel was pet friendly nd when i checked in they said they were no longer pet friendly
Our stay was good. Requested for 2 extra pillows...none were available. Lights in the room could be more brighter. Overall...our stay was just good.

Summary Heading: They lost a customer and hopefully this helps them lose more.

This is a valid reason in their contract. However, when I tried to have them use my credit card (which I have done before) they refused to take it... OK, fine, then refund my money so I could get him a different room? NO! They absolutely would not! The manager put me on a very long hold and then eventually had the front desk girl call back and let me know that they will not be giving me my money back, since I didn't cancel within 24hrs. location of this facility is good, walking distance to Disneyland. room is a little dated and has some sort of moldy smell. breakfast area is tight and can get crowded; food quality is a little below average.  will I stay again? probably no.

Let's get this out of the way: There are no bells or whistles on this hotel.  It's clean, it's basic, it's cheap.  Rooms are spacious enough, but don't expect an kind of luxury (you'll feel like in a motel room, actually).  Breakfast is pretty basic and even though the tiny room opens at 6 or 6.30, the lady that refills things only gets there at 7 (or at least that's what the guy from the front desk told me when I asked him to refill the waffle mix).  It's cheap for what it offers.   Where it excels is precisely that: It's cheap, but the location is great.  If you're visiting Disneyland, you'll be hard-pressed to find a better deal. I left an item behind accidentally. When I called to see if it was still there, the desk clerk, Adam, went out of his way to find it so I could retrieve it. Great customer service all during the stay. Breakfast included waffles, cereal, and good comfort foods. Good location close to Disneyland.  We had a handicap room with roll in shower which was great since my husband is in a wheelchair.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for.
Summary: The room was not exactly clean. My daughter was wearing new white socks and they were black from walking in the room, carpet was dirty. There was a menu on the counter that was left sticky. It was close to Disneyland, so it was a place to sleep. Free breakfast, just cereal, apples, toast & waffles. More variety would be nice. Expected a little nicer as we have stayed at other Days Inn in the past...

Summary Heading: furious! about $100 replacement charge for "stinky" pillows after checking out!!
Summary: after getting 3 different stories about an extra $100 charge to my credit card I was told brand new pillows in my room where filthy then stinky & had to all be replaced so they charged my account. After explaining I had brought my own pillows & 2 previous stays with no extra charges I was told they pillows were brand new & had to be replaced. I disagreed because I had to wait to check in while all rooms needed cleaning. How could pillows be brand new then? Disputing this issue with my bank & credit card company & will never stay here again.
Room clean, counter person seemed annoyed we were asking questions. Pool area and balcony being cleaned and painted. Would have liked to known has it affected parking.

I personally liked my stay here , nice quiet very calm! rooms were clean bathroom as well alway had fresh new towels every morning we would get up for breakfast witch was 6-9 am perfect times . They good out good variety of food to choose from! It was a good price for a hotel knowing you won't be really in the hotel. So many stores around !!! If your thinking of booking here youll love it !
Hotels was ok for the price. Breakfast was good. Linen clean and beds comfortable. It's good to stay at if you are off to Disney and on a budget. Pool area is ok

On a recent trip I took to CA in which I had a long layover waiting on freight I stayed 6 days at this Days Inn. The location was perfect and they let me park my straight truck in their lot with no additional charges. The room was nice though the mattress was not great but soon to be replaced from what I was told by Reuben the GM. The staff was courteous and efficient. A nice experience overall.

I was not happy to learn that the pool and laundry facilities were being closed due to renos...I was not given any prior notice to the day before it happened.  One of the reasons I chose the hotel was for the pool...very disappointing!

The room stukn, dirty carpets, dirty bed linen, requested upstairs king non smoking room got downstairs handicap room shower leaked everywhere, had to request clean linens the night I checked in due to mine were very dirty. Yuck! Breakfast was a joke!. Apples looked like someone used them for baseball practice. Waffle maker needed spray to keep waffles from sticking couldn't find any. I was told I wouldn't have to have money for incidentals that was a lie. I got charged 50.00 for that . Laundry room was a joke. Washer dryer outside up against a wall by the outdoor pool. Tried to get a refund and the GM said no. This is a very very dirty place .  DON'T STAY HERE VERY VERY DISGUSTING! !!!!!!!

If you need a convenient place to sleep, this is a great value. The property needs to be updated a little but it's very close to Disneyland, basically walking distance, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is very basic but there are lots of great restaurants right around the hotel.

We stayed here on our latest trip to Disneyland.  Based on prior reviews I was a little concerned but was pleasantly surprised.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  The location is miles from Disneyland and not walking distance but we bought a 3 day pass for the ART which has a stop directly in front of the hotel which was easy and convenient.  Typical continental breakfast of cereal, toast, waffles and apples - no other fruit which would have been nice.  My only 2 complaints are how they didn't handle service issues that arose, the front desk just pushed it on someone else and never followed up at all.  1st issue was I attempted to purchase a soda from one of their on site soda machines and it took my money without giving me a soda.  When I alerted the front desk I was told

My family and I reserved 2 rooms for our Disneyland week.. However these rooms were terrible. Third the towels all felt like sand paper. Fourth the tv remote didn't work . They also overcharged our bank card and then never said anything until I realized they then told us the money could not be refunded until the next day..This was not a great start to our Magical Disney week!! And after walking for hours through the Disney park the last thing we want to do is lay on a bed of rocks!!

The room was not very clean. There was a huge stain on the carpet when you walk through the door. Also, the walls are so thin the people in the next room sound like they were in the room with us. They double charged my credit card. Please check your statement carefully especially if you hold the room with one credit card then use a different credit card when you actually pay for your room. The good thing about Days Inn Maingate is fairly close to Disneyland. There is a shuttle right in front that will take you to Disneyland for a small fee. The shuttle does get crowded.
Don't like the breakfast or the parking. Good location for Disneyland, lots of resturaunt nearby, target was nearby. Shuttle for Disneyland was just steps from the hotel.

Summary Heading: Staff is very friendly rooms are clean my only...
Summary: Staff is very friendly rooms are clean my only dissapointment was that the day before we left our room did not get serviced
The hotel was close enough to walk to Disneyland. It was a good experience overall.  Thank you!

Summary Heading: cheap,clean convenient stay for Disneyland on a budget!
Summary: My stay overall  was a nice, clean comfortable  stay. I checked in late evening and the front desk clerk the first night wasn't  very friendly  and couldn't  answer any questions  I had about the Disneyland  transportation.  The second  day the clerk was very friendly  and upgraded my room and answered all my questions I had the first night.

Summary Heading: Sketchy People as Guests but great employees!
Summary: We noticed the guests that stayed there we very sketchy. You could tell many of them were on drugs, so it made us feel uncomfortable. However the employees at the front desk were great! Super nice willing to help us, great experience with them.

Summary Heading: Nothing was needed.  Great room size, privacy, not too loud...
Summary: Nothing was needed.  Great room size, privacy, not too loud with neighbors.  The biggest thing for me at hotels is feeling safe, and that never once was in question.  Very helpful staff.

Summary Heading: It was ok, worth the price
Summary: We were in LA for a disney vacation, we stayed one week. Let's see- The rooms seemed old and out-dated; the towels were paper thin; the door to the adjoined room made it possible to hear the neighbors; the 6-9 breakfast was ridiculous, you basically had to get there before 7 to get any kind of protein which was a cheese omelet. If you didn't get there in the first hour you are stuck with 2 brands of cereal or waffles, and sometimes you had to ask for the waffle batter to be refilled and the lady attending the breakfast area was less than polite. Overall, it was a place to lay our heads at night because we were barely in the room. Although there was always something unpleasant about the stay for the times that we were in our rooms. The pool was also very cold and dirty. And it is
My only complaint was that the entrance way carpet was very, very dirty. The carpet color is brown but because of how dirty the is carpet now it is dark brown, gross.

We take overniters to Disneyland about once a month. I always try to find a nice inexpensive hotel in which to stay, and this one did not disappoint. We basically just need a bed to sleep in, no other amenities are necessary (we try to be low maintenance.) Close enough to the Toy Story parking lot, and far enough away from the kingdom to avoid resort fees. This place was clean, and had good TV, which is pretty much what I like.  Not a 5 star hotel, but in a good area, lots of nearby choices to eat, if that's what you need, and covers all the basics. Will stay again, if it's the cheapest available when I book.  (BTW-Wyndham Rewards is the best way to go. Has the best rewards program! Only hotels I look for now!)  Internet, WiFi was iffy on my device, but that may have been my

The ironing board was broken. The safe wasn't working. The coffee pot in the room was dirty. The breakfast area was too small and there was too long of a line for all the food so we were unable to eat our breakfast at the hotel both of days we were at hotel. The breakfast area was out of coffee and the employee said it would be a 20.minute wait l. The hallways smelled of cigarette smoke. The air conditioner was too loud. We woke up every time it came on.

This Days Inn was a great choice. location from fast foods, a Target near by, incase you've forgotten anything you need when you were rushed to pack. shuttle stop near the curb for those going to Disneyland. the pool area was good, very cold water due to that the pool is located in the middle of the hotel so it gets nearly any sunlight. the hot tub area was green, yup I said green I didn't take a chance at it. the room was a great size, bathroom shower area was good with minor damage near the corners, the housekeeping service was great, kept the room clean and organized. thank you. all in all it was a great place to stay. we will definitely stay again.

The carpets in the rooms either need to be replaced or cleaned. When you walk barefooted and step into the shower, you leave black footprints in the tub!  The continental breakfast was not replenished and ther are families with kids staying here.  Problems with internet connection for over 12 hours

Great location, in walking distance of Garden Walk and Disneyland. Guest service was great. Rooms were very clean. Breakfast was awesome. The Internet was fast. The only complaints I would have are: the pool wasn't open, (we stayed in February), the bathrooms were a little dated, and the walls were very thin. We were woken up every night by the people above us. But for our purposes it was fine. If you want clean, friendly, and within walking distance of Disneyland then I would chose this place.
OfferS on rates and close to the park. Breakfast was marginal but there is a Cocos nearby with far the cheapest breakfast.
N ice rooms, clean, friendly staff. Only one "issue" the pool was cold. Students played anyway and had a great time. Staff really worked to accommodate our school group. THANKS!

Summary Heading: Bugs, gross, cold, can't even talk to manager apparently

My cousin's gift was to take me to Disneyland, so we figured, all we need is a place to sleep that's somewhat tidy. However, it didn't even meet these standards. We arrived and checked in, which was fine. Then we were in the room, double checking for bed bugs, and found a bug. We asked are entomologist friend what he thought and he said it didn't look like bed bugs, but definitely looked like a cockroach. So we went up to the front and asked if we could move. The front desk lady (can't remember name) who was helping us went upstairs to our room to check for more bugs, where we happened to find a HUGE cockroach crawl out from underneath the fridge. So, we asked if we could move. She said they didn't

I enjoyed the location being so close to the convention center, however, when we checked in to room 211, the room smelled of cigarettes and when we let the front desk know, our feedback was not taken kindly. The man seemed defensive and unwilling to help us with our situation and would not notify a manager. He argued that it was impossible for the room to smell like cigarettes and said the only thing he could do was to spray the room with air freshener. I will not come to this place again.

Room was clean and simple.  All rooms have an outside door.  The upstairs neighbor was a bit noisy.  Wireless internet didn't work very good so I ended up using my phone's data plan the majority of the time.

After reading some of the reviews we were afraid what we would be in for, but were pleasantly surprised by the clean rooms that had obviously just been renovated. Breakfast was good! Nice location, walk to Target and the ART Disneyland shuttle stops just on the curb. Might ask for a room that has no ajoining room door - we could hear our neighbors Chrystal clear every night. Oh and the Internet kept kicking us off and having to re-log-in. Otherwise we enjoyed our stay and would come back!
Started off the New Year with a really nice room that had everything we needed.  We enjoyed it so much we stayed several more days.

Last minute booking, was excited hearing that the rooms were recently remodeled. The rooms did look new-er and nicer, but there were still some issues. In the bathroom there was a Crack next to the door and a few cockroaches ended up visiting us. Other than that the beds and room were very clean. Stayed for 3 days.

The room was dirty. When we first got there, the bathroom floor was dirty. When we went to use one of the towels, a clump of dark hair fell out of it. There was dirt on the sheets, the blankets, and the bedspread. We reserved the room for 4 people, but they would only give us 3 towels each day.   When we complained, we got some new sheets. The 3 days we were there, it was never cleaned well even after our complaint.  We will NEVER stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time out of your busy schedule to let us know regarding your stay. I'm sorry that your stay wasn't a pleasant stay.  We are putting in new procedures for both our housekeeping and front desk team members so that these situation does not happen again t other guest.

Summary: I like the service! Microwave & refrigerator are there. I like the design of room!! Everything is over the average to compare to other days inns! Also it is near to Sea world so bert comfortable to move!
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay with us. Hope to see you soon.

Summary: The hotel is pretty affordable so we weren't expecting too much, but it's actually a very nice place. The staff was great and always willing to help. Free breakfast was simple but good, room was clean and hotel is 5 minutes from Disneyland by bus.
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed your stay with us. The Anaheim Resort Transportation (ART) does pick up right in front of our hotel so, that makes it very convenient for our guest.

Summary: The Days Inn/Anaheim Maingate on 2200 South Harbor BLVD gets a terrible review from me because I,E, (1) The motel Office representative sent us to a booked room that was not ready/in total disaray; Bed moved to middle of the room/unmade, room furniture moved around/not placed properly and dirty/uncleaned interior-very unsatisfactory! and (2) Very rude behavior from the Office representative giving us the impression that we were an imposition  to him not the other way around!
Manager Response: I have spoken with ALL of our front desk team members regarding better customer service. There is no reason our guest should feel as if they are an imposition.  Also our housekeeping team members have been given new training procedures to help with cleaning both the rooms and common areas.

Summary Heading: Cockroaches, Worn Out Mattress, Grease-Cvrd Curtains, Bath Unsafe, Receipt Withheld:Prohibited/Unauth'd Charge
Summary: My husband frequently transports me to Orange for both in-patient & out-patient spinal surgeries with our prescribed service dog. Although I verified twice directly w/the property that Days Inn Maingate was compliant w/the requirement to welcome a documented prescribed service dog without charge, Dakota claimed she couldn't provide me w/a receipt at check out, promised there were no additional fees charged, then lied & charged me an unauthorized & prohibited "pet fee." She was also extremely rude because I could barely move w/the assistance of prescribed mobility assistive devices following spinal surgery the previous afternoon, & I was in a great deal of pain for which I had to receive additional medical care after being available to check out in a timely manner, yet Dakota was
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know about your stay with us.  We are under new management that will be in the process of make sure that these things do not happen to other guest.  We also in the process of deep cleaning ALL of our rooms and common areas.

Summary: Was very worried about reviews I read. The hotel seems to be fixing itself up. They were cleaning carpets and remodeling things during my stay. All the bedding appeared to seem new and beds were very comfortable. I stayed six nights and was pleased especially with the staff and the hotel overall. Breakfast was ok ate cereal and an apple. The remote in my room didn't work well and my carpets hadn't been cleaned yet. But I can tell they would have been soon because they were cleaning all the other rooms. I would stay here again it was cheap for a Disney vacation and worked for me.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to review our Hotel. As you mentioned we are in the process of cleaning the carpets in ALL the rooms. We do have a new management staff that is taking charge to make sure the hotel is cleaner and that the staff is helpful.

Summary: Well located Just a mile away from the popular tourist attraction - Disney parks. and three miles away the popular shopping place - orange county factory outlets.  Reasonable quality of stay -- bedding was nice, cleanliness was okay. Staff needs to be trained especially one person at the reception, I found it to be rude to talk to. Reasonable breakfast, very limited choices for the vegetarian. Wifi connectivity was okayish. I had to come closer to window to get good signals.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to contact trip advisor.  I have spoken with our front desk team members and have issued new training to all so that this does not happen to other guest.

Summary Heading: Clean, helpful staff and well located.
Summary: It's close enough to walk but you can also jump on the ART bus which take you even closer than the Disney parking lot shuttle. Parking is included (YAY!) and no dumb resort fees that raise the price by 30%. We live close enough to drive home but this place is well-priced making it worth staying the night.  I wish they would extend breakfast hours until 11am though. That would get them a 5th star.
Manager Response: The ART shuttle does pick up right under our Days Inn sign. It picks up about every 20 minutes or so. Starting about 45 minutes before Disneyland opens and the last shuttle picks up at Disneyland about 45 minutes after Disneyland closes.

Summary: I was really glad to have chosen this location for my most recent trip to so cal. Front desk lobby was open even though I arrived late, the girls were wonderful. My room was clean, bed comfy, towels clean. When I checked out the staff asked how my stay was. My only complaint was the neighboring room decided they needed to slam the door closed on both mornings, repeatedly.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know how we are doing.  Next time you come into So Cal and you have any issues with neighboring rooms please let us know so that we can take care of the issues for you asap.

Summary Heading: Cheap and cheerful - within walking distance of Disneyland
Summary: This stay was as expected - cheap and cheerful but very basic. The room was fairly large but it was dark and had a really strange smell (like sushi!). The sink was outside of the bathroom, which we found to be strange. Bed was comfortable and room was fairly clean. Breakfast was simple but ok for what we needed, although it was a small space and did get very busy
Manager Response: I have spoken with our housekeeping team members regarding making sure that ALL of our rooms are cleaned properly.

Summary Heading: Curised Hotel, Pee Smell ,Dirty, Room , Rude Front Desk, Bad Services, Don't waste Money
Summary: planned to stay this location because good price and location. Like Cursed hotel that people are dead and behave like zombie,

we had no heat in our room for the first 2 nights. they could not accommodate us with another smoking room.  Staff said they would have it looked at the day i reported it but they did not. they waited an extra day to have it looked at. once it was fixed it still didn't work properly. it was either on of off. no temperature adjustment.
Manager Response: Unfortunately the issues with your AC where on the weekend and we did not have the parts that our maintenance team member needed to fix the issue.  We did try to move your to a different room but as you mentioned we did not any other smoking rooms available.

Summary: This motel was clean and convenient.  Breakfast was good offering some hot items in addition to cereal and toast.  Short walk to the parking lot of Disneyland where we were able to catch a bus in.
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed your stay. Hope to see you on your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary: This is the most dirty hotel I have ever been in. My toddlers feet were black within minutes, the tub had mold. We cancelled our 3 day stay after one day. Went across the street to Hampton!
Manager Response: We have had a company come in and shampoo all of our rooms to make sure that this does not happen again. The new management team will be on top of these issue.

Summary: We stayed at the hotel for 6 days and had to get new key cards 3 times. We made it a point to make sure that the cards were not getting "demagnitized." The hotel room was descent. The hotel only gave 2 towels for the room but they were poor quality towels. The remote in the room did not work for the television. The eggs from the breakfast were gross but did not have a lot of options.
Manager Response: We have a new management team that is working on fixing the things that you have mentioned.  We have placed orders for new towels and also new remote controls for all the rooms.  We are working with or breakfast food vendor to better our breakfast experience for our guest.

Summary Heading: To much furniture in a small room. The bathroom sink...
Summary: To much furniture in a small room. The bathroom sink counter was loose from the wall.the bed comfortable had a small hole in it.
Manager Response: I spoke with our maintenance team members to go thru all of our rooms and make sure that we take care of an issues that the rooms may have right there and then.

Summary Heading: Only stay if no where else available - Terrible
Summary: Had the opportunity to stay there twice.  The first time was to try it out.  It was ok, the air did not work and was invited to check out and stay somewhere else.  The area was sold out, the manager did not seem to care.  Eventually was put in another room.  The second time, much worse.  The bathroom was filthy, no towels were available for the rooms due to sold out capacity.  Since the towels were far and few between, we kept the towels in the bathroom on the towel rack. The bedding was old, faded and rips, foam pillows that were lumpy, the towels were small, in short supply and thin.   The pool is the size of a hot tub we didn't even use it. The place is noisy paper thin walls, when anyone shuts a door in another suite the whole place shakes. Room is dirty and over crowded with old furniture. Free Breakfast was a joke, coffee, fruit loops and bread something that looked like eggs with cheese whiz in it and waffles, juice.  The only thing we had was the juice. Then we went to the room and right when we opened the door there were big pee stains on the carpet and the room also smelled of urine. Summary: very friendly customer service. I would suggest that you have towels by the pool and that you make sure that the safes are working in the rooms. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Ist stay in Days Inn Anaheim Maingate
Summary: Very helpful and friendly person at the register. Nice clean beds, sheets and pillows. Not so clean wash cloths and bath towels. Old carpeting and smelly some little bugs crowing in the bathtub

My wife and I liked the room very much, she liked the comfortable mattress. The shower was great, I take rather long showers and the hot water never ran out. The rest of the room was good, to the fridge, the microwave, iron and ironing board. The only thing I would have them change is the bath towels were kind of rough and kind of small and could have used 2 more because people with long hair need an extra towel...

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: This is the only place we stay when visiting Disneyland. Its a short drive from the park. The beds are clean and comfy and the shower works. This is all we use it for. If I wanted a place to hangout at then we obviously would stay elsewhere. But for the amount of time spent in the room I feel this place is pretty good.  The breakfast could use a better selection.

The staff was great and friendly.  The carpet was stained, parking lot was way too small, bathroom was a little dirty but it was a nice stay.  It was a short distance from Disneyland which was convient.

I'm 62 with a bad knee. They said they only had a top floor room THERE WAS ONLY 4 cars in the lot overnight!!! No elevator with 4 heavy bags with no hotel help. Requested another room. Told none available but only 4 cars??? A lot of noise because of room location. I think they gave us the worse room because of price paid. I guess we had to be punished!!!??????

The A/C was broken in our room we asked to be moved and were told no, that they didn't have any extra rooms. They supposedly fixed the a/c but when we would have it on it would make all our clothes, pillows and bedding damp. On night it was so damp I had to put our clothes into the dryer to dry them so we could wear them. The breakfast is subpar! They only had bread, waffles and "omelets" that were just frozen eggs that were heated in a microwave. It was nothing what the website said or anywhere close to a continental breakfast. I would NOT stay at this property ever again.

It is an average budget motel. The room was okay, the beds were comfortable and it was quiet. The name "Maingate" is a little misleading as it takes nearly 1/2 hour to walk to Disney from the motel. The continental breakfast could use a little more selection and the waffles always stuck in the waffle maker and were hard to remove but the attendant wouldn't provide any spray for it. The eggs were barely edible. My biggest complaint is that they didn't clean our room one of the days we were there. We were out all day and didn't return until after the parks closed and when we returned we found the room hadn't been touched. I didn't bother complaining because we were checking out the next day.

Our room was clean and comfy and very much in line with the price we were paying.  Unfortunately several excited children were upstairs (active-child families please request the first floor!!!) driving us nuts jumping and running around.  The ACT shuttle stops right at the front of the hotel so it is really convenient and very easy to get around.  Parking is insufficient but they do have an annex area.

Facility and general condition OK.  Floor and carpeting filthy.  Carpet in our room was stained and so discolored it appeared to have been burned.  After walking barefoot on carpet I got in shower and had solid black footprints on mat that had to be scrubbed .  Ironing board in room had two huge melted holes in cover.  Photos available.

It is obvious there a lack of pride in presenting a comfortable, clean place for people to stay in this Days Inn. This is a very old building that needs updating. Unfortunately,  the staff didn't care when I talked to them about how dirty the room was. There was mold around the bath tub, paint on the floors and carpet around the bathroom door frame, sticky, dirty carpet, and the window curtain was missing hooks to hang on the rod and when closed - there was a huge, gross stain on the curtain. I plan on letting Expedia.com know this as well as the Days Inn Headquarters. I've never stayed in such a room.

I'm usually not a picky person, I just need a clean bed and a shower and I'm happy. The beds were clean, the shower was OK (the mechanism  to activate shower instead of tub was kind of failing), but there were A LOT and I do mean, A LOT of small cockroaches everywhere... we left a cup with coffee in the morning, we came back in the afternoon and it had without exaggeration, 7-8 small roaches around it...I bought cookies and stuff from Target (which is very close, I liked the location of the hotel), and had to stuff everything in the small fridge. I was traveling with 2 kids and I was definitely concerned about the roaches getting in their ears or something like that while sleeping :( . Stayed there 3 nights, mentioned it to the cleaning staff, they did nothing. I mentioned it at

They were accommodating of us checking in late. The room was relatively clean looking, but we found a sort of roach looking bug in our room by the sinks.  The beds were nice and big and clean. The shower was clean. Continental Breakfast was awful, they had some weird egg and cheese thing that I didn't even want to go near. All in all, I would not stay here again.

Check-in staff was friendly. Hard to get to hotel. Must enter through Jack in the Box. Carpet was all wet from the refrigerator leaking. Found live roaches in room and one in bed. Housekeeping still pounded on the door even though the DO NOT DISTURB sign was up. Remote for TV didn't work. Dresser drawers smelled like vinegar. Very out dated rooms. Experience was NOT good. Would not stay here again unless there were major changes made. Sorry. :(

The walkways need to be cleaned badly but otherwise the property was nice.  The beds were amazing.  Best hotel bed I have ever slept in. However the staff and especially the front desk clerk were rude and inconsiderate.  WE had to change rooms 3times over a nine day stay....said they needed to touch up the paint.  Moving rooms was a hassle and 3 times?  There seemed to be a  shortage of towels as well.  Because of the rude staff I do not recommend this hotel and I will never stay there again.  Definitely not a resort experience..

Glad I didn't pass up booking here. Thought about it because of other reviews I read but was happy with my choice. Room was very clean, had free wifi and is quite close to Disneyland. Enough restaurants and variety of stores within a few blocks to pick up most anything you may need. Needs improvement on the Continental Breakfast, not much of a choice.

Summary Heading: Room was clean and loved the big bed
Summary: When I first pulled in I was unsure of my stay due to the location but in the morning I was glad we stayed there it was a clean room with a large bed it was overall a nice stay.  I would encourage others if need a quick place to stay this would be a great place.
Very clean and comfortable! awesome staff . close to disneyand you can purchase $5 bus passes from the hotel and the bus passes last til midnight. very convenient

Back when I would travel a lot for work, Days Inn was my go to place. Now, about 10 years later, I had to chose from the countless options of overnight stays, due to a mini family vacation. I made the suggestion to my family of going to Days Inn because of their affordability and cleanliness, from my previous experience, they agreed/trusted me and we booked a room. Everything went smoothly with our check-in, got a room downstairs and the parking right in front. Things went downhill from here. After a very tiring day all we wanted was to slide into bed and sleep! Unfortunately, when we got to the room the pungent smell of cigarettes made it almost unbearable to be in the room. We sprayed NOT SPRITZ the entire room with deodorizer and left the door open for a several minutes. Once
When I work in Anahiem I always stay at the Days Inn. The rooms are always clean and the beds are comfortable. The value and location are also reasons I stay there

Summary Heading: Great Value for a Disneyland Trip
Summary: The reviews I initially read started to sway me away from this property, but, given the price, and knowing I would simply be sleeping there, decided to reserve and so happy I did.  I made a hiccup in my reservations and feared I would not get the best possible deal but through the website and the front desk they took care of me without drama.  My room was very clean and overlooked a side street that was very quite.  The nite before I went to Disneyland, I was able to watch the fireworks from my upper level room.  The desk clerk was so very helpful in answering questions I had.  Options to Disneyland parking were good, as they have a parking lot with bus shuttle a little over a block away or you can simply drive to Disneyland's main parking lot if you leave early enough.  The
I received ARP rate and was very pleased to have the room at such a decent price so close to Convention Centre where I attended a faith conference so it was very easy walking to and from.

Summary Heading: Don't be put off by bad reviews
Summary: After reading a lot of bad reviews on this site AFTER booking our stay I was apprehensive, but honestly our room was great! HUGE bed, clean bathroom, sink with a wall sized mirror, coffee, fridge and air con/heater.  The shuttle for Disneyland stops literally right outside and we had a great stay.  Breakfast was very basic but hey, it's free and there's a waffle maker so I was set! ;)

Went to Dsneyland on a whim, made a reservation at this property then read the reviews. What have I done?!??!!! What I did was book a night at a decent place for the price and did NOT encounter any of the horrors that have been posted. The staff at the front desk were engaging and very friendly and yes the breakfast was what one would expect but got a good nights sleep and no body parts fell off.

Due to my husband's need we require a handicap room.  The only real accessible room was the bathroom.  When you come in you open the door just enough to clear a table, there is just barely enough room to get thru between the foot of the bed and the table.  Good thing he had a scooter and not a full size wheelchair.  Had to place the scooter between the table and the door, essentially not being able the fully open the door. "Breakfast" was non-existent.  A waffle maker that had the stuff stucked and burned because they don't allow you to have a spray.  During a 4th of July week-end they ran out of food, I complained to the desk clerk, the answer was "we are completely full" - that is no excuse, if they knew they were 100% booked, they should have more than their normal supply. They made me pay extra $20 dollars to switch rooms, because we could not bare the smell! It gaves a headache!  It was by far, a horrible expirence!!!! I don't not recommend it to anyone!!
It was okay other then the first night there was a SWAT team in the front getting someone out of their car. And 2 days on a tow we found roaches totle of 4 by         ur our sink.  daysinn

We had a great sleep, fantastic shower, easy to operate coffee machine and lots of space.  The lady receptionist is a gem, superb in every way. The man at front desk is a bit more grouchy. The room was fantastic, clean and spacious. A/C works. Waffle maker rocks!

Summary Heading: It's a like inn to stay, not to far from the convention...
Summary: It's a like inn to stay, not to far from the convention center. For the price, it's not bad at all.

Summary Heading: Not the happiest place on earth
Summary: I was harassed for payment via phone even before I checked in despite the fact that I booked through hotels.com and they had my credit card info on file. Staff was ridiculously unfriendly. Room had a very strong body odor smell and was dirty. I will never use hotels.com again nor will I stay at another Days Inn because of this experience.

I expected better from a Days Inn. The filthiest carpet I have ever seen. Our feet were black after just standing up. Mildew in the shower, and the beds were stained.  Don't dare to ask for 2 extra towels. Because that's just asking too much.  It was a place to sleep during our Disney visit, but will never stay at a Days Inn again. Trust me, spend a little more and stay somewhere else!  I don't usually leave reviews, but I don't want anyone else to be disappointed with a Disney trip because of this hotel.

So, we stayed this last Tuesday to Thursday, 8/11-8/13/15... Hotel is directly on Harbor (same as Disney) and about 3 to 4 blocks away. Directly next door to Jack n the box and across from a Italian ice/ice cream spot and a family style resturant.. also down from red Robin and Roscoes... check in was fast and easy... we had a upstairs room near the pool. Pool was a little small but appeared clean, spa had jets going and had large amt of bubbles at surface. There was also a few seating areas and this was were washer and dryer were located. We opened the door to room and there was a strong chemical smell n floor seemed lightly damp... obvious they just did carpets... didn't complain just opened window and put air on low. Room was ok size with 2 dbl beds, flat screen (good cable)

Overall cleanliness was good.  Bathroom could use some upgrading (tub/shower had many areas needing re-caulk and some deep cleaning)  Sleeping area with 2 queen beds was large with enough room between to accommodate a rollaway).   A few noise issues (street noise, walls were a bit thin)  Jack-in-the box next door which helped with the food cost.  Hotel provided a free breakfast which was adequate (cold cereal, coffee, toast, pre-made eggs, and a make your own waffles)

Summary Heading: i will  never stay here again
Summary: im  not  sure  what  the  worst was, the  roaches  or the poor  management; i  travelled  with 3 kids and 3 adults  rented 2 double  rooms, both were infested  whit roaches, i  complaint to the clerck and  they sent  someone   to  fumigate  our  rooms  and tolds  not to  leave anything  on the floor. which  is  simply an  acceptable  solution. the  younger of  our  kids  had an   allergic  reaction  to the  chemichals. this  hole  thing  was  an invitation  to never comeback

The room was dirty. We were placed on the second floor near the street. It was noisy. The AC worked but it was noisy. The beds were way too soft. I looked at the breakfast room. I just got coffee but there was a waffle maker. It's an ok motel if you want something cheap.
Floors so filthy my feet were black after walking around the room for less than an hour. Woke to a cockroach first morning. Safe battery was dead. Terrible experience!

We picked the hotel because it was close within two blocks of the Anaheim convention center. All the front desk clerks were very nice. One informed us about the ART pass shuttle which you can purchase for $5.00 and takes you to Disneyland. The rooms were comfortable and had all the imenities. The only drawback was the condition of the carpet. It needed replacing or a good cleaning. Bring a pair of flip flops! The free breakfast was OK if you like carbs. Waffles, cereal, toast and apples. The coffee was good. (There is a Jack in the Box next door, so breakfast was not a problem.) I would definately return to this hotel for the value and convenience.

I stay here one night on July 20. The guy who check me in was night but the rooms were gross. They looked that the haven't been cleaned from the last people. There is no parking. And me being handicap walking that long was hard and then walking up stairs. I would never stay here again.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Shower sprayed outside of shower, ceiling leaked from upstairs bath, carpet filthy, old, worn towels and bed linens. Littered parking lot, noisy neighborhood. Remote control almost non-functioning. Bed spread stained. Moldy smelling room.

This hotel was awful.  Carpets had stains that looked like blood, linens had pee stains and there were bugs in the room.  Had requested a crib for our stay but when we arrived, we were told their only crib had broken a couple of days before but that I could go to Target down the street and purchase one!!!   Requested towels and they didn't arrive for like 2 hours and let's not even talk about the "continental breakfast".

I already knew I was going to run into problems booking at days inn. I mean common it's Days Inn we are use to Resort stays but I convinced my husband well we are hardly going to be in the room we are going to be out at amusement parks all day, so he agreed. That was the worst mistake ever we will never stay in a hotel room again I can probably put up with it but my husband said never again. The room smelled funky The first day there we were at the beach all day so we came to the hotel that night showered and went to bed because we had Knott's Berry farm to attend to the next morning. convenient transportation to and from Disneyland resort to hotel for $5 per day with the ART! free parking at hotel is great! would be nice to have options for food allergies at breakfast, waffle maker was cool!

Summary Heading: Decent price. Disappointing service and staff
Summary: Priced well and you get what you pay for. Plenty of parking during the weekdays and bus to Disneyland stops right in front of the hotel. We did see large (2+ inch long) cockroaches near pool and in front of our hotel room every night. We never saw them in our room but other residents did. Another thing, we did not want housekeeping in our room while we were gone for the day. Even though we put the "Do not disturb" sign on our door, they came in. The second day, we specifically told the lady we did not want housekeeping. She spoke broken English but said that she HAD to come in and change the bed because they didn't do it the previous day. After going back and forth for a few minutes, we just gave in and let them come in. The last day was the worst--while our family was packing

Summary Heading: Don't let the name fool you
Summary: The hotel is over a mile away from downtown Disney parking and even further from Disneyland (much further than website said or name suggests). The staff was not helpful and you can tell they are tired of people asking about distance or for help. Beds horribly not comfortable, otherwise room was fine. Would not recommend staying there if you plan on doing anything more than just crash there for a night.

Summary Heading: Will not book w/Days Inn EVER AGAIN!
Summary: As formerly Wyndham chain employee I trust most hotels, but after this stay I will do more research and think before booking. My family made 2 reservations, my sister checked in hours before me and called me really upset. She had found a roach in her room let staff know and they notified manager the problem and they stated the manager will be back in 2 hrs and she will be able to talk to management about how to resolve problem. Manager never contacted my sister and never came to our rooms to check on us. There was no option on changing room since they were fully booked. My room had some minor issues.  -floor needed to be shampooed bad odor in the room -bed spread had cigaret burns -mattress pad too thin, I could feel the springs -when asked for more towels they said front desk

Over all was ok for the price I paid. Couple lights didn't work and yes the front desk was notify, but think the lady forgot to check on it. Continental breakfast wasn't what I expected either, however, Jack in the Box was just next door. :)

Summary Heading: I really like how the pool is always clean and the rooms are mostly clean and have air conditioning.
Summary: It was a great stay I have been staying there since the very first time i went to disneyland and Me and my family have really enjoyed it and it was amazing.  i really enjoyed the stay and the staff is really nice
Good customer service and clean property. Changing windows in the rooms, so that means security and they are keeping the property in shape. Breakfast was good. Will be bavk
Chose this location and venue because of its proximity to disneyland.  Staff were very polite, pool was great, hotel room came as advertised.  Would definitely stay again.

We booked two hotel rooms at this location for a two night stay. I can't say enough negative things about this rancid establishment. We had no other option but to keep our rooms for the second night due to the holiday weekend and proximity to Disneyland. Where do I start. The carpets are so dirty your socks turn black. The rooms smell moldy. The towels are not clean, they had rolled up hairs stuck in them. The most horrifying is the BED BUGS!!!! I didn't see them till the second night. I woke up uncomfortable and saw something crawling on my pillow at 4AM. I smashed it, then turned on the light and saw a big blot of blood and a bug about the size of the tip of a q-tip!! I had no idea what it was so I quickly looked it up and realized it was a giant bed bug! My kids and husband

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: As a Disneyland annual passholder, my husband and I try to make a few trips a year without spending a lot on a hotel. I'm not picky but during our visit here I was very unhappy with the cleanliness of the room. There was food stuck all over the carpet, hair in the shower and sink and on the pillows, and cigarette ashes in our trash can when we checked in. The free breakfast isn't much- no protein and in a very small room that was ALWAYS packed. The staff was extremely nice but we will not be staying here again.

Summary Heading: Worst hotel I have ever stayed at!
Summary: Somehow when I booked this hotel, it came up under a smoking room.  I didn't even think there were smoking rooms allowed in California anymore.  Before I even checked in, they charged card for one night, how can you do that?!?  When I made the reservation, it was book now, pay later when you "check in".  Check in was quick,  but then they don't tell you that they hold an extra 40% for incidentals, they just do it.  I get to the room open the door, and oh my god.  The stench of cigarettes was disgusting.  It smelled like the room has never been cleaned.  Everything stunk like stale cigarettes.  I went to the office 4 different times to see if they could switch my room, or do something, and nope, they wouldn't.  I understand that it was a holiday weekend, but sometimes you have to

If you're staying in the Anaheim area, for Business or pleasure, the Day's Inn Maingate is a good place to stay. It's right next door to lots of places to eat all within walking distance and not far from the Disneyland Resort. Clean room, great staff who are very friendly. I would stay there again.

I like to stay at the days in cause they usually have truck parking. This one in particular had truck parking but it was very small.  I had to move my truck twice to make space for busses. The breakfast was ok, waffles were breaking and they syup wasn't that tasty. I also had a roach in my room, which I found to be unpleasant.  But over all it was ok, it was quite lots of channels to chose from.  My room was clean and I didn't have any serious issues,  front desk was over the top helpful, I enjoyed talking to them.  The lady was quite attractive my I add. But I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Decent inexpensive room close to Disneyland
Summary: I found this Days Inn by searching bargain hotel sites for an inexpensive room close to Disneyland. All of my basic requirements were met (clean room, clean bathroom, free breakfast, close to Disneyland) and I was satisfied. I stayed on the first floor facing the side street and would have preferred the 2nd floor or facing the parking lot but I didn't ask to be moved. The woman at the front desk gave me info on saving $ when purchasing my park tickets which was helpful.

Summary Heading: The Retirement holiday of a lifetime
Summary: Far too much noise from other Patrons having Domestic problems (midnight to 1am) and another 2 nights with someone talking loudly outside our door 1 to 3am.

Staff are very helpful and and the location of the inn is very accessible. Room was clean and comfortable. Nice place to stay and hopefully will stay there in our future bonding time. Not quite near Disneyland but with the ART bus stop just out in front. No problem going to Disneyland. Also, ample space for parking if you bring your own car.

I have been staying in this place once a year for a few years now when it was still Quality Inn. The continental breakfast has been reduced to pretty much waffles only (from a pretty decent breakfast in the past) but the rest is pretty much the same. If you get a good deal on a room and intend to sleep and go, why not.
where do I start the moment that we checked in the receptionist had a bad attitude does Luis for dirty there was no photo paper towels in the room and it's not likecat pee

OK, so it's a Days Inn, right? You do not expect a 5-Star experience, but you at least expect to have your room cleaned every day and enough clean towels left in the room for each person in the room.  You do not get that at the Days Inn Anaheim Maingate.

Over all this place suited my needs but was very poorly maintained. Carpet and chairs had stains. Toilet seat was loose. Bathroom wasn't very clean. All sheets were thread bare and at one point the whole place ran out of towels. How does that even happen.  Internet never stayed at a useable level for more than a few minutes and the tv remote was broken. The staff did the best with what they had but I wouldn't choose to go to this hotel for anything but a last resort. At least it was better than the travel lodge up the street where a friend had roaches coming out of the sinks and water fixtures
The room was great. 2 1/2 blocks from convention center. Overall staff was helpful with restaurant information, but lacked knowledge of bus system.  I would book this location again.
Hotel itself was ok customer service was no there. I have worked in customer service for 16 years. It actually made me sad how they acted.

Summary Heading: Probably a New Hotel Next Time
Summary: We had a reservation for 4 people. There was only 3 bath towels in the room. We asked numerous times for more towels and we never received them. The night front desk clerk was anything but friendly. The pool was heated but it was in need of a cleaning. The morning clerk how ever was very friendly and helpful

We have always stayed there and will to continue to stay there..the staff and rooms were excellent.  Every time we stay at the Days Inn it is a wonderful experience. .The waffles are awsom.thank you for all you do ..

I looked at review's before booking this hotel for a last minute trip down to Disneyland a few days before his 4th birthday.  While I knew I wouldn't be staying at a 5 star hotel I was surprised to find out when we got there at about 10pm that we had a second floor room and there was no elevator in the hotel.  When I stated I was a single parent with a stroller she made sure I knew that no other room option would be made available to me.  As I was leaving the lobby and commenting to my son we'd have to make a couple trips to get the suitcase and the stroller and him up the stairs the clerk did at that point offer to lock the front door and she brought my suitcase up the stairs for me, which I did appreciate and was very nice of her.    I just felt like whenever I had to go in

This is a cheap place to stay for an average hotel. AC system in the rooms is an old design and could use an update. Only one ice maker and it's a good walk unless you are close to the office. Nothing special, but it does the job for a low price. Close to the Convention Center, but still walk and a good 35 minute walk to Disneyland.
Near Disneyland and if you are too tired to walk you can take a bus for only 5 usd.   The only thing i did not like is the breakfast, they don't have variety and the place es very small.

Summary Heading: Rooms were okay - need updating. Looked out of place...
Summary: Rooms were okay - need updating. Looked out of place compared to the nicer hotels around it. From the website, it looked somewhat appealing. Rooms clean although there was chewing gum on the shower head. The breakfast was not good, went across to Jack In the Box. Convenient to the places we needed to go to.

Summary Heading: Was not satisfied with this Days Inn.
Summary: On my 2nd day my room was not cleaned at all. Was very upset how the staff did not believe me tell they saw my rm.Dirty wet towels still in bathrm/trash cans full/beds not made. Will not stay at Days Inn again.
