Summary Heading: Nice, economical choice for Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: We stay here each year for a meeting at the Anaheim Convention Center.  It is a longer walk than the more expensive hotels and motels near the center, but it is a lot cheaper and the facilities are nice.  They have a decent continental breakfast to start the day and a good hot tub for the end of a long day.

As soon as I walked in the rm it smelled of horrible odor! The front desk lady did tell me she had someone who stayed in the rm before I did that literally was there for 5 minutes and left. She said she did a "quick walk through" to make sure the room was OK and if anything was out of the ordinary please inform her. Right away that gave red flags and asked for a different rm if someone was just in there and nothing was changed out. I do not care if a person was just in there to use the restroom. I do not know if the person carried some type of disease and left it. She insisted i take a look at the rm before i made my decision. I explained about the bathroom toilet being lopsided as well as the odor the next morning and asked if I could have another rm. The receptionist ignored

I had some issues with the continental breakfast. There was not enough food (ie. egg, waffle mix) for the amount of people in the lounge and there's only 1 waffle maker.  When I asked the lady in the kitchen for additional waffle mix she left and came back with the person attending the front desk. Front desk lady said there was no more waffle mix given that the kitchen was already closed (this being 15 min prior to 9am). If continental breakfast ends 15 min before 9am please let your customers know so they can plan ahead. I saw a couple of people leave disappointed without having breakfast and I personally was not impressed with the lack of customer service.  If continental breakfast is one of the services that your hotel provides, please ensure that you are able to accommodate

The service: Was average, could have been better but, the front counter person looked really busy and the only person at the time of check in 3pm.  The Room: Did not like. I dont re-call saying or noting that i was handicap, and that is the room i was given downstairs right next to the office. I struggle in the shower getting the detachable shower head to stay still for me, this is a great room for somebody in a wheel chair.  Location: Great location and area, I went to the front office to get information on restuarants and the rep recommended one that we went and was pleased with the recommendation.  Over all it could have been better but I can understand that you guys were busy and in full capacity, maybe there should be a plan of action when the hotel is full so the customer

We asked for two queen size beds and when we got there to our surprise they had booked doubles and the rooms are infested with water bettles and cockroaches. We checked out the next day and booked at the Hilton.

It's a nice location, friendly staff, clean rooms, decent wifi. I didn't experience the breakfast but it looked good. However, this is 2 stays in a row with a billing issue at this site. I've never had any billing issue at any hotel I've stayed at except this one. The first time was taken care of and I left it as a mistake, so I gave this site another shot. Again, a billing issue days after my stay. It has been resolved, but like the first time, I felt like the person helping me wanted to brush me off as quickly as possible. They have good customer service skills in general, but need improvement in resolving issues.

Anaheim was our first stop on our adventure after attending a Church Conference in San Diego. It was lovely to be welcomed by the staff at the counter in such a friendly and inviting way. We were made to feel very much at home.   Although our room was upstairs it was very comfortable and we had all we needed for our 2 night stay. Great selection of channels on the TV but we found we really enjoyed watching HGTV a home renovation channel.   The room was clean, and when one of the lights on our bedside lamp did not work, one of the staff came up and changed it immediately.   There was a shuttle bus to Disneyland stopped right out the front of Days Inn which was very convenient as we caught it there and back. Also if you want a quick snack or a meal there are a number of

I stay here every year for a convention...have stayed for probably 10 years in a row.  For me and just needing a place to rest my head it is great - friendly staff and clean rooms.  Is it the Hyatt or Hilton?  No - but you are also not paying the prices for that!!  It's a short walk to the convention center, good water pressure and a decent mattress.  I'll keep going back!

Room was terrible and unwashed, nothing had been washed or even bothered to wipe down , the beds were covered in hair , and the pillows smelled like unwashed heads , I doubt any of the sheets were washed , the bathroom was covered in hair and still had handprints on the safety bars and sink from the last visitors , the bed had visible skin flakes on  it which made me sick to my stomach, we checked in at 3 , and left and didn't come back to the room until 11, breakfast was just a bunch of toast neatly arranged with cereal and coffee.

This was a great hotel in a great location.  The rooms are big and spacious. They contain coffee-making facilities, a bath and shower combo, King-sized beds, a microwave and a fridge. There is room service available at this hotel, though I did not get any.  Breakfast is included in the price. My friend got the coffee most days, but I did not go to breakfast, so I can't tell you what it was like.  One piece of advice. There are a lot of rooms and we found it a little difficult to find ours, walking up and down the length of the hotel more than once. Ask at reception the fastest way to your room.  There is also a pool and jacuzzi, which is open 7-11. The pool area contains laundry facilities priced at $2 per wash and $2 per dry. The reception is helpful in changing bills into
This was my second choice, since a big convention was in town and the place I normally stay was booked. I was very happy with the condition of the property and the room. I will stay here again.

All staff were helpful and friendly but the hotel had MANY issues that suggest that management or owners are not investing in the hotel: Paper-thin sheets. Awful mattress covers that tangle up when you move. Saggy mattresses. Microwave that only works when hit. Room STANK of chemicals (staff said it was cleaning supplies). Continental breakfast was mediocre. I would have rather had good muffins and fruit than a variety of cheap (white bread, cereal, bad eggs) choices. I would NOT stay at this hotel again. Not a good value for the price.
Great People on Staff !     run down facility, rooms beds furniture fixtures lousy WiFi  Chair doesn't fit under 'desk'    no elect outlets, plugs Bath moldy  no safety handrails to enter exit Shower

I had a very pleasant stay at the Days Inn. It may not be the fanciest place on the block, but you definetely get your money's worth. Very affordable and conveniently located. For those who complain about the poor quality of the rooms or the premises being this or that, stop your whining and pay the extra money to stay at a Jet Set hotel down the block and leave Days Inn alone.

My boyfriend and I scheduled a weekend getaway for valentine's day. We requested a king size bed on first floor, as I have a physical limitation. It is difficult to go up stairs. Well! Front desk lady manager, so she said), told us that the they were fully booked.  Guest that had room we were to be given chose to stay an extra night and we could check out if we were unhappy. We had no were to go, since plans were made prior to her inconveniencing us.   From my understanding, hotel needs to honor request. If guest reserved for one night, but chose to stay more, he should've been  moved.  Instead! I was to walk with difficulty up stairs, while lady copped an attitude. Very rude and arrogant because she had the power to control our weekend stay, which we left the next morning..My

I stayed there for the Disney run and saw the other reviews and thought it would be an ok place to stay. Definitely didn't get my moneys worth. We checked in later than I usually like to and had we checked in earlier, I would not have stayed there. It's right on Harbor Blvd. and you could definitely hear the traffic whizzing by at all hours of the night. It has that "hourly rate" motel feel. We stayed in room 230 and like I said, it was late and I was tired and just wanted to get some rest. When I  came back from my race in the morning to shower before heading home, I notice that there were blood stains on the carpet! Need I say more? The sheets were also not up to par. They were old and probably should have gone to the Goodwill but even the Goodwill might not have taken them.

I have stayed at this hotel before. However, imagine my surprise one night returning to my room that my door was left open! I am still waiting for management to acknowledge the problem but looks like I have to pursue them myself. Absolutely terrible!

Summary Heading: Nice Motel at a reasonable price
Summary: Everything was very nice, a basic room and a very good value.  Even had a refrigerator and microwave in the room, didn't expect that but used both!  Motel staff was very nice, room was clean and well kept, wifi had a good connection, even the TV was better than average,

Ack... My husband booked this by mistake thinking it as another Days Inn we had stayed in before. The service was so-so. The room was clan but the bathroom was mildewy. My hubby says the hot tub was hot. There is a safe in the room. The location was convenient for what we were doing. The breakfast room was horrible. Small and cramped and dirty. There wasn't much selection. We ate there not one morning and for the second wen to the fast food place next door. We won't make the same mistake twice!!

Much to my amazement, this hotel is in need of overall repair and updating. Example: Bathtub had mole and was not cleaned properly. Mat on tub was glued on, which is a OSHA violation, and it was cracked and torn. The ironing board cover was torn and showed signs of wear and tear. The refrigerator freeze had ice formation and it smelled. Beds sheets were not changed, much to Days Inn front office confirmation that they were.  Breakfast was less than adequate. Fruit loops were old and stale. Employee handling breakfast area was not wearing gloves and was handling food by hand. Grossed us out, so we decided to go elsewhere for breakfast. By then we decided to cut short our stay. I have pictures to go with above comments.
Free breakfast,  internet,  parking,  microwave,  fridge,  awesome location.  Understanding staff, you definitely get what you pay for.

came there to business. rm smelled so like dog made us sick. took a shower water would not drain, only had four hours to sleep before appointment, did not get any sleep, they put us next to cars on the street car alarms went off people beeping horns. doors slaming. it was bad! breakfast was bad what a joke.

It's not the Hilton or Sheraton but it served its purpose for us. Just a decent place to crash in and have a shower every morning. Free breakfast was adequate, make your own waffle, apples, 2 kinds of cereals, milk and orange juice. Can be better but for the price of less than $100 a night, I wouldn't complain anymore.  Quite a walk to Disneyland, around 15 minutes at the very least. Not very ideal if you're coming out of the park after a long day and feeling very tired.  There's a Target store 5-10 minute walk away if you need basic stuff, water, milk, bagels, cereals, candies, etc. The Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) bus stop is right outside the entrance. Take bus number 1 or 2 and get to the Disneyland entrance in around 10-15 minutes.  Lots of dining options around the motel,

On the same street as Disneyland, but quite some distance away. I never used the shuttle service, we drove and parked at the park, but if you walk, make sure you bring some comfortable shoes (but I don't recommend it, walking back to the hotel after a long day at the park will not be fun--and this is coming from a cross country runner). If you're looking for a good breakfast, do NOT come here. Granted, there is a breakfast, but the room it is served in is not a comfortable or very clean place, and the food itself is not very good. There is a single waffle maker if you like waffles and waiting in a line for a bit. But, if you aren't worried about much of this and you need just a bed to stay at night, this place is a good choice. If you want more than just a place to sleep, I

Summary Heading: Perfect price, comfortable bed, great shuttle service!
Summary: The outside of the hotel is a bit shabby looking but the room was wonderful! The bed was so comfortable, and usually hotels only give you one pillow per person and we were delighted to find they gave us extra! The shuttle picked us up right in front of the hotel and is a quick trip to Disneyland. Overall this was a great hotel and one that we plan to use from now on.

We booked 4 rooms back in August for a Christmas Disneyland trip, the rooms were small, dirty and had a horrible smell. Had it not been Christmas I would of went somewhere else but everything is pretty booked that time of year. So we just sucked it up. Was super disappointed with this location. We have stayed at multiple locations and this one by far is the worse.

Summary Heading: The place is cheaply priced and you get what you pay for...
Summary: The place is cheaply priced and you get what you pay for. It's clean but it's not a property that's constantly renovated such as high end hotels. The grout in the bath is not the greatest looking but is clean. The sheet/blankets cheap with stains, but clean. Breakfast was one of worst continental breakfasts in one of smallest breakfast rooms. Walls super thin. Woken up by other guests walking by in the morning to breakfast room and other rooms' doors being opened and closed. However, needed a decent, cheap hotel in Disneyland area at last minute and this hotel fit that bill just find. Not too particular of a guest.

It was like in the horror movies!!! Room smelled like urinal the least to say. My brother in low has shivers every time we mention this hotels name.  We where dragging our time anywhere so we wouldn't have to spend much time in the room. Don't stay there. Not worth it !

I reserved 5 rooms for 2 days each for my employees, their families, and my family for a Disneyland Christmas vacation.  The rooms were about average for this type of hotel.  I stayed here because Residence Inn near Disnelyland had no vacancy.  Two of my employees complained about dirty bath towels in their rooms.  One had blood on it.  The other had a brown spot.  The hotel advertises free continental breakfast.  It serves cheese omelettes, toast, juice, milk, and waffles.  They kept running out of omelettes and did not refill them fast enough.  There was a constant line of people waiting for them.  Then they would bring out only a few so several people did not get any.  They ran out of milk and did not refill it.  The waffles kept sticking to the wafflemaker.  Management only
Did not received good service, the breakfast was supposed to end at 9 am but at 8am there was nothing left an the person in charge said there was no more available.

Over all the hotel was great but one of the beds had a pee stain on the mattress and the toilet seat was loose on the toilet. Staff was very polite and apologetic and would make sure it was cleaned up and fixed. Location was very nice and convenient.
Our stay was very comfortable. The room was clean and the bed was soft. Breakfast was tasty. We plan to revisit soon.
The stay at the Days Inn Maingate was pretty good overall. The room was clean and the bed was soft as well. The only complaint is how the sub par breakfast tasted

Summary Heading: The place was not near the main gate as advertised. When I...
Summary: The place was not near the main gate as advertised. When I tried to explain the false advertising to the people there they were rude. Only one lady (a blonde) was a little apologetic. I will not stay there again.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland with Free Shuttle &great Value for Money
Summary: The room was clean, well Maintained. It had all the basic amenities like Microwave/Iron/Hairdryer/TV. Since we only planned to sleep in and spend most of the day in Disneyland, DaysInn was very suitable for that. They have free Shuttle going every hour and a very courteous Driver driving up and down. The Free breakfast spread was good but basic. Even for vegetarians! they allowed us to checkout an hour later than 11 which was required by us without much hassle. A minor issue was they didnt have drinking water bottles in the room so we had to go to the nearby vending machines which required us to have cash in change. Also one person checking out before us did complain of one of the lamps in his room not working. So it would be good to check the room for faults while checking in.

This hotel in in a great location its a 5 min shuttle ride to Disneyland and California adventure land.  There are many restaurants with in walking distance as well as a target if you need to grab something.  You can also see the Disneyland fireworks from the hotel.

I was hesitant to stay here because of the mixed reviews, but decided to give it a try. I've traveled to this area often, and I have found that some people are never satisfied with many of the area hotels or motels. This is a basic motel, and so you can't expect a 5 star establishment. You get what you pay for. Granted this place could use some improvements but it was reasonably clean and fairly comfortable beds. The Anaheim Resort transit buses stop right in front of the office. I ordered my senior 5 day pass online and it was at the desk when I checked in. The bus takes you directly to the Disneyland parking lot. It is rt. 3 and runs about every 20 minutes until an hour after Disney closes. I didn't encounter any difficulties with the staff during  check-in or check-out. They

The room was clean and neat. For the most part, it was painted nice. The bathroom was clean and basic amentities were provided. The safe was not working and right away the clerk came up to look at it and offered to keep my valuables in their office. When I returned to the room, the safe was operating. Breakfast was convenient and good. Some of the choices were egg and cheese omelettes, pancakes, grilled cheese, cereal, toast, waffles, and juices/coffee. For a few nights, Days Inn is a great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Never go to this hotel, it's gross!
Summary: TERRIBLE HOTEL....I WILL NEVER GO TO A DAYS INN AGAIN. I'm handicapped & like the top floor. I will report this hotel to the ADA. We rented a room cause I thought we were getting a good deal! Listen to me and do not use this hotel!

I reserved a room through ebates (which allows you to make reservations directly through the hotel's website).  I reserved a queen room and instead received a queen accessible.  Despite it being the hotel's error they refused to move me unless I paid for an upgrade.  I wasn't willing to do that for their error so I instead flooded the bathroom every time I showered.  I had stayed here twice before with no problems, but after this (and the clerk rolling her eyes at me) I won't stay there again. Breakfast was also rarely replenished despite being open for 3 hours.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: I have stayed at many wyndom properties but this one is just a complete embarrassment to the company. The bedding was dirty, the room smelled horrible, mold in the tub, stains on the curtains along with burn marks on the walls by the heater. Old fridge that didn't work, no microwave, blow dryer didn't work, and the list goes on. I would never ever pay to stay here again!

I would not return although the stay was ok.   The hotel room was clean but dated.   The beds and pillows are very soft, the bathroom seemed dirty even though it was clean.  It is next to a fast food restaurant and is very noisy.   If you are booking through the main website be careful as they deceive you. I was looking at a price of less than 80 dollars a night but when I arrive it was twenty dollars more. Apparently the cheaper rate is if you trade in some kind of points. They don't make it very clear. I stay away.

Summary Heading: The best cheap place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: I've been going to Disneyland at least once a year for the past 20 years & this is the best hotel that I have found to stay at for a great price!  The rooms are comfortable (bed comfort is #1 for me and they have regular spring mattresses rather than bricks to sleep on) and relatively clean.  Hotel staff is nice, rooms come with standard fridge/microwave/safe, free internet.  The pool is small, but nice (especially the Jacuzzi after a day of walking at the park).  The Anaheim Disneyland shuttle bus stop is right outside on the curb, so easy to get to and from the park. My only complaint is that the bottom bed sheets are not fitted & the queen is too small for the bed.  I always ask for a king sheet to replace it with so it won't pull out and wrap around me in the night.
The box spring in the room was staind with what looked like dried blood. The aroma of pot and crystal meth outside some of the rooms was tough to explain to my kids

Front Desk woman, very pleasant. But this hotel is deplorable! The bathroom's had mold & black stuff around the ceiling; towels stained. Sheets like sandpaper. Dirty! The beds are so old that whenever you move, they creaked so loud and were loose that we felt they were going to break. AWFUL EXPERIENCE! Will never recommand to anyone.

Summary Heading: Room was clean - bed was comfortable. Continental breakfast...
Summary: Room was clean - bed was comfortable. Continental breakfast was disappointing and the breakfast room smelled funny.

It was nice and clean and for the price I cant complain. We only wanted it to sleep and shower a d it was perfect for just that my family like that it was clean and the bed was comfortable the bathrooms very small but ok just would like for them to make check in a little bit earlier.

Summary Heading: I do not recommend this hotel
Summary: I do not recommend this hotel to anyone, unless you have no other options to choose from.  This hotel is old and dirty, lacking updates and could only be improved by imploding it and rebuilding it.  The carpets were dirty, despite being vacuumed every day. My children could not walk barefooted in the room, their feet were black afterwards if they did.  There was MOLD in our shower, cobwebs in the corners of the room and one of the noisiest air conditioner I have experienced. The pool was dirty and looked like it had not been cleaned, including the concrete area around the pool.  I would not allow my children to swim in the pool.  The phone in the room was so dirty it smelled.  I picked it up once to call the front desk and couldn't believe how badly it smelled.    The walkways

We stayed at the hotel on Oct 11, 2014. When we checked in the man at the front desk was very pleasant, he was friendly and basically right to the point. Our room was very basic unfortunately all that was left were 2 double beds. They were small I couldn't see 2 adults sharing the bed at all. We were traveling 2 adults and 2 small kids (4 yrs) The beds for us were ok. The property itself is clean but again very basic. The hotel is set back pretty far! I could not see walking to Disneyland at all, and you couldn't see the fireworks from the hotel. Breakfast in the morning was packed. There wasn't enough room for us to sit down and eat. We just got a cup of dry cereal for both of the kids and we were on our way to Disneyland. So as far as our stay in general it was OK. TVs in our

This hotel is really close to the Toy Story Parking lot. About a 20 minute walk. The receptionist put us in the wrong room and we had to move after we had unpacked. She was very apologetic. The rooms need to be updated, a little run down. The bed was too uncomfortable and the area was quiet. The room did have a mini fridge, which was convenient. The room had a weird smell to it, like cleaning product. Went away after we left the air on for a bit. Breakfast wasn't super exciting. They had a waffle maker which I think is awesome. Didn't get to use it since there was quite a line. I would stay here again if I had to, not my first choice.

I always stay at the Days Inn hotels and this hotel had its ups and downs. It had a wide variety of services including the best variety of free breakfast foods yet (I'm used to pastries and cold cereal as the norm but they really kicked it up a notch) and excellent location-- it is a five minute drive from Disney (I don't recommend walking, take the shuttle if you don't want to deal with parking.). The staff was very nice throughout our trip. As with any Disney hotel, there are are several food joints near by willing to provide free delivery and we made use of them. Our room was a little ragged and had a little ant problem in the bathroom, but if your trip MO is to be in the parks all day and only sleep in the room, it's not a huge deal. You get what you pay for, and the Days

The Staff was very rude to me and my husband. They said we had caused a "big problem" when we were using the waffle machine. Also when a child screaming next door woke us up at 4 AM I walked downstairs to tell them, but they told me I should have called them instead. Very rude but I tried to ignore it in order to enjoy my trip to Disneyland, we could not afford to switch hotels at this point or I would have.
Our room smelled horrible.  Floor was crunchy.  Shower had mildew.  Breakfast was empty, toaster didn't work, had cereal but no milk.  Anywhere would be better to stay.

The location is great for visiting the Anaheim area, but could be a bit of a walk to some things but still doable. The location provides free parking and breakfast. The rooms were very clean and well kept.

Summary Heading: A decent price for a comfortable room
Summary: The rooms are an older style, but that was ok since we only needed the room to sleep in after spending the day at local attractions. We were very happy because it was a huge improvement over the hotel we had stayed in the previous weekend in downtown Atlanta, GA (expensive wifi, expensive parking, no breakfast, no view, half of the tv channels didn't work, terrible bathroom lighting= $200 A NIGHT). Days Inn was convenient to Disneyland, right on the ART bus route, had a decent breakfast selection, a hot tub, free wifi, and we could see the Disney fireworks from the front of the room. It's not a Ritz-Carelton, but it's more than adequate for what we needed so that we could save some money to spend on fun things during our vacation.

Summary Heading: So so so so so poor
Summary: I just made a stay in Days Inn Anaheim maingate. It was so poor. The beds and floors contain a lot dirts

Summary Heading: Nothing in this hotel makes the low cost worth it.
Summary: Stayed here against my best judgement for my birthday weekend vacation. I wish you could give negative reviews on this site because they do not deserve any rating, let alone a one star.  Checking in to the hotel was fine, the girl at the desk was nice but the entire walk down the hallway was a struggle because all of their ac units are leaking, making a puddle maze to try and get to your room.  Once we got to our room, we could tell this was going to be an experience. The entire room smelled like cat pee, ammonia and smoke. We had to prop the door open and turn on the leaking ac to stand the smell inside the room. The bathroom area had looked like it had not been cleaned and there was a stain on the outer wall. Inside the toilet shower area, the showerhead leaked no matter which

This property in on the lines of a 1 to 2 star property at best.  It is old....period.  They need to gut the rooms and rebulid the interiors.  Reminded on the old style rooms in vegas back in the 60's and 70's before the newer tower style rooms.  The bathromms have commercial fixtures you would fine in a work setting.  The cable did not work.....even though it was just upgraded and installed by a local cable provider..... we left after the first night.  On plus....restaurant wasn't too bad... 7 out of 10.   The room...... 4 out of 10 and OVER priced with Bad...bad...parking situation.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for!
Summary: We have stayed here 3 times. The first 2 times were ok but this last time we stayed for a week in July and let me just say it was filthy. The pillows had make up and lipstick on them, the pillow cases were dirty. The sheets were dirty. We had to call and get everything changed from dirty to almost clean. The floors are stained, the outside pool area is never swept and the jacuzzi had green algae all around it. When I mentioned this to the pool cleaner he said it wasn't algae it was suntan oil. So although the price was good we will be looking elsewhere on our next trip. Even if they raised their prices by $5.00 a night they could really fix that place up, it's in a great location and very easy parking.

in cali just for the weekend for a wedding wanting to save money we picked the days inn 85$ a night ...unfortunetly wasnt worth 40$, u take a hooker here. The floors were soo dirty my feet became black. A smell so nasty i gagged. Do yourself a favor and stay anywhere else.

Summary Heading: Very dirty, mattress are old, breakfast room is dirty and...
Summary: Very dirty, mattress are old, breakfast room is dirty and the food is nasty and noisy. My family stayed there for 3 nights and tried breakfast one time.

Summary Heading: The hotel is in good location and has plenty parking...
Summary: The hotel is in good location and has plenty parking spaces.  Room is ok. The comforter was old and stained. I found "hair" in bed sheet. Other than disgusting bed...everything else is ok.

It was a pleasant stay. No problems ample parking good location quiet even on a main street.  breakfast was nice and service personnel very helpful.  Clerks were nice and helpful.  If you plan a trip to disneyland and don't mind a brisk walk this is a nice place to stay.

I did the reservation a month ago and even had confirmation emailed to us. We drove from Phoenix to Anaheim for a great weekend of fun and found our reservation cancelled by the manager and they refused to give us any answers. Never book here. We were disappointed by the poor level of customer service received at this place. It ruined out night and to make it worse all the hotels were booked so we had to drive out of town for another room.

Summary Heading: Dirty room- nothing like the pictures on web site
Summary: The room was dirty, there bugs on the wall. A bug crawled onto one guest leg, the bathtub had mold still in the tub.  Bed spreads had burns and were dirty. I complained and was told there was nothing he could do- since he was new. He would let the manager know in morning. We all slept on top of bed spreads, in our clothes. I paid for us to stay 5 days, we checked out first thing in the morning. I was told by the girl at front desk, since I booked though aarp I would have to call them, to get my money back. I called them, was told it was the hotel's choice & the hotel was staying we didn't tell them we left. The manager is never there, when I call to settle this. Her name is Luli Serria -this is the name I was given. I took pictures of the room, nothing like the web site. Watch
My stay was what i expected. A fast check-in, clean room, and easy parking. I'll tell my family and friends about my stay.

Over all the room was average. The carpet needed shampooing. There was surface mold on the bathroom ceiling. Other members in our family experienced a front door that didn't lock, swimming pool and spa that was very cloudy and trash on the deck. As a maintenance supervisor, I found these issues a public hazard. All 3 rooms that we stayed in needed the carpets cleaned. I will not be staying at any Days Inn again.

The pool was filthy.  the water for the spa was green...not normal.  My son found a bloody bandaid, plastic bag, and strange brown things in the pool.  The tables by the pool were not cleaned the entire week we were there.  The rooms were barely cleaned each day.  The sheets were not changed regularly.  There were four people in our room, but we only received three towels each day.  We had to go down to the front desk every day to ask.   The continental breakfast was okay.  The waffle iron was good, but they did not have individual syrup packages. They refilled an old syrup bottle for everyone to share.  Yuck. With this hotel being so close to Disneyland with lots of competition, you would think they would work hard to make sure you had a clean establishment.
the room was not as nice as i would expect for the price we paid, stains on wall,lamp fixtures, ragged carpet.

Summary Heading: Overall nice hotel! Could be more modern but overall its a...
Summary: Overall nice hotel! Could be more modern but overall its a really great value for the price& location
The Hotel is an older model, well maintained & clean.   Its location is ideal for Disneyland and getting to the freeway.   Overall, I would recommend this Hotel.

Overall, the Days Inn Anaheim Maingate was acceptable.  The staff was knowledgeable and handled my walk-in professionally and courteously.  They were dressed in appropriate business clothes, no blue jeans or tennis shoes.  They were clean and ready to serve.    Despite it's age and heavy use, the hotel looks well maintained.  Internet connectivity was excellent.  There was no accumulated trash or graffiti.  The furniture and bedding were new and felt clean.  The room smelled like it had been cleaned with industrial cleaning products.  A very unpleasant smell.   Regular household products and hot soapy water would be just as efficient at cleaning.    The shower and toilet worked well but looked like they had seen better days.  The air conditioning unit worked well and kept the

Found a dirty towel in shower when first arrived. In the picture on the internet showed bigger and nicer rooms thats not wat we got.  Asking for towels was  not easy. If we did get some they gave us only 2 for a family of 5. Or they gave us small ones. I probably wont go back. We stayed our last 2 nights elsewhere we were provided wit stove big refrigerator pots pans dishes belcony smoking area. Chairs. Its was a very nive stay those nights and only costed me 20$ per night extra then wat i paid at days inn.

Arrived after a 7hr drive, fully intending to stay, registered went to room (given wrong location .. ok explainable) got to the door finally and was greeted by a STRONG ODOR OF URINE, closed the door went back to the front desk to complain, asked for another room possibly, they claimed to be completely booked, say they would go spray the room, turn air conditioner on and open a window and the smell should be gone in 20 mins., went back to room 20 mins later, smell still there, REFUSED TO STAY IN SUCH FILTH,  tried to see if front desk would help me (that was laughable) 3 HRS LATER found a TRAVELODGE near knots berry farm (THIS PLACE I WOULD RECOMMEND WITH 5 STARS), when I went to pay with my CC it was DECLINED because Days inn had 5 pending charges THATS RIGHT I SAID "5" . which

A rough night in this pitiful place. Don't let the pleasant exterior deceive you...inside in hidden areas its a whole other story. The disgust started one night last week when we turned on the A/C unit after a long hot day at Disneyland and discovered that the unit was putting out URINE scented air...Yes, someone peed inside the unit and it stunk to high heaven all night long. I tried covering my head with the sheets to try to cut out the smell, but to no avail. Then, four days later we found an extra $8 charge to our credit card. When we called to inquire what the charge was for they said that there was a makeup stain on a towel...Are you kidding me! Summary Heading: Yuck! Run away, far far away.
Summary: Dirty far beyond explainable. The mattress had a large brown stain running down the side. I kept telling myself it was diet coke. The office crew defined "creepy". The breakfast looked good but I saw him touch the omlet with his bare hand to feel if it was hot enough to serve. Where had that hand been? The waffles were good. It was convenient to Disneyland.

Very close to the Disney, so close that you can actually see the evening fireworks from the lobby. This place suited us well, sply also because we were travelling with my 4 months old niece. The rooms were equipped with a microwave and a refridgerator so our lunches and dinners were not a problem at all. The property has a clean swimming pool and the cost inclusive of breakfast, fits the pocket very well.

The rooms were clean and comfortable. The location was very close to restaurants, shopping and short driving distance to disneyland. The staff was friendly and helpful. I wish they had an elevator so that I could have wheeled my dad to the second floor.

Loved everything about this stay! The rooms were clean. We had a flat screen tv, with cable. There was a microwave and fridge in our room, which came in very handy. The free breakfast was good. The pool and hot tub were nice extras. They had a washer and dryer we could use. Also we couldn't have asked for a more helpful staff!

Not good service. One day they didn't make the bed and how date my daughter use a washcloth to wash her face.  They charged me for the washcloth because it had makeup (which easily washes out!) on it ($8). Really?  Ridiculous!

First of all we were overcharged for the room. I made the reservation on Wyndham, when I mentioned this to the desk clerk he stated I would have to take it up with Wyndham this is their price for the 3 days. He did not tell us where our room was, so it took about 10 minutes walking all over the property to find our room. He mentioned the breakfast area was down the way, it also took awhile to find that little room. Not a bad breakfast( fresh waffles, apples, donuts, pasteries and coffee, milk and juice). The room was not bad. Just be careful in the tub they are VERY slippery especially when wet! Pillows were kind of lumpy. When we left in the morning we would turn on the a/c so the room would be cool for when we got back in the evening, it was ALWAYS off, so the room was HOT!!!

Not sure what to expect, read reviews after booking room for 3 nights.  Arrived early had to wait for room, staff was pleasant.  Got to room and pleasantly surprised, room very clean, carpet was clean, bathroom was very clean. For the price, it was perfect, we spent exactly 6 hrs. a day in the room sleeping to get ready for the next day. Buses stopped right in front of hotel and dropped off at the front door of the parks and picked up at the same stop. The continental breakfast was exactly that, donuts, apples, juice, coffee, cereal, and you could make homemade waffles. Every person I came in contact with was very professional and courteous to the guests. Would stay again with no problem.

room smelled of smoke, couldn't get it out, paint and wall separation curtain weren't hanging properly window left open no safe promised to have it repaired never did, they just said that to pacify me

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay near Diseneyland
Summary: This place is very near to Disneyland. Just 10-15 min walk to the Disneyland from the hotel. The breakfast was good. Also this place is on the main road so if you book a tour to anywhere, the tour guide can come and pick you up easily.  I will recommend it as a very good place to stay.
The room was very comfortable, and the only problem was the placement of the electrical outlets.  They were very hard to access and i was in a handicap accessible room.

Summary Heading: It was a place lay my head
Summary: I stayed here in Febuary. The facilities are a little run down, but over all bearable. The pillows however were small and uncomfortable. Long walk to Disneyland. Breakfast okay had jack in the box more than hotel breakfast. Pool was nice. Laundry facilities handy. Target was close by about three blocks away.

The room was by the office and was noisy late night and early morning.  Since the room doors are on the outside of the building and I was facing the street, the street noise was something to get used to.  The staff was courteous, friendly and helpful.

When we first arrived in our room it had a intense smell of cigarettes and weed. There were stains everywhere, on the carpet, the blankets, and drapes. The fridge and microwave were both filthy. It was too late to find another hotel and we knew we only stay there to sleep so we decided to stay. After unpacking we left to go meet up with family, our door wouldn’t close from the outside. We tried several times before going to the front office for help. The employee there said we had to slam the door while pulling up. I asked if he could show me how and he said he couldn’t leave his desk. So we went back to the room and tried to close the door again.  After several failed attempts we still couldn’t get it to close.  Again we went to the office and asked for help. The employee said

I chose this hotel because it was very close to DL and we were attending the 24 hr event. Not really my idea of within walking distance, but at least they were on an ART route. The first trip to the park was fine. However, when we attempted to catch the ART at 12:40, it didn't show. At 1:00 it didn't show. At 1:20 it didn't show. We started walking and came upon a slew of ART buses fueling up. My friend inquired about if they were still running and how we had been waiting and no bus arrived. They gave us Dispatched number. My friend called and apparently we were supposed to call for a pickup. WHAT??? It would have been nice if upon check in the person at the desk would have told us. Needless to say having to walk to Disney was not our idea of fun. It put us both in a poor mood
Not to far away from the park if you are parking in the park. Gentleman at the front desk was great!

Summary Heading: I stayed here because of the price and the extras you...
Summary: I stayed here because of the price and the extras you offered.  The location was good but a bit far from Disneyland.  I had more problems with ART than with the hotel but that certainly played a part in whether I'd stay there again.

You get what you pay for, Days Inn is not like it use to be, gone downhill in many areas, cleanliness, high carb, low cost breakfast, no fruit, protein (boiled eggs) or oatmeal.  Mattresses soiled, holes in walls, moldy grout in shower, strong oder in lobby, less in the room.  Hard to carry luggage and kids things upstairs, no elevator.  Wore socks on carpet, wouldn't use the pool. We've stayed at Days Inn in the past, never again.

aircondition was too loud, poor service, we had to wait hours to get clean towels, when I asked for towels the response was "They are working on it" breakfast was not good, coffee was terrible, Juice was water..
Our room smelled like smoke and had large stains on the carpet. The breakfast was good but the tables weren't clean and the garbage was overflowing. It is close to Disney and cheap tho.

We used this hotel because we wanted a cheap trip to Disney. Our toilet wasn't even attached to the ground and wall properly so every time we used it, it wobbled and made a loud noise. It didn't flush right either. The water pressure in the shower was bad at times. You can hear EVERYTHING outside from inside the room. I would wake up at night thinking someone had come in our door because of how loud the outside noise was. The breakfast is horrible so we only tried it the first day and ate elsewhere after that. They say it's a mile from the park but it seemed further. By the time a family of four were to pay for the shuttle, parking at Disney is better. We didn't always get our room serviced right and they charged us for staining two towels with what they thought and said was

Summary Heading: Ok but could be way better, need to be updated
Summary: I'm always checking out reviews before I book a hotel but have never written a review so here it goes, for the price i have stayed in better rooms, they where dingy and small the carpets were nasty and the bathrooms had lots of mold on the walls. If you are really really on a budget stay here but if you can fork out $20-$30 more a night stay elsewhere. Everything seemed very outdated and Just dirty but the good thing was the staff was super nice, cost was low and location was decent  , it was nice to have a fridge and microwave . Also in our room one the outlets had a piece of plug stuck in it and the lights would flicker. Overall unless it's updated a lot I probably wouldn't stay again

The positives: comfy bed, near a range of food options/supermarkets, on direct bus route to Disney ($3 each way, or $5 day pass), free breakfast, swimming pool and cable tv. Staff were friendly and helpful.  The downside: when we arrived it appeared as though our room had not been properly serviced - there was only one clean towel, while used towels hung on the back of the door. This did make us wonder if the sheets had been changed. The hotel itself is rather outdated, but the room included a tv, small fridge and microwave so it was sufficient for our needs. It was nice to have the opportunity to go for a dip in the pool, but unfortunately this was quite unclean. Some rowdy neighbours woke us around 2am with a full party in swing, but management did deal with this swiftly.

I am staying here for three nights. Room rates are good, can't whine about them. they are under $100 and that is my meter these days. Front Desk Staff are exceptionally polite. Breakfast is OK - standard hotel carbohydrates with nothing special; apple and orange juice, waffle maker, donuts and danishes from Costco, two 'blah' cereals, 'hotel' coffee is fresh, apples - no other fruit. The doors seal and you feel safe, the neighborhood is quiet enough. the pool and hot tub are clean. they have shampoo and soap and a coffee machine in the room.   They surcharge you for the safe as an excuse to get your credit card number and one has to remember to tell them to remove that charge before you leave. The housekeepers did not service my room one day because they are not here after 11 am

Hotel was decent. Don't expect a resort type room but it was clean and in a great convenient location. Pool is very small. Overall it was a nice place just to sleep while visiting the area. Staff is friendly and helpful would defiantly stay here again.

We stayed here to save money, and it turned out just fine.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  It was very convenient to use the ART shuttle to Disneyland.  We appreciated the free parking and free breakfast.  It was clean and beds were comfortable.  We liked having a refrigerator and safe in the room.

You get what you paid for. They only had the wheelchair accessible room and omg I regret saying yes to it, the water from the shower leaks into your room carpet so the entire time your soaked if u don't have shoes on. And then they charge you a clean up fee as soon as you leave even if you keep the room clean!  The front desk girl said she wasn't from around there so had no input on anything.  Really you don't know any good restaurants around disney? If you want a dirt cheap room book here.
This was an average Days Inn, nothing special. The beds were comfortable and the breakfast was okay. Very close to Disney and nice dining options. It was also not far to Huntington Beach, Long Beach.

The staff was wonderful, room was neat, tidy and in good order. The only problem was that the noise from other guests running on the property and walkways that kept us from sleeping. Management only needs to enforce their noise policy more and let each guest know at check in.

Summary Heading: need to fix the security door lock screws were stripped out...
Summary: need to fix the security door lock screws were stripped out one light didn't work,otherwise was a nice place to stay

Hotel was great and cheap , only thing is that the sheets were dirty when we got their,  I didn't want to complain because I was trying to enjoy my vacation with my wife. But at the end of it I had a blast.

This is an average hotel the location is great, however we stay for two days and couldn't get cleans towels. I have never stay any place and not been able to get clean towels. Won't stay again even with being a good location.

Summary Heading: I specifically asked for a non smoking room due to my...
Summary: I specifically asked for a non smoking room due to my daughter's having asthma. Room smelled like an ash tray bad and when I brought it to the "manager" she offered to check me out. Did not offer another room or nothing. We drove 400 miles and were extremely tired. 2a.m I awoke to my daughter coughing had to drive 2 miles to find a store to buy febreze and a humidifier

This hotel was completely discusting. First room I had there was blood and pee all over my sheets and it smelt heavily of mold. The front desk informed me all rooms are cleaned daily and it must of been my 3 year old child who never stepped foot inside the room. They switched me to another room which was fine but it to was very dirty and my son had to wear his shoes inside because of how black he got. We cancelled the rest of our stay and paid the extra night and paid to stay somewhere else. I would never stay here again. Front desk told me I got the room really cheap so I should take what I get.

We checked in to the Day's Inn and I have to say that the management was extremely nice, however the room was the dirtiest room I've ever encountered.  Our socks were BLACK  after just a few steps, the tub didn't drain, you could see under the door as there was a 2" gap from a missing flange, the mattresses were stained beyond words and to top it off, a cockroach was found right before we went to bed.  We did request assistance when all of this was noticed however maintenance was not on staff at night and there were no other available rooms. The next morning, we discussed with management the problems and they did allow us to check out early and did help us find another place to stay. However, I don't believe we should have been charged for the room, especially a peak rate. I was

We had booked rooms at this hotel through booking.com but found a hotel that better met our needs.  We called the Day's Inn and cancelled but to our surprise received an email saying we were a no show and that they would be charging us.  Thinking it was a mix up we went about our trip figuring we would handle it at the end of the weekend.  American Express contacted the hotel for us, they denied that we had made the cancellation and that according to their policy they would be keeping the funds as charged for two rooms one night.  Lesson learned do NOT use booking.com and do NOT stay at a Days Inn or any property owned by them.. I write a travel blog and will make sure my readers all know that if they are thinking of visiting the happiest place on earth, Days Inn is NOT.

Summary Heading: a perfect fit for the confernce
Summary: the room was comfortable. I found all I needed for my stay. frig , microwave, the iron....and even the safe for the money I didn't have. the breakfast was convenient.... the location is close enough to walk. This is the 3 year I use this hotel.  thanks!

Summary Heading: The Days Inn has a NO CANCELLATION policy which was very...
Summary: The Days Inn has a NO CANCELLATION policy which was very inconvenient for this particular stay.  Second, they have no refrigerator in the rooms with double beds.  All the Wyndham hotels in this area have refrigerators in every room.  We were at one end of the property and the only ice machine was at the other end.... the rooms were clean; the staff helpful.   We didnot eat breakfast

The bath mat was moldy, the room dated and smelly, curtains had burn marks and pool was scummy.  Breakfast was not edible.  And parking was atrocious.  We had to park quite a ways away and haul our luggage upstairs and around the entire building to get to our room.  Never again...
Manager Response: Thank you taking time out of your busy schedule to let us know about the mat in the bathroom. We have had our maintenance team members go thru the hotel to make sure that all the mats were in good order.  As for our breakfasst items, we will be offering new items within  the coming weeks.

Summary: The people at this hotel are great! Very helpful and courteous. Disneyland, the location was supper convenient and we were able to leave our cars all day. However, we had four rooms and there was mold in every bathroom, hair (always scary) on the floors and the air conditioner (in two rooms) did not function well. But, the people were so nice and the price was moderate, we would probable give them another try.
Manager Response: I'm glad our team members were helpful and courteous.  We  have had our mainteneance team members go thru the hotel to correct the issue of the bath mats and also the A/C. I do hope that you and your guest return so.

Summary: We have stayed at this motel multiple times when visiting Disneyland.  Nothing really special, basically a decent place to crash after a long day in Disneyland.  Very affordable.  Note this hotel is *not* walking distance to Disneyland, so you will need to find a way to get into the park (either buses or pay for parking, which is just down the street).  The pool is super small, not really a good place for kids to hang out.  One nice thing is Jack in the Box is right next door, so you can pick up your breakfast there, and if needed pick up a late night snack when you get back to your room.
Manager Response: Glad to hear that you received a good value at our hotel.   As you mentioned there is a shuttle provided by ART that does pick up right in front of our hotel ($5 for adults & $2 for kids ages 3-9) round trip.  The shuttle runs every 20 minutes or so.

Summary: Anaheim was very busy with the Natural Products Show. Found this room on the web and it was close to the convention center and very reasonable. Will stay there next time I have to work in Anaheim.
Manager Response: The convention center is only 4 city blocks from the hotel.  So not a very long walk.

Summary: I've stayed here the past three years for conventions.  Not a bad experience the other times...you know what you are geting - it's cheap and no frills..fine by me since I just go to sleep.  One of my employees complained profusely about their room and how they didn't even want to step on the carpet.  I didn't really understand until I saw it.  Then they moved me into a new room as well after my first night - the new room smelled horribly of cigarette smoke.  I asked about a new room and they said they would "spray it down".  The bed was pretty bad in that room too.  I decided to stop complaining because of it all.  My employee who checked in first had a horrrrible time with the front guy who couldn't get the pre-auth credit card form I faxed in (so he wouldn't have to put his
Manager Response: Dear Sir,  I do apologize for the inconvienence that you had while staying with us refgarding the situation with your credit card.  We have re trained our front office team members so that they can provent this situations from happening again.  we have also had our maintenance team members shampoo the rooms a bit more often to help with this also.

Summary: This was not a nice hotel.  My room had a broken AC unit so it blew hot stinky air.  I pointed this out every day I was there and they sent a repairman to fix it but when I returned that night the AC unit was in pieces strewn about the floor.  I went back to the front desk to point this out and left for dinner.  When I returned the hood was back on the unit but the pieces stayed on the floor.  It never worked.  When I got home my wife commented on my smelly "clean" clothes that I never even wore, but because they were in the room, they picked up the smell.
Manager Response: I do apologize for the inconvience that you had while staying with us.  We have retrained both our front desk and maintenance team members as to following thru on guest issues.

Summary: We stayed here for one night and our door lock was malfunctioning and we got locked out for 30mins late at night with sleep kids. The room was okay but it's close to a jack in the box and late at night I could hear yelling and fighting nearby and loud car music playing. It kinda freaked me out.
Manager Response: We have notified the owner of the Jack In The Box to please advise his drive thru geust to please keep the noise down as they go to get their order.  Our Maintenance team members have replace the look on the door and have gone thru the hotel to make sure other door do not have these issues.

Summary Heading: I was surprised when I looked at my bill that I had been...
Summary: I was surprised when I looked at my bill that I had been charged to use the room safe. they should tell you about hidden  costs.
Manager Response: On the registration card that is signed, we ask that you initial that you are aware of this charge. It is on an honor system that if you tell us upon check out that it was not used we will be more than happy to take the charge of 1.17 off the account.

Summary: Room was clean, comfortable, no problems.  Desk person was especially helpful giving directions we needed to get around town. Got an excellent prince by booking online!
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know that both our Housekeeping and Front Desk team members were helpful and made your stay enjoyable.

Summary: I had NO issues whatsoever with my stay that involved the hotel. Wifi was great although a little faster speeds might be nice. It is close enough to Disneyland that you CAN walk the distance if you need to for some reason but far enough that you don't feel like you have to eat, sleep, and breathe Disney. It is also very close to Target so if you need anything like sunblock or some snacks for the room, walk on over.
Manager Response: As a matter of fact we have upgraded our internet system to make it a little fast.  Glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.

Summary Heading: We had a great stay at Days Inn.  About a mile walk to...
Summary: We had a great stay at Days Inn.  About a mile walk to Disneyland, free breakfast in the morning and a clean room.  If your on a budget this is the place.
Manager Response: If you don't feel like walking to Disney there is also a shuttle that picks up in front of the hotel the cost is $5 per adult and $2 for kids ages 3-9 round trip.

Summary: Staff was very polite, professional and helpful, especially the housekeeping staff.  The water pressure in the shower was above average, as were the comfort of the beds.  Having said that, we will not be staying here again.  We didn't have towels or pillow cases on check in (although they quickly remedied this).  We called down to a young man at the front desk to ask how to use the room safe.  He did not know but told us he would call us back in a few minutes.  We never heard from him.  There were truckers staying on the floor below us who had a full size grill.  They would bbq each night and then smoke weed outside.  On the last night, we took some of our clothes to put in the dryer and discovered that he laundry "facility" was outside in between the pool and the hot tub.  Very

Summary Heading: Terrific Value & Extremely Helpful Customer Service
Summary: Location is great, I was on a budget and this was the best value I got during my entire Anaheim & LA trip. Highly recommend this place and was very happy with all of the assistance I had. The late night front desk clerk, James was extremely helpful and assisted me in planning out an efficient and enjoyable vacation.  Will certainly recommend to others & come again!  -B

The Wi-Fi was not good for our room (215).  Maybe because it was too far away from the office.  We had to go to McDonald to check our email or to surf the Net.  Anyhow, we've just go there to have a shelter to sleep and have a shower.  No big deal.  Thanks.

Pleasantly surprised by above average accommodations and continental breakfast at very affordable rates. I will definitely keep this location in mind for any future trips into the Disneyland and Convention Center area of Orange County.

I've stayed at this Days Inn on business trips to the Anaheim Convention Center many times, going back to years before it was a Days Inn. It's everything you expect for an inexpensive place to stay. The staff is courteous. The breakfast is free. The beds aren't terrible. Fast food and other restaurants are nearby. And, most importantly, it's within walking distance to the Convention Center if you're in reasonably decent shape. On the down side, it can occasionally get a bit noisy on weekend nights, usually from the parking lot next door. On the upside, it's cheap and is a fine place to rest and sleep after a day of doing business. I'll likely be there again.

My Travel agent booked this hotel on our behalf. The staff greeted us in a friendly manner, were always available & helpful with answering our questions. The room was clean & tidy, having all the amenities we needed. They have a pool & spa (open late) - also very clean & much appreciated after a long day at Disneyland. Coin-operated laundry near the pool area, kitchen, snack/drink/ice machines. The buses go straight to Disneyland from the front of the hotel. The staff helped us with directions to places, best transport to other areas & calling taxi's. It is about 20 mins walk from Disneyland, but is close to Target, ATM's & other food places. A quiet room on the bottom level away from the carpark, was our choice. I'd stay here again. Thanks to Lilly & the Boys.

I booked this hotel because it's cheap among all the hotels around Disneyland. The location is great. 20 min walk to Disneyland. Many restaurant round. The room is generally good. But the carpet in my room is not clean and has a smell. I stayed in the first floor. Every night I can clearly hear the noise like car parking, kids upstairs running and playing. But I can live with it at this price. The breakfast is below the average for a B&B.

Summary Heading: Eh...not sure I'd stay there again!
Summary: I know going to Disneyland means staying at a place close to the park...so we tried a new place.  This is on the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) which means you can pay $12.00 for a 3 day adult pass and catch a bus outside the park right to your hotel.  But...the service on Route 3 SUCKED!!  Really Bad...and I'm going to have to rethink using ART to access the park.  So, on to the room....was a little yucky!  Old bathroom had a rubber mat stuck to the floor of the tub...didn't have the guts to pull it up and see what was beneath it.  The water was hot and plently of pressure though.  The toilet wasn't secure on the floor and rocked badly when sat upon...eww! The cleaning staff must be trying to hid smells becuase each time we entered the room after Housekeeping, it reeked of

Summary Heading: Good hotel--exactly what you pay for.
Summary: I was worried about staying here due to all the bad reviews but because of the price, I booked anyway. And I'm glad I did. When we arrived, the gentleman behind the desk was very friendly and nice. Quick check in and up to room #207. It was exactly what I expected for what we paid. (There are so many people on here that think they should get a $250/night room for $80.00.) Our room was clean, the property was clean and the staff was very friendly. The girl behind the desk in the morning was also very nice and helpful. The beds were comfortable, good pillows, good shower, and ok coffee. T.V. worked just fine, but would suggest to bring a multi-socket extension cord if you have a lot of electronics that need to be plugged in. The only thing I wasn't thrilled with was the

Summary Heading: This hotel is a good value for the money and close to...
Summary: This hotel is a good value for the money and close to Disneyland.  It is no frills, but what we expected.  We had 2 separate stay.  The second stay our room had a strong chemical smell from cleaning supplies.  Would have like to have yogurt or some type of protein as part of the breakfast. The people at the front desk were helpful and had lots of great suggestions.

The hotel is your basic good bargain hotel. It was clean which I feel is what most people are concernded with.The room to be specific for review purposes is 108.The sheets were clean, the bathroom was clean everything appeared to be just fine. The carpet is like most hotels like this if you walk around with socks on your socks will get dirty. I recommend bringing slippers if you expect the floor to be spotless.        I have two complaints. Number one complaint I do have is the wifi needs to be consistent.  In todays tech driven world just about everyone has a cell phone, tablet or laptop. The wifi signal from their router was up and down at best and most of the time did not stay connected. Basically never used the wifi because it never stayed connected. A pretty simple fix for

Summary Heading: The screwed up on my billinig even with literally 9 times...
Summary: The screwed up on my billinig even with literally 9 times advance reminder. I asked them to fix during check out at 5:00 AM, check out staff person asked to come back at 7:00 AM to talk to manager.   I couldn't make it at 7:00 AM, went back at 3:45 PM, manager was gone, they asked me to come back 7:00 AM next morning.    How ridiculous, on my vacation they expect me to keep coming back to fix wrong billing which was not a innocent mistake but very clear cut ignorance.  Normally it takes a lot for someone to get me upset but these two people managed it very well to make me raise the voice.  They even have false advertising. It says maingate, which normally used by hotels in front of disneyland.  This particular place is nowhere close to disneyland main gate.  For $30 bucks more I
Clean rooms and really nice, helpful staff. The rooms are basic, but the showerhead had at least 8 settings! Good location too, we walked to the convention center.

Summary Heading: i liked the location and you have restaurants near by.when...
Summary: i liked the location and you have restaurants near by.when i checked in i spoke to the manager it was a lady she was very rude not friendly at all the only thing i would suggest is ti invest in cleaning the carpet it turned our socks black every time we took our shoes off

Summary Heading: Not staying at a Days Inn ever again
Summary: This place was a dump! There was no power button on our t.v. The pillows were small and flat. Everything looked old and in disrepair, including the shuttle. I did not even feel safe because someone was trying to access our room in the middle of the night and there wasn't even a key for the safe! I would not recommend this hotel nor would I stay here again. You get what you pay for and that's why this place is so cheap.

This has to be the worst visit at a Days Inn ever.  We requested a non smoking room and our first room was smoking (we booked 1 week out). The mattress'  and bed cover were stained, the carpet was stained (room 205) the bottom of the door was dry rotted away with  a 2" gap.  There was no guide binder in the room. When the guide binder was delivered to us the channels on the guide were no where near the television stations.  Had to search through 100 plus channels (including sub channels).  We were moved the next day to room 204.  The vents in this room were filled with dirt and grime in the bathroom and sink area.  The staff was very polite and felt bad. They stated the General Manager had not updated the binders since the change of cable providers (unacceptable).
Clean room, great staff, & close to attractions!

Summary Heading: Our stay here was OK.. this PLC needs a serious deep...
Summary: Our stay here was OK.. this PLC needs a serious deep cleaning. Our room was never cleaned during our stay! We came back to our room to find a do not disturb sign which we never put up. The jacuzzi and swimming pool were filthy gross... oh n the blankets had old blood stains pretty gross. Good thing we brought our own blankets.oh and u can hear the jack in the book drive thru person all night....

Requested a non smoking single king room with a fridge when I arrived they were out of non smoking kings and they charged me an upgrade fee to move to a double twin non smoking without a fridge the rooms were unpleasant and the people were very unwilling to help me out I will never stay in this hotel again

Staff was friendly at front desk.  Don't allow early check in without a fee even if the room is ready. Room was not cleaned 2 days of my 6 day stay and when I reported this the response sounded as if it wasn't unusual. Bathroom was up to date as well as sink area but the carpets need to be replaced and the upholstered chairs cleaned.

The room looked decent at first, made the mistake to get a smokers room so it smelled horrible. The biggest problem was the bed... Laying on it felt nice but once I was about to get under the covers I noticed the bed was dirty!

First off, the hotel had charged my debit card before I was even checked in. When I called them about it the said that it was an "authorization hold" and that I wasnt really charged - bull!!  If its a pending transaction in my account then it is a charge!!  Then the desk clerk proceeds to tell me that there will be a %15 percent incidentals charge on top of the room charge.  There is no mention of this anywhere when I was booking the room. Plus, this isnt exactly the sort of place where you might need and incidentals.  Had I wanted to spend that kind of money for one night, I would have stayed somewhere nicer  Its a two story hotel, with no elevator. I ended up just taking what I needed out of my suitcase, rather than lugging it up the stairs.  When I start to get settled in, I

Our stay was quite pleasant. The room was clean and the folks who worked there are all very friendly, which is super important to me. The room is the smallest room we have had in a hotel, but that's ok. We had a tv with good channels, a fridge  and a microwave. The bed was surprisingly very comfortable. The only thing I disliked was the shower. I think we might have gotten a handicap room which we don't need, or maybe not and all the showers are like that? I'm not sure. The curtains had stains on them but that was about it. Everything else was clean and we checked thoroughly. It was sufficient for 2 nights and for the money.

Days Inn Anaheim is a disgustingly dirty hotel/motel.  The professional pictures make the rooms look much better than they are.  The carpet in the room was very dirty and the room had a really bad smell.  I had to clean the bottom of my bedroom shoes before packing them.  The hotel is also very outdated.  We would have relocated to another hotel but town appeared pretty crowded and my stay was only two nights.  I plan to visit Anaheim again in the near future and I would NEVER stay there again nor would I ever recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: I do apologize that your stay with us was not as it should have been.  I have spoken with our housekeeping team to be more aware of the carpets.

Summary: Desk clerk was super friendly and had everything ready prior to our late night arrival. Rooms were pretty standard and beds were really soft. Slept well and was pleased to be allowed a late check out. I imagine this would be convenient if you were going to Disneyland cuz it's really close to this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know that our front office team members where indeed helpful upon your arrival.  Indeed we are just 1 mile from the entrance of Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Worst hotel.  My son had allergies because of the dusts...
Summary: Worst hotel.  My son had allergies because of the dusts inside the room.  Probably from the dirty carpet and the ac ducts.  They also gave the wrong room than what was prokised and what was prepaid. We prepaid the room and upon check in, they didnt have our room and gave us a lower cost room.  We had to move three times before they got the room to match what we prepaid.

Be careful not to confuse this Day's Inn with the one that is just north of Disneyland.  I thought we would be closer to the park then we ended up.  But you can take public transportation or the ART shuttle for fairly cheap.  Clean, in good condition, had a microwave, fridge, and free wi-fi, smallish pool and nice hot tub.  The complimentary breakfast was neither the worst nor the best I've had at a motel.  Cheap donuts and cheap cereal, but they had waffles, too.  They don't sell Disneyland tickets like the sign on their window says, but you can walk across the street to the Stanford Inn and Suites--  They sold us two 2-day 1-park tickets at a slight discount from the box office price.
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed your stay with us.  We are lucky in fact that the ART shuttle does in fact pick up and drop off right in front of our hotel.  The shuttle does run every 20-25 minutes.

Summary Heading: Good Value - Jack in the Box is Open Late Next Door!
Summary: I travel quite a bit, so Days Inn is nothing new to me.  My Wife and kids were like.. Umm dad this isn't as nice as the Marriott so I have to put it into perspective to them.  The room had a refigerator and Microwave, Wifi and plenty of power plugs.  Anaheim transit bus picks up RIGHT in front of the hotel.  True the owners could walk across the street and see the breakfast the other hotels offer, but the waffles and cerial and danish with fresh coffee and juice wasn't bad for free.  Problem with Disneyland is they want almost $7 for a pretty crappy hot dog and if you are hungry it's better to walk out the main gate and go to Denny's or Tony Romas for what hot dogs and churros would cost a family of 4.  Best part about Days Inn is it's across the street from Bucca Di Beppo and
Manager Response: Glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.  Your right we do have great restaurant near us.

Summary Heading: try the other days inn....this one needs an upgrade.
Summary: Ok, let's start with 75% of the tv channels not working. Ok, Disneyland...i know i know...but when you're in the hotel room (and it's near halloween) being able to watch a scary movie would've been nice.  THEN...i go to take a bath and there is ZERO towels in the room, oh wait, there was one, a dirty one hanging on the back of the bathroom door. I had plopped into the tub before realizing this though. My boyfriend called downstairs and had them bring some. Oddly enough the second day, they took them all again (even though we'd not used them all) leaving no towels AGAIN...so he called AGAIN (at this point sort of agitated as he knows i enjoy a nice hot bath) and we were brought towels again. (strange towel meistering going on....)  we were in a smoking room, that had no ashtray,

We booked a room for 2 nights in October 2013.  When we checked in, there were posters on the wall stating they sold Park Hopper tickets.  When I asked the night shift clerk about them, he said they didn't sell them anymore and didn't know why the posters were still up. We also asked about shuttles to the park - he said we could buy 24-hr tickets on the bus.  When we got to the bus the next morning, the driver said they only sell one way tickets on the bus.  We had to go back to the office to buy 24-hr tickets.  When we got to the room, we found no shower curtain.  I went down to the office and the clerk said he didn't have the key to get one for me - I'd have to wail till morning.  We used towels to mop up the water after taking showers. I went back down to the office and got 2

Summary Heading: Expected better quality for a days inn
Summary: The Bad - One of the 6 pillows smelled like urine - Pillows were old, worn out and flat.  I slept pretty comfortable with two of them stacked. - Day one we had 4 pillows bed, day 2-6 for some reason we had 3 pillows per bed. - The floors were so dirty that my socks would turn black walking on them. I don't think they had been vacuumed in a long time or whatever they are using to vacuum isn't working. - The hotel was stingy with there old crappy towels. We had 4 people and they would only give us 3 towels, 1 hand towel and one wash rag.  When I asked the maid to bring more, I was told I would have to get them from the font desk. -  Every morning we awoke to the wonderful sound of crying kids, doors slamming and maids gossiping.   Overall, the biggest reason I would not stay here

Summary Heading: Good Room for the price we paid.
Summary: Overall we had good experience. Room was nice and had a flat screen tv. Bed was comfortable, Free Breakfast had waffles, pastries and donuts to eat and coffee, milk and juice to drink. The only issue we had was our toilet kept plugging up and we had to use a plunger for our stay there. Staff was friendly   and the 5 minute drive to Disneyland will keep us coming back.

I stayed at this hotel for two nights at the start of the week. The staff at check in and check out was pleasant. Breakfast selection was good and stocked, area was well maintained. An elevator would have made loading and unloading easier. Our room did not have a microwave or a fridge which would have been greatly appreciated. It did appear to have been remodeled and was clean, beds were comfortable. Thankfully our Disney tickets included parking because it would have been a long walk.

pot smokers outside our room, no frig or microwave, beds horrible, tv channels dont work half the time, wifi doesnt work, trashy, dog crap in hallways, half the ice machines dont work, maid knocks on door at 0800 to ask if you need towels if u not there they dont leave any, miserable stay. wont stay there ever again.

I'd read the reviews on Yelp before staying here and since many of them were unfavorable I was not expecting much, so I was pleasantly surprised with the accommodations.  No horror stories here.  As others here have said the room was clean and it was nice to have a fridge and microwave.  I would not hesitate to stay here again.

I had stayed At this property on a previous visit and enjoyed the stay so I decided to stay here again on a second trip to the area. However my brother tried to check in and the man at the desk wouldn't let him because I was the one who had originally made the reservation. We tried to have him speak to me on the phone because I was in disneyland already but he wouldn't even talk to me and said I had to call whoever I made my reservation with to add him as an authorized check- in individual. So I called the main days inn reservations number which I had originally called and the man on that line kept saying he couldn't find my reservation and wouldn't help me with anything. I knew for a fact that I did have a reservation because I had gotten an email with the confirmation and I

What went well:  Allowed to park at the hotel and ride the ART to Disneyland even BEFORE checking in as well as after checking out since there is plenty of parking.
