Housekeeping staff person we ran into was pleasant and helpful.  Room seemed clean, plus we love that it had a microwave and refrigerator.  Quick response from maintenance for a non-flushing toilet.  Front desk staff was playful.  Breakfast included waffles, donuts, danishes, apple juice, orange juice, and coffee.  I think there might have also been cereal.  Located right next door to Jack in the Box.  What needs improvement: Our particular room (202) was in a "hallway" between the front and back of the hotel.  We had a light shining in our room all night long, plus any noise from the street or otherwise echoed off
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know about your stay. I have advised our maintenance team members regarding the light that goes into the room fron the hallway and to see about what we can do about he echoing noise coming from the street.  I have also spoken with our housekeeping team members regarding taking time to put more care into details.

Summary: On May 29, 2013 I made a reservation for your hotel at Days Inn Main Gate  (714) 750-5211  When I made this reservation I requested 2 rooms for 4 nights starting October 6, 2013. I made a request for these rooms to be adjoining rooms and that one person in my party was in a wheelchair  I chose this Hotel for 3 reasons It says wheelchair Accessible.  It says that my party of 7 can have adjoining rooms  It says there is a heated pool  When we arrived at your hotel the Girl at the front desk was very rude.  She got upset with us when we asked for the rooms that we requested. She said that not only does my party not have adjoining rooms that we had rooms on the second floor of your hotel that does not have an elevator.  I said that will not work with a wheelchair and she said it is
Manager Response: I have spoken with our front desk team members regarding much better customer service.  We do try to honor the REQUESTS that are made by our guest to make their stay as enjoyable as possible.  As we wear sold out we did have to move people around to make sure that your rroms where next to each other. Unfortunatelyour both our adjoining and accessable rooms were occuppied by other guest thru out your stay.

Summary: The girl at the front desk was very very nice. My stay there was excellent. The location was perfect for meeting with my family.
Manager Response: I'm glad that our front desk team members were nice and helpful to you and that you enjoyed your visit with your family members.

Summary Heading: Plumbing, barking dog in next room, and room overcrowed with furniture.
Summary: Poor at best. The plumbing did not work properly, there was a barking dog in the next room, and our room was crowded with spare furniture.
Manager Response: I do apologize that your stay was not enjoyable.  Our hotel does accept small dog and for that there maybe barking. We do try to get ahold of the dogs owner to advise them to calm the dog down.  I have advised our maintenance team members regarding the extra furniture and also the plumbing issues.

Summary: Needs some modernization and breakfast could be better. People In general are really Nice. Fair price. Localization is also good, you can walk until Disney parks with no issues and there are some shoppings around. Security can be also improved.
Manager Response: I'm glad you enjoyed your stay with us. Hope to see you back soon.

Summary: Stay was good.  Bed was comfortable.  Room was clean.  All in all visit was nice and enjoyable.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know that our team members made your stay enjoyable.

Summary: Thank you for the great stay. Your beds are comfortable. Breakfast choices were great.  Overall wonderful stay. Will come back again.
Manager Response: Glad you had an enjoyable stay with us. Hope to see you soon.

Summary: For the price of our stay i was pretty pleased. Free breakfast and the service was nice. The room was cleaned daily and it was sanitary. The hotel is not within walking distance of the Disney park. I enjoyed my stay. I didn't expect a super great hotel because i didn't have a lot of money to spend on my hotel room but with what i paid i was given a good room.
Manager Response: We are a mile from the main entrance to the park which can be a walk. There is a shuttle provided by the Anaheim Resort Transportation, that does pick up right under our Days Inn Sign.  They run the hours of Disneyland.

Summary: over all good room rate  good location..friendly staff. shopping and food within walking distance.Staff helped with internet and map printing.
Manager Response: Glad that our team was helpful with your internet and map printing needs.

Summary: Overall, it was worth what we paid. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean, the location was great. There was no elevator which was a little rough for a tired family with a lot of luggage at the end of a long day. My biggest complaint was the breakfast, which was the bare, bare minimum. I don't think some flavored coffee creamer and fruit loops for the kids would be too much to ask. =) But, for what we paid, the hotel was a great value and we would stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for let us know that our Team members are friendly and that our housekeeping team is up on their job.

Summary: I would not stay here again, the rooms were run down the front desk folks were so rude and nasty and when we put our do not disturb  they still came into our room.
Manager Response: We have spoke with ALL our team members in regards to the front desk being rude which is unacceptable.  Also our housekeeping team has been advised as to the do not disturb sign on door and to follow the protical.

Summary: The Receptionist  or who ever Checked me in was very un professional You guys had said I had booked 2 rooms I have no record of me booking 2 rooms you charged over 140, more then I was supposed  to be charged no so no souviners. Cus you didn't take it off my credit card til 1 day after I got back home.
Manager Response: Unfortunately the central reservation dept did make a mistake a book 2 rooms.  We did issue the credit back into the account but unfortunately it did take a day or so to go back in.

Summary: We stayed at a Good Nite Inn that was much nicer for much less cost the day before. We stayed here because it was a Days Inn that posted Day Break breakfast and shuttle to Disneyland. The Breakfast was a joke.  They were constantly out of the Danish & donuts & milk. They were very slow to respond to our requests and made us wait. The breakfast room is tiny and there are many rooms full of people. We had to eat in shifts or eat standing up or take food back to the room, which is very inconvenient.  They could not get the waffle maker to work, the waffles were torn and crumbled on our plates even when we asked for the staff to help us. Who wants to eat a mess? There was one syrup container and we had to keep passing it around and ask for it from other patrons. We were all

We booked this hotel only because of few things: name "maingate" thinking it will be relatively close to Disneyland and their complimentary shuttle, but  it turned out to be couple of miles from the actual main gate and they didnt have any complimentary shuttles.The condition of this place was very poor and run down, hot breakfast was a joke, we ended up eating else where. Will never stay there again.

This hotel was conveniently located at one of the ART bus stops and was a short ride from the Disneyland entrace.  It was super cheap, so I wasn't expecting much.  It was quite clean, which is a big plus.  The breakfast doesn't amount to much though.

Summary Heading: Sickening-the health dept should shut it down!
Summary: I stayed here with a group so I had no choice of the accommodations, nor could I leave. The room itself was very large, lots of towels, plenty of room. However, when I pulled the covers back to check the bed, I was appalled. The mattress and box springs were stained with what could only be described as a bloody mess. It covered about 1/4th of the mattress and 1/8th of the box springs. I checked the other bed and it was filthy as well, but not as bad. Luckily, I had blankets in my truck . I put the blankets on the bed and tried to sleep but my mind could only come up with what had happened in that room.  I let the front desk know and the gal was very shocked. When we came back, nothing had changed in the room, the beds were made up nice and pretty but the filth lurked underneath.
Manager Response: I do apologize that your stay was not a good stay with us.

Summary Heading: The Hotel is exactly what I expected.
Summary: I've stayed at a couple of Days Inn hotel chains before.  The stay was just like the others - average.   The beds are comfortable, the AC is cold and the showers give off intense HEAT.  The breakfast could inculde some form of protein though.  Also, IDK why but the carpet turns your foot bottom dark (noticeable in the shower).     Not too cool.  Other than that, the experience was great and the location is awesome!
Manager Response: Glad you had a great experience with us.  We have let our maintenance team know about the carpet so they can take care of that situation.

Summary: We were quite disappointed with the overall accommodation at Days Inn.  We have travelled extensively throughout the USA and Canada and have found the rooms poorly serviced.  The pool area was very dirty with garbage and the outdoor furniture filthy.  The bedding was old and uncomfortable and our room was not properly serviced during out stay.  The rate we paid was higher than quoted on the website.

There were never enough towels and washclothes left for the entire family, there was mold in the shower, there was a roach in the drawer, the selection at the breakfast was poor (only waffles that didn't get done in the middle, donuts, danish, toast, an orange or apple or cereal) and the hotel overall was very noisy.  You could hear every door close because they slam shut and people even just walking upstairs at all hours of the night not that they were trying to keep you up just that apprently there is no insulation between the floors.  If you want to get any sleep, don't stay here.

Summary Heading: Ok but needs more sound proofing
Summary: We stayed here for 10 nights - it was ok for the price. It looked a bit like the room hadn't been upgraded for about 20 years, eg wouldn't take much to do new caret, new bed duvet and some upgrade in the furniture, would help heaps to modernise but overall the room was very spacious and comfortable. Our main and really only  complaint Is that it was rather noisy and the rooms have very little sound proofing so we had some rather bad sleeps, or just not being able to get to sleep. it comes with breakfast which is avg overall I guess you pay for what you get, and we were happy with what was provided especially fruit being available.

I got this room for my son for his honemoon.  They couldn't even sleep on the bed and since they arrived late that evening, they had to stay that night, so went to a Walmart and bought blankets to lay on.  The bed was filthy, the bathroom was dirty, there were bugs on the floor, and it smelled bad.  They went to the manager to get a refund and were told they had to stay that night, so they did, but we better get a refund for the remaining days, because they left the next day and went to another hotel.  WE HAVE PICTURES DOCUMENTING ALL OF THIS, INCLUDING THE BUGS.

The staff here were very nice to us, but it bothered me that the day manager treated the staff poorly in the office. They need someone to staff the breakfast, nobody was ever there to restock the food. There is a definite shortage of towels. We  couldn't get extra for swimming, and they only brought one, saying it was all they had. The next day they came for our dirty towels in the morning because they "needed" them, and then we didn't get any clean ones until almost 5 hours later, not even a hand towel. On the plus side, we had fun in the pool and jacuzzi, and an employee who seemed to be a day porter was very nice.

Summary Heading: room carpet was filthy(got dirty feet when I was barefoot...
Summary: room carpet was filthy(got dirty feet when I was barefoot).  The coffee pot was broken and their hotel made coffee was gross.  The swimming pool was tiny.

The front help was less than that.  The first room I was shown smelled like a bottle of disinfectant was dumped on the floor and the beds sagged deeply.  The room had not been refurbished in a long time.  At $84 a night, it was in an iffy neighborhood.  I won't be back.

Summary Heading: You Get What You Pay For
Summary: This hotel was average, there was nothing majorly wrong with the hotel except our bathtub drainage was partially clogged so it didn't drain the water immediately. Either than that breakfast was okay (waffles, toast, pastries, some fruit, juices and coffee/tea) but what we liked most is the shuttle which took us to and from Disneyland (it runs approximately every 20 minutes); if you feel like walking it's about 10-15 minutes depending on your speed plus there's quite a few restaurants along the street and Target is about a 10 minute walk away too.
Manager Response: The shuttle is provided by A.R.T. the cost is $5.00 for adults and $2.00 for kids ages 3-9.  It does pick up right in front of our hotel for you.  Thank you for address the issue with the shower or team members have take action to get that situation fixed

Summary: This was a great stay at the Days Inn Anaheim. It was comfortable and very close to Disneyland and other shopping areas. I will come back soon.

I made my reservations over a month before we went.  I asked for a frig.  Did not get a frig.  I paid extra for a frig.  The room is a basic room.  2 beds little work table sink and long counter toilet and bathtub/shower.  Breakfast was so so.  2 kinds of cereal, waffle maker, donuts, bread to make toast, juice, coffee  small room.  My daughter went to Jack in the Box for breakfast my son didn't eat and I had the cereal.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know about your stay.  Some of our rooms have a frig and microwave in them. That would be the 2 Queens and also the Single King room. Unfortunately the 2 Double bed rooms do not have the frig and microwave. We do hope to have them in all our rooms soon.

Summary: very clean room there was mold they would not clean it and we told them everyday.the last day we were there they cleaned it a little bit.
Manager Response: Our housekeeping team members have been advised on the proper cleaning regarding any mold issues that may come up.

Summary Heading: This is located close to Disneyland, grocery stores, fast...
Summary: This is located close to Disneyland, grocery stores, fast food and Target. It's away from all the congestion and we just love it
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed your stay with us.

Summary: Very nice staff, rooms are clean, a short bus ride (14 or 15 dollars for a family of 4 day pass) to Disney, can be loud but the reception respond quickly to any issues if you let them know.  We had a week here and as our base it was great! No complaints. Thanks!
Manager Response: Glad our team member where able to take care of the noise complaint that you had in a timely manner.

Summary: our stay was ok . the rooms were big. Front desk were very helpful. The Day Breakfeast was not what I expected needs to improve on.The carpet needs to be steam clean.The queen beds are small queens. I would stay again if some improvements get done.

Summary Heading: Good value, great location.  For the money this hotel was...
Summary: Good value, great location.  For the money this hotel was pretty good, no real complaints other than there was no soap in the shower.

Summary Heading: Average place to stay with good breakfast.  Not that close...
Summary: Average place to stay with good breakfast.  Not that close to Disneyland.  Needed bus or car--too long of a walk.

Got what we kind of expected for around Disneyland at a cheap rate...that allowed pets. Rooms not the cleanest. Towels rough. Safe didn't work but was still charged for it daily. Not a lot of choices at the breakfast.

Summary Heading: You definitely get what you pay for
Summary: On our latest trip to Disneyland in June 2013, we were looking for a reasonably priced hotel that was within walking distance to the park. We misjudged with the Days Inn Anaheim Maingate. It's probably a good half hour walk (minimum) from the gates, but the ART shuttle stops outside the hotel. It's $5 for a day pass, which is a good value, and the buses come by every 20 minutes. The rooms appeared to be as clean as they can get, given the obviously dated decor. The rug in our room is in desperate need of replacement, and the bathroom tiles and slip-mat in the tub looked grungy. The shower curtain also needs to be replaced, as it is almost short of the edge of the tub. It flapped in the breeze from the water and offered minimal protection from keeping the bathroom from flooding,

Summary Heading: Not sure I am staying in Days Inn again
Summary: My family and I recently stayed at the Days Inn Maingate in Anaheim.  It wasn't horrible but it was not very satisfying either.  To start, before we left for Anaheim I called the hotel to verify our reservations and they were there but they had us in a smoking room, to which I did not reserve, my daughter who is 4 yrs old has asthma/allergies and I would never of booked a smoking room. And when I called the actual hotel they told me they were going to charge me more for another room so I called the 1800 number and the gentlemen who helped me straightened the whole thing out. They say they are walking distance to the Disney parks and they are 2.5 miles away, not close enough for walking and then having to walk the parks all day. The bathroom shower/tub was full of mold from the

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Nothing fancy, average place but reflected by the price. If wanting to stay somewhere cheap, not too far from Disneyland then Days Inn does the job. Breakfast very average, but we didn't expect much. Some reception staff are very friendly, others are just ok.

This was my 2nd stay here, and the first time was better. My room smelled strongly of mildew. The breakfast was good, but the food was often not refilled when it needed to be. I had to get the attention of staff for refills on cereal, donuts, coffee. Aside from that, the staff was respectful. I would consider them again, but maybe not when the hotel was completely booked.

Upon reading the reviews of the hotel I was nervous about staying here. When I called the hotel to inform them of my late arrival, they guaranteed my room will be available till midnight. We get here and it was an easy checkin process, it's a good location for families and all the important restaurants "McDonalds" are in the area. The best part Disney is one mile from here and it's on the same street as the hotel.......... The only issue I would say that I had was, there was no microwave in the room. Overall friendly staff, decent room, & great location. Would recommend if you need a decent priced room for a short stay
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Our 2Queen rooms and also our King rooms have the microwave and refrigorator hope this helps for your next visit with us.

Summary: We ended up having to bring our dogs on our trip so we needed a pet friendly hotel. This was a nice pet friendly hotel. Not as close to Disneyland as I thought but if you are willing to walk a bit several long blocks you will get to the main gate. The hotel is a little older but seems to be well maintained, I was surprised at how quite it was (well insulated) I wish the breakfast room was open a little later for the days I want to sleep in but the food was pretty good. It was a pretty good place for the price.
Manager Response: We always have Pet friendly rooms available for for our special "family members" that we travel with.  Hope to see you again on your next trip to Disneyland.

Summary: Days Inn Anaheim Maingate would imply that this hotel is closer to Disneyland than it really is.  But there is a shuttle stop right outside the property and the cost of $5 is a small price to pay.  We were on the top floor and at night (If we were back in time) we could watch the Disneyland fireworks from our room.  The room was clean, the linen was fresh and all the amenities were in good working order. Staff were knowledgable and very helpful. Pool and jacucci were well maintained. The one fault would be the free breakfast, the breakfast room was tiny and the food wasn't replenished often enough.  Out of the 12 days we were there, we only managed to get breakfast 3 times.  Apart from this issue, a good place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about the issues that you had with the breakfast food not being replenished often. I have spoken with our breakfast team members to be on top of this.

Summary: The Days Inn Anaheim Maingate was a little further away from Disneyland than the name implies, but it is still within walking distance or you can pay the $5 a day to take the shuttle. Clean, beds were comfortable, nice amenities--microwave, refrigerator, iron, ironing board, hair dryer--as well as a small pool and jacuzzi. Would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Kimberly, Thank you for advising us regarding the dust and the freshness of the food in our breakfast item.  New training has been done for our team members.

Summary: Food was not fresh, rooms were dusty and hard to breathe in. The was mold in the bathroom and the service for getting extra towels was rediculous. I feel that the hotel needs remodleing or at least some thorough cleaning. The price was good and the beds were comfortable despite the atmosphere . overall the hotel was not the best "cheap"hotel. I wouldn't stay there agian.
Manager Response: I do apologize for the issues that you had while stayinig with us. These where brought to the attention of our maintenance team members to help improve the hotel.

Summary: This hotel exceeded my expectations since it was the lowest price I could find on a weekend where all hotels surrounding Disneyland were priced high due to a 24 hour Disneyland event.  Since my wife and I were attending the event, all we needed was a room to nap in, so we weren't looking for much and went with the lowest price we could find.  The associates at the check in desk were awesome, the room was clean, and the a/c worked great!  We were pleasantly surprised!
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed the 24 hours at Disneyland. Hope to see your family next time.

Summary: The Days Inn had an excellent location next to Disneyland.  The front staff was extremely helpful, great pool, and a delicious breakfast.  I would stay again. Plus an excellent price!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: This hotel was "affordable" but I will not be back!  Rooms were extremely outdated, the smell of urine was intense and blood splatter on the ceiling was the icing on the cake.  Disgusting!  Do not stay here! God forbid ask for an additional towel....they are out!

We checked in and were told they only had a disabled room with a king bed available.  After checking in we noticed almost the whole top floor was unoccupied.  Asked for late checkout as our flight was at 11.30 pm but no go.  Room smelt musty, the rubber strip between the bathroom and bedroom had nail points poking through.  The bathroom floor was so slippery when wet, we used a hand towel to stand on in the shower so we didn't slip over.  The carpet in the bedroom area was so dirty our feet were black.  You had to dress in the bathroom or your feet were dirty again.  The best was yet to come. when we went to go to sleep we discovered sp[latters of dried blood on 3 of the 5 pillows and the bottom sheet stopped almost 6 inches short of the end of the mattress.  We also found hairs

Had a concert at the Pond.  Needed a place to stay for the night.  I've stayed at Days Inn in the past so I check this place.  It was close to the venue and was a good value.   First off I was greeted by a friendly guy that quickly checked me in. There were other people in the office that were talking work stuff and I think it was the owner and his family.   I've stayed in motels where the owner was on property and it seems like those are well kept because they care about their property.   The room was nothing fancy but it did the trick. Bed was fine and room was clean.     The room I stayed in was set up for someone in a wheelchair.  Peephole was low and even the shower was accesable.  I'm not disabled but it was nice to see the room like this.  It's close to Disneyland but not

The room wasn't the worst but was definitely faaaar from the Best carpet is disgusting so I wore slippers at all times! Bed is rock hard I brought my own pillows and blankets! When we arrived for check in @about 1:am the man upfront was helping someone while another girl worker sat there & didn't even greet us so rude the man was nice ! We also could hear every noise from the street! The smell the room had was horrible mind u it was non smoking!Point is I'm never staying here again!
Manager Response: I apologize that your stay with us was not a pleasant stay with us. We do hope to improve those issues and have brought them up to our team members.

Summary: My husband and I stayed for 9 days in the days inn maingate. It was dirty stained carpets beds are hard as a Rock house keeping didn't do anything but make your bed and give you fresh towels.  The bath tube was so slimy looks like it hadn't been cleaned in a long time. The pool and hot tube both very dirty and not maintained the mattress and box spring are very stained smell nasty. The only good thing about this hotel was the friendly staff at the front desk we felt with three people at the front desk and they were great. But over all not a good experience at this hotel.
Manager Response: I apologize for the issues that you had while you stayed with us. These issues have been given to our maintenance team members to be more pro active.

Summary Heading: Fair value, great location for Disneyland
Summary: Offers a fair value.  Close to Disneyland and on the ART bus transportation route.  The included breakfast is limited, but adequate, offering waffles, bagels toast and pastries.  The limited seating in the breakfast area was a bit disappointing, since the hotel was very busy, but we were able to sit outside on a beautiful day.  The included WiFi was a plus, but often slow or difficult to connect; possibly because there were many people using it.  The room was clean, but not fancy.  Overall, we were happy with the hotel, and would book again for the value.

Our stay here was ok. You get what you pay for. A cheap place to stay. The bed was extremely uncomfortable, the breakfast is pretty basic, and if your looking for a hotel near the parks this is not for you! The staff was friendly at least, except upon arrival one of gentleman was not very pleasant.
Manager Response: I have spoke with our team members at the front desk regarding customer service needs to be done with a smile.

Summary Heading: Inexpensive, free breakfast, short bus ride to Disney
Summary: A good basic hotel. I was greeted promptly on check in. My room was clean & comfortable. There's a small pool & hot tub I did not visit, but walked by.  For breakfast there were make your own waffles, toast, pastries, and cereal.  The hotel is on the 43 bus line that has a stop by Disneyland's entrance. It's a ten minute ride, if that.  At $2/passenger, it is cheaper than the shuttle that stops by the Days Inn.  Check Google for the 43 bus schedule. On the return trip the drivers were very helpful when I made sure to tell them I wasn't sure what my stop was (it's Harbor-Wilken).  My room key card stopped working and the hotel staff quickly resolved the problem with a smile.  They also refilled coffee, made change for me, and gave me a plastic bag.  Check out was very quick.  I
Manager Response: Thank you for let us know which bus route is available to our guest. :)

Summary: Overrall it was pretty good stay, we liked the area were the Hotel is, very convinient; the room was pretty well mantained and clean, and of course the staff very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time  out of your busy schedule to let us know how we are doing.

Summary Heading: I think one thing that people can expect of a hotel is a...
Summary: I think one thing that people can expect of a hotel is a clean room. However, in most of the drawers in the room there were garbage... chewed gum, fast food garbage. Also, the room was non-smoking and smelled very strongly of smoke. And not as close to Disneyland as the hotel's website states. I would not stay here again and I would not recommend it to family or friends.

We got a great rate on Priceline and the room was sparse but adequate.  It does have a coffee-maker. The digital clock in the room was way fast and that messed us up a little when we rushed to breakfast before it ended, and then found out we were early.  The maid should correct the clock if it is not close to accurate.  The tube TV was a reasonable size but it made the room feel dated.   We were in the back building so it was quiet at night. The breakfast was basic but adequate in a town where few hotels offer free breakfast.  It's nice to not have to go out for breakfast, which throws out your ruitine when staying at a hotel, especially for just one night.  It must not be the Disneyland Maingate referenced in the name because that maingate is nowhere in sight. Luckily we were
Manager Response: Michael, thank you for let us know that we need to double check the clocks in the rooms. Our team members have taken more notice of the clocks in the rooms.

Summary: Left a horrible hotel late at night after long day of vacation activities. came here hoping for the best and was very happy! Clean room, clept great on the beds, very clean facility! Breakfast was included though we slept in and missed it! Very happy with our stay!
Manager Response: Kimberly, I'm glad our team was able to make your trip a success.

Summary Heading: The room was clean, the bed comfortable.  This facility had...
Summary: The room was clean, the bed comfortable.  This facility had been recently remodeled / upgraded rooms.  They should have replaced the shower curtains with sliding doors, and dumped the old  dinosaur TV and replaced it with a wall mounted LCD TV.  If they had done this, I would rate this room as a "10".  The front desk service was wonderful.  I think they need to have someone in Grandma's kitchen monitoring and replacing items in their continental breakfast as needed.  Maybe extend the breakfast time one more hour.
Manager Response: Dear Mark, We are working on getting some more upgrades done to the rooms. I do hope that when you come back to the Disneyland area we will have completed them.  Thank you for taking time to let us know how we are doing.

Summary: I called several times prior to arrival. Front desk mis-informed me of several things including paying at time of check out. Wifi was not avaiable in my room 220. Too for from office I'm assuming. I was not able to connect to complete my homework. I was told this hotel was within walking distance to the maingate, this in NOT the case. Very unhappy. The rates were more then I paid last I brought my family to Disneyland and we stayed accross the way at the Hilton! Lady at the front desk was grump too!!

Summary Heading: Good Location/Best Value stay for Disneyland
Summary: I always stay at this hotel when visiting as it is close in proximity to Disneyland having the bus station just outside and plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The hotel staff was great this last trip when I mixed up dates of my stay and emailed them they got back to me quickly and corrected my dates! It is a good hotel for the value, sure the Disney hotels or other surrounding are nice but for a fraction of the cost the Days Inn is a clean place to stay. Now for the $50 dollars a night it is not first class as there continental breakfast is lacking and rooms are not high quality but again for the price for a small family its the best value for the trip! I gladly recommend this days inn to others

Summary Heading: My wife left her wrist watch in the room after check out...
Summary: My wife left her wrist watch in the room after check out and was not found when we came back... when my wife called the front desk about an hour after check out that she left her watch on top of the tv in the room, she was told that we can come back anytime to get it. She thought they got it. But when we're back to hotel toget it, thats the only time she called somebody (in spanish) to ask about it. She told my wife to go to the room and check it.room is already clean of course and no watch!  Another worse thing, the carpet is terrible! Very dirty.your feet gets dirty in just few minutes.the price is cheap but maybe a clean carpet is a must ! And an honest hotel staff is priority!

Summary Heading: This hotel has some of the rudest people at the front desk...
Summary: This hotel has some of the rudest people at the front desk. When we got there we found out we had been charged double and they refused to even help fix the issue. They gave us a phone number and told me I had to fix it my self. When we got to the room it was a dirty and and broken outlet 3 lamps that did not work, The morning I went to talk to the manger he was not there is was "busy" handling an issue.

Location was farther away from Disneyland unable to walk there. Little selection for breakfast. Unable to get an extra pillow they said they did not have extra pillows.  Had to request towels for 4 when we booked for 4 people. Needed to keep air conditioner on due to window not able to open. Air conditioner was loud. Price was great. Plenty of parking. Limited TV channels. Small pool area.

Our "non-smoking" room reeked of smoke.  When we said the room was not was we reserved and was unacceptable, we were told stay or not, we would be charged.  The drains in our handicapped bathroom were at high points, so that when you showered, the bathroom floor was covered with a quarter inch of water.  The bathroom and shower tiles were slippery and represents a safety hazard.  The hotel staff could care less.  Very frustrating to travel cross country, and cannot get a simple thing like the room your reserved, and have it be clean and safe.  I contacted Wyndham about my experience in hopes that the safety issues would be fixed and that the hotel's management or staff would either get fired or get an attitude adjustment.  Played phone tag with Wyndham customer service and gave

First the good: Great location and walking distance to lots of things. Price was okay. Beds weren't bad. You can tell they've remodeled and the room was very clean. We didn't take advantage of it, but breakfast was included.  Now the Bad:  1. The showerhead did not work properly.  2. The safe was already locked when we got there so we called the office and someone came up and couldn't fix it. When we checked out we noticed they charged us for the safe. We told them ours didn't work and they said we should have told them (LOL!) and said they were not able to reverse the fee.  3. The towels are very small, thin and rough. I would have brought my own had I known how bad they would be.  4. The televisions are older so reception is terrible. This was bad for us since a member of our
Manager Response: I do apologize on behave of our team.  The things that you mentioned should have been taken care of for you when you mentioned then to the desk.  Our team has been re trained to make sure that when a guest has an issue to take care of them as soon as possible.

Summary: Excellent customer service especially Joel. Not bad for price paid but outside was pretty noisy but had earplugs. Shower was a handicap bthroom. Lots of room but water creeped onto floor due to no containment of water other than curtain.we just made a barrier of towels on floor. Room was pretty clean. I would suggest not getting room facing the jack n the box due to u will here lots noise from there. My room was facing a side street.

After reading several reviews i didnt know what to expect.but it was a nice motel.walking distance to the park.also there is a nearby target walgreens and a liquor store lol.the phones wouldnt call the front desk thats the only thing i didnt like.
Manager Response: Thank you Disney Mommie for the review. We have taken a look at the phones in the room. We have in fact changed a few phones. Thank you for letting us know.

Summary Heading: Stay AWAY from this chain entirely!
Summary: Their online reservation system booked two SAME reservations one minute apart (I only booked one).  They have been holding my money and promising to fix for over a week-gave me a date to fix and on that date took more money out and promised another few days!  I have to turn this in to my attorney and the bank fraud department - if that had just cancelled the extra erroneous reservation they could easily have booked the rooms for someone else!!  NO CUSTOMER SERVICE - promised to call - didn't JUST TOOK MORE MONEY - BEWARE!!!!

Summary Heading: Not the best service or cleanliness!!
Summary: The floors were dirty and the place was covered in dust.  The tub and toillet looked like it had not been cleaned and the pillows had a odd smell to them.  I just used my own pillows and blankets from home and I was okay.  The breakfast lounge doesn't look very neat and it seems really un-organized. The microwave and fridge were not clean and had a funny smell. The tv and remote did not work.
Manager Response: Dear Julia, I have spoken to our team members regarding the lack of housekeeping and breakfast area not being up to par.  We have taken steps to improve these issues.

Summary Heading: My stay at Days Inn Anaheim Maingate
Summary: Days Inn Anaheim Maingate, is close to all aminities, Desneyland Park, quite area and it's affordable rates. Its good for budget travelers like me. I will stay here again next time.
Manager Response: Dear Leny, We look forward to seeing you next year.  Call the phone directly so that we may give you the best rate possible.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, close to Disney
Summary: We just got back from a family vacation to Disneyland and stayed five nights at this Inn. I have no complaints, the rooms were clean, the staff was great, there have waffles for breakfast and the hot tub was just what we needed each night after the park. House keeping was great they would not only clean the room but would fold our personal blankets and even set up our son's stuffed animals on his bed standing or sitting (he thought this was so awesome by the way). I would defiantly stay there again!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know how our Housekeeping team did.  I'm glad they went out of their way to make your little one feel special.

Summary: This hotel was recently renovated.  You can see the new paint and new furniture.  They did not do a good job patching prior to painting but everything was very clean.  The room was a bit small but fine for the two of us.  We spent two nights and would do it again for the bargain rate we got.  This is not a Hilton but you get what you pay for.  We loved the fact that all was very clean and that breakfast was included.  Not a full breakfast but there was fresh fruit, juice, pastries, cereal, and waffels.  This was the heart of vacation land and we enjoyed the stay.

I had a conference at the nearby Hyatt Regency and needed a relatively inexpensive place to stay.  The Days Inn had the price I was looking for, but I was pleasantly surprised with the amenities I found there.  The rooms may not be the fanciest around (I didn't expect that), but the fridge, microwave, and Target just down the street made cheap eating really easy.  The staff was polite, and everything I had in the room functioned properly.  My only regret was that the free continental breakfast had no protein, so I ended up just eating my own food.  All in all, however, this was a good stay.

Summary Heading: People in room above us kept running and jumping the entire...
Summary: People in room above us kept running and jumping the entire night.  After calling to main office someone did knock on the door, but it still continued throughout the night.  The phone was across from the bed next to the TV.   So in addition to being up from the people upstairs, I had to get out of bed to call the office.  Breakfast room was not kept stocked and no one in room to tell.  Out of coffee at 7:30 am.  Hotel was not right across the street from Disneyland as told when making the reservation.  Minimum parking.  Very few channels on the TV.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know about your stay with us.  I have spoke with our team member to advise them of walking the property more often so as this may not happen again.  We have also put a team member in our breakfast area to make sure that we do have breakfast items for our guest.

Summary: The mattress was not comfortable, there was a loud noise coming from the tub when we turned on the sink. So had to move. Dropped my phone behind bed pulled out to get it and found all kind of garbage and empty vodka bottle. Yuck.. Not enough bath towels when asked for more they were not  cleaned yet.

Summary Heading: Perfectly acceptable if you're just here to sleep!
Summary: I spent four nights at Days Inn Anaheim Maingate, and it really wasn't as bad as some of the other recent reviews here state, although perhaps I just got a bit lucky.  I'll start off by stating that my stay here was exceedingly cheap. I found a great deal online, and wasn't expecting greatness. No, I just wanted a decent, safe place to sleep at a good price - and that's exactly what I got.  I knew I'd be arriving later than the stated check-in time, so I emailed the hotel in advance, and the staff member who checked me in was polite, courteous and helpful.  The room was of an adequate size - completely fine for a lone traveller or a couple - and the bathroom was pretty large! As I was there as a tourist, I only planned to spend the nights at the hotel, and so it had everything I

Owner and clerk called animal control and threatened to kill my cat even though IT CLEARLY STATES they allow pets on their website and on the phone. I missed 2 important business as he called me in the middle of the meeting and demanded i leave my meeting and threatened to kill my cat if I didn't come back right away and evacuate them from the hotel. My wife and kid also lost a whole day of Disneyland pass interrupted becasue of his irrational hatred towards cats. I hope some justice will be served to this evil little man. Any lawyers with cats please book a room and see what happens. I am and will do everything in my power to make sure this hotel's exposed to the world. He also charged $1500 on my credit card even though I was booked for 4 days @ $89/ day, but that problem's
Manager Response: Sir, When you checked into the hotel there was a sign on the front desk clearly stating that we only allow SMALL dog only.  At no time did we threaten to kill  your 3 cats.  What we asked was that your 3 cats be placed at a pet hotel/shelter.  You and your family were more than welcome to  stay with us.   The only charges to your credit card where for the nights that you stayed with us.

Summary: I arrived at about 1:30 am on Friday. The employee  working the nightshift told me that my card was declined in a rude manner. It was if we disturbed him from his slumber and he was cranky. I did not appreciate his attitude, but I just wanted my room  because I was so tired. Other than that, the female employee at the front desk was very nice and helpful. Overall, I was satisfied. It would be nice if in the future, Days inn would have a shuttle service to and from Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you taking time to give us a review.  I have spoken with our team members regarding customer service.  We hope your next stay to be more enjoyable.

Summary: Mother of all Lords, thanks for saving me. Me and my daughter had to participate in the Disney Tinker Bell Marathon and had to stay somewhere close by as the race as at 5:45 AM in the morning. So even though we live in Stevenson Ranch driving 61 miles this early was a bad idea so we opted for a cheap hotel. Check was not great ..When I asked for an extra hour for check-out the stiff guy said no as the room is fully booked for next day. I went to room and after a few hours called anonymously for 6 rooms for a last minute Disneyland trip. Guess what ! He pulled 6 empty rooms from his rear end for the next day. Overall the hotel and block around it is dark and dimly lighted. Not sure if they are trying to save money or something. If without the Jack in the Box across the entrance,
Manager Response: We do apologize that your experience with us was not up to par.  With the marathon it does make it difficult to do late check out.  We have our team take more care of the breakfast items to make sure they are go.  Thank you fortaking time to give us a review

Summary: Luli at the front desk was a MAJOR help. I overslept and missed my Amtrak train out of Anaheim and she got me a taxi to downtown L.A. in like 5 minutes. Also was a big help with instructions on how to get to Disneyland. Very nice expierence. Will be staying again.
Manager Response: Thank you, Im glad that our team was able to help you during your stay. :)

Summary: The carpets are very dirty passing a white towel on them revealed that they were black with crud. The room did not smell fresh. There was dirt and hair both on bathroom floor and in shower. The safe was broken and hotel by default wanted to charge me for that service. I refused and they cancelled the charge. Breakfast was OK although for two days we had to request milk and coffee which ran out each time. We were supposed to come back to this hotel a week later and instead reserved at the near by Holiday Inn. For $10 more with the entertainment rebate it was a far better deal. I have traveled to many other Days Inn and must admit this is simply the worst  one I have ever been in.

Lilly morning staff no welcome. She said 2 rooms reserved advised her only 1 room since party of 3 was told have to pay no military discount told could pay @ check in but my card ran w/o my knowledge.
Manager Response: I have spoken with our team members in regards to both the cleanliness of the rooms and the activation of rooms keys.  We have had retraining for the team member to improve on our customer service.

Summary: The was close enough to Disneyland to work for a trip down at a decent price.  The beds are too soft, the shower walls had hair left on them when cleaned; meaning that the room was not inspected well enough.  The room rate was not correct when I arrived and had to provide my email confirmation to get it fixed.  The hotel charges for the safe in the room at time of check-in and they expect you to tell them you did not use the safe to get the refund at checkout, very unprofessional.  The breakfast area was not well stocked and the choices were not good.  The keys worked great until the last night and the front desk agent said that I must have deactivated them.  I am someone who has assisted in the running of hotels for years and the manner in which I was treated when I needed to

This was a great location for Disneyland.   We did have some miscommunication with the front desk concerning the shuttle buses to Disneyland, but we resolved taht problem by driving and parking the next day.

room was outdated but clean. the remote to the t.v. didn't work properly. the air conditioning unit squeaked so loud we couldn't keep it on. minor inconveniences, but overall a good value for the price.

Good for the price, had to change out light bulbs, no back on the remote, breakfast wasn't too bad. The staff is friendly. Not sure how this was recently updated?? Rooms need new towels, looked like rags.

This had the potential to be a much nicer place. porno blankets had to go, terrible millwork (crown moldings around doors) no valance or sheer curtain meaning it was either totally closed window or totally open. also the window locks were ineffective - only one near the bottom, not two, and they were loose and the window was shaky. anybody could have broken in. it doesn't take big expensive consultants to improve room decor for little money. the furniture was cheap, but who cares, it was clean and in good shape. the bland wall colors were another opportunity that was missed. don't add senior citizen home paintings, just watch HGTV. the hot tub was very nice. the pool a little chilly. washer/dryer on pool deck was convenient, but too exposed. pool area needed better decor.
Most everything was very good.  The TV stations were a little screwed up and some channels listed were not there.

Summary Heading: Decent... if your looking for a place to sleep.
Summary: This was another Priceline Name Your Own Price bid we won.  It was close to Disneyland, ART bus just outside the hotel. It also had a Jack in the Box steps away for those late night snacks.  The Pros:  We liked how close it was to the park. We could leave the park come home, shower and head back and not been away from the park for more then an hour. The free wifi and parking was awesome. We drove from Vancouver, BC and noticed some hotels had a “resort fee” The staff was very nice. We didn’t meet a rude person. In fact everyone in that hotel seemed polite and happy for the most part. The room was spacious for the price. King bed, 5 pillows, 2 night stands, a dinning table, etc.  The room had a smell the first night. Seemed like a water issue. When the bathtub would be  on the

The hotel was good for the money. The location was not too far from Disneyland and the rooms were in decent condition. I have stayed on better, but I have stayed in a lot worse as well. Right next door to Jack in the Box which is my favorite. The parking lot is not do great, kinda small and difficult to get in to and out of. The hot tub was not that hot. Make sure to have enough clean clothes cause the "laundry facility" they have is one or two washers and driers by the pool and is $5 for one wash & dry. They also don't provide toiletries for free so make sure you have your own toothbrush, paste, shampoo or what you need. If by chance you forget, there is a Target near by or you can pay a pretty penny to buy them from the front desk.

Summary Heading: I should have paid attention to the other reviews....
Summary: The only positive about this stay was the young man at the desk that evening when we checked out.  Otherwise, it was a lousy stay all the way around.  We were there for Disneyland and didn't want to get an expensive hotel as we knew we would hardly be there.  However, we didn't even get what we paid for!  When we arrived, and drug all of our luggage upstairs as there is no elevator, we discovered that on the curtain pull there was a bloody fingerprint.  It looked old enough that it was now part of the curtain pull.  Over the course of the two days we were there, we discovered another spot of blood on the wall and a spot of blood on the bedspread, proving that it hadn't been washed.  I noticed light coming in by the door and we realized the door had been shaved and no longer fit
Weekend stay to visit Disneyland. Walked to/fro venue. Staff excellent./pleasant. Room quiet and clean. No complaints. Value for the money.

We stayed at days inn while visiting disneyland..we had a wonderful time.this hotel staff was so friendly and the breakfast was just rite.the rooms very comfy and quite durning the night.the shuttle bus to disneyland picks you up rite in front...very convienent! Will stay here again!

We had a nice stay. The price was worth it compared to the price of other hotels.  You excepted pets and most others around did not.  The only issue was that the pool was closed and we would have liked to take advantage of it.

Went in open minded as the rate seemed too good to be true, but who spends more than a few hours a day in a hotel while on a trip to Disneyland? Brought left overs back to save some money, all had to be thrown out as was frozen solid. beginning of third night came back to the left over clean towels from the night before: one bath towel and one washcloth for two occupants: you do the math. Advised the hotel staff he enzyme morning but seemed like it may have been more effective to complain to Mickey Mouse, after all they already had my $ so what do they care? I'll bring my own towels from home next time:they were rough and scratchy anyway .

I have always stayed at this hotel every time I visit Anaheim and this visit was not as good as my past visits. The pool was under reconstruction and I did not have a refrigerator nor a microwave. And this stay was one of my longest stays. I stood for 6 nights. And so I was not as happy with the stay as I have been in the past. I do wish someone could of informed me of the pool under construction, due to the fact that I had three children with me at this visit and they were all looking forward to swimming.

The carpets were dirty/stained and the bathtub had chips in it. but those are minor issues. I would stay again. The pool was under construction, which we were unaware of, the website needs to be updated for things like this. With 2 kids and 90+ temps, we were planning on swimming.  I tried to make reservations online, but the website froze, THREE times.  I explained it to the person checking us in, and she didn't apologize or offer me the online rate.

I cannot even express how terrible our stay was here!!!  One issue was that my nephew was playing with his trains and was crawling around playing, when he stood up he has black stuff all over his knees and front of his feet. So we checked the bottom of his and the other people in our room and everyones feet were black from the rooms carpet. the explanation was it was from the parking lot black top being trampled in...... And that they shampoo the carpets monthly (if the month is accurate, they need to do it weekly). However there was no indication of this blackened trailings in the more common areas, so if it was being trampled in wouldn't it be everywhere? And not just the rooms?   There was crazy splatter marks across the window coverings and lampshade in one of the rooms we

Summary Heading: If you are going to need laundry, directions, kindness, service, luggage cart, this is not the place for you.
Summary: My first review: This Days Inn Anaheim Maingate is a poor representation of Days Inn.   Left here and found great motel, cleaner vents, much more customer service, luggage cart, indoor pool,  extended check out time, and laundry service advertised was actually -----------available -----unlike Days Inn Maingate where everything was broken and misinformaiton and apathy given instead of  service.    Stay anywhere else but here! The room looks nice for the price, but.... Turn on the AC/heat and even if your allergies were minor before, wheezing, runny nose/eyes, will quickly ensue. If the floor gets wet from the leaking micro-mini fridge, feet will feel like stepping in syrup. The TV did not work the first night, the safe could not work the entire time. . Dirty pillow and snotty,

The hotel was fine for what we were looking for, an inexpensive motel within walking distance to Disneyland.  The rooms were clean enough.  However, the complementary breakfast was simple un-eatable. We got there early and there wasn't milk for the cereal, the syrup for the waffles had been watered down to a gooey runny @*%# liquid.  The bread was stale and the donuts were soggy.  Horrible!   But other than that, and the fact the the pool was in major disrepair, our stay was fine.

Summary Heading: Very good value fo the money.
Summary: Everything was satisfactory.   Only problem was the water from the shower that I mentioned below.  We have stayed here before and will be staying here again in December.

This was a dirty place.  Shirts had blood and pee stains on them.  all the manager could say was we only change our sheets every three days and thats how all hotels do it.  we walked accross the carpet and our feet turn solid black.  I almost got sick when i saw that.   there were bugs on the a/c unit.

After reading other reviews we were rather worried about our trip. We had booked a 17 day stay before reading the bad reviews. On our arrival, we were greeted by an extremely friendly front desk staff. The rooms were very clean and our rooms were cleaned  promptly every day. We had a problem with our air conditioner in one of our rooms and it was fixed by the time we returned from Disneyland that afternoon. The only problem we had was the carpet in one room was dirty.We had to send a fax and the front desk was happy to assist us with it at no charge. I would highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel was a reasonable price and we got what we expected and  paid for Rooms are a little tired but generally ok  Breakfast was very poor and not worth bothering with - food not replaced when finished, tables not cleaned and room very small  Front desk staff were very helpful however  Walking distance to disney and a few restaurants  which was a bonus

Warning do not stay here. I am not a complainer and have never written a review before. This is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. When you check out they try and charge you for anything and everything they can come up with. They lie and make up things that aren't true. They tried to charge be an additional $133 dollars to by bill. Can you believe it! They said I got some make-up on a towel so that was $25, and I got blood on 4 pillow cases that was $40, I started my period and got a little bit of blood on a sheet and they said that was $35 for each each night. A total of $70. I argued and disputed with them over all of these items. They took off $64 dollars. They say I still owe the $69 dollars. I will be contacting headquarters of Days Inn tomorrow.
