From the time we arrived at the hotel from the moment we left it was a bad experience! The woman at the front desk was rude and unwilling to explain the charges making it seem to be a waste of time.  When we got in to our room looking around there was garbage on the floor and stains on the floor! And to make all matters worse it was very difficult just to get towels, when they claimed to only have 1-2 available for a room with 5 staying! I will not be recommending this hotel to anyone I know and will be warning people about what I experienced!

We made the reservation on Orbitz for 2 nights.  We checked into the hotel and got to our room....OMG....The sheets were stained & the room was dirty.  We're reasonable...we asked for a different room.  But wait -- they wouldn't move us!!!!  Unbelievable!!!!  We're working on getting a refund from Orbitz -- they said maybe 1/2 back.  This isn't hospitality... its theft!!!

We stayed at the Days Inn Anaheim Maingate from May 1-May 5 - we knew we were getting an average motel for the price, but there was nothing terribly wrong with this motel. Check-in was easy, and we got a room on the back side, which was quiet enough when it was time to sleep...our safe wasn't properly reset, but the front desk agent came to fix it right away. The pool and hot tub were clean, and the breakfast room was cozy, if lacking in a few food options...the beds were comfortable enough, although the towels were definitely a cheap material. Housekeeping cleaned our room and replaced our towels every day, the carpet was clean, and the front desk staff were always pleasant and accommodating...there is an Anaheim Resort Transportation shuttle that stops directly in front of the

Summary Heading: Deteriorated after changed ownership from Quality Inn
Summary: I use to stay there before when it was Quality Inn and it was a very decent place for the money. I couldn't believe after it changed ownership and name how bad the place has become. The towels were rough and stained, they didn't change them on the following day even after my request. I had to go get some myself (they were too scratchy even for a car wash). I was placed in a handycap room where the water from the shower spills throughout the whole bathroom floor. I slipped a few times and was lucky that I avoided a hard fall. The sink got filled with water from the bathroom above. The breakfast choices were cut in half. When I asked for a diferent room, they asked for an upgrade fee because they didn't have ohter single bed rooms available at the time. I was happy when a few

The rooms doesn't look like posh from the looks. But inside, you have a very decent room with comfortable bedding. We stayed for 3 days and worth it for the bucks. This is very near to Toy Story parking area. So if you are going to Disney then this is best spot which is like 1.5 miles from this place. The continental breakfast is quite good with waffles, fruits and bagels. But definitely this can be much better with more varieties. Lot of parking spots. It has a very quick check-in and check-out process. The leaks on the way due to the air conditioners could be prevented.

This place is awful and they charge stupid things.  Be aware of the charges and the people who worked their are rude and lazy and do not keep up the breakfast.  The manager Ahbib was rude as well and made a commit to my boyfriend charges to rooms that if messed up.

I stayed at this property for a week. when i checked in, i put an ipod on the table. when I went to check out, my ipod was gone. Nothing has come of this yet and it seems i will never see my i pod again.

I've a chance to stay at this Days Inn for 3 days last week. At first I was reluctant to book this hotel because of some comment from others. However I took my chance due to the location which very close to convention center(10min. walk).  I found it not bad at all. The hotel is quite new(should have been renovated recently) compare to near by hotel. The microwave and fridge are provided in the room. The room is clean, no smell. The breakfast is good with hot waffle available.Target is in walking distant. Jack in the box is right out side. It is very convenient.

Being so close to Disneyland and the price was great.  Rooms are clean and housekeeping cleans them daily for us.  Continental breakfast was filling. Parking is free and there is a shuttle that stops in front of hotel for a minimum cost that goes straight to Disney. :)

Summary Heading: Only useful if you want to be HUMILIATED beyond words!!!
Summary: My Fiance and I stay in Motels 2 to 4 times a month.  Being that I live in Long Beach, and him in Santa Ana, we try to dedicate the weekends to 'our time'.  On a budget we havent had the best of experiances....this motel BY FAR WAS THE WORST!  Upon checkout the owner Mr. Bhakta sent his employees up to make sure we didnt trash the room, in which I stated 'be my guest'.  In turn they brought down to the front desk my towel i used to shower with and our bed sheet, asking if these were my stains??  I was APPALLED!  I had accidently started my period and left maybe a quarter size stain on each item!!  He wanted to charge us for both items!!??  Is this even legal?  Someone help me!  I will NEVER stay at another Days Inn again!!!

We stayed here for a 11 day trip over the Christmas holiday. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with figuring out where to go and how to get there! Breakfast was fine and we really enjoyed the waffles. We were so beat by the end of the day that we only used the pool 4 times. the rooms were fine, but the carpet was filthy. The beds were made up and towels changed every day. I have to say the bed was pretty comfy, and i am pretty fussy when it comes to beds. All in all, it was a great experience considering the price we paid. I was very satisfied with this place.

This was our second time staying here.  We loved it so much the first time, we came back. Lived up to our expectations once again.  We stayed 4 nights while visiting Disneyland.  Check in was fast.  Front desk staff are really nice.  Our room was very clean. Two queen beds, a microwave, refrigerator, and coffee maker all for around 58.00 per night. Free continental breakfast is sufficient too.  Just a short easy drive up Harbor Blvd. to Disneyland.  We already made reservations to stay here next month when we visit the Magic Kingdom again.

This hotel was average at best. Rooms are old had a funny smell (not terrible) Ok if you are just looking for a place to sleep and leave. Breakfast room was very small, little selection, and not well kept(there were no coffee cups in the breakfast room for the coffee.

We stayed at the Days Inn Anaheim maingate for 4 nights while visiting Disneyland and surrounding parks. The hotel was very cheap, included free wi fi and free breakfast. We enjoy the waffles (make your own with batter supplied) and thought the pasteries and cereal was great. Rooms are dated, but clean, and for the price we couldn't complain. It's right next to a Jack in the Box, so convenient if you want a quick bite to eat (at any hour!).  The walk to Disneyland was a bit long in the heat, but totally do-able. It took approximately 25 minutes to walk to Disneyland, so saves paying for a shuttle or parking on-site. We also rented a car, and parking here was free, which was a bonus.  I was a bit nervous, because of the mixed reviews, but overall thought it was great value for

Summary Heading: Not a bad place to stay if you are just sleeping there after a long day at disney
Summary: We stayed here on my sons first birthday after spending the day at Disney. The location is pretty good. We drove to the park and this is definately bot walking distance. The pool was not very inviting but there is a bar right next door. Breakfast was nothing special. The room was clean and outdated, the tv didnt work that well. It wasn't worth the money but if you can get a deal this is a decent place to sleep.

We booked 5 nights here while on a Disneyland vacation. We got the room for $80.00 per night.  This is kind of high for a Days Inn, but this was actually the lowest price I could find for the area at the time.  This hotel has all the amenities we were looking for. The room was clean and had a refrigerator and microwave. The sink is located outside of the bathroom which allows a person to get ready while another person uses the toilet or shower.  This is very important when we are on vacation.   Continental breakfast consisted of cereal, pastries, donuts and even had a waffle iron.  Located less than a mile from Disneyland, we would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here 3 nights while we went to disneyland and universal. We arrived  around noon and were told check-in was not until 3, so we were charged $20 for  early check-in. Not a huge deal but I have never had to pay for early check-in  anywhere else. The first day we walked to disneyland. Their website says that  they are .7 miles from disneyland when in fact it is more like 1.1 miles. THE  MAIN THING that upset me with this hotel was when i got home I WAS CHARGED AN  EXTRA $110 for 2 towels, a flat sheet, and a mattress pad. Number one that is an  insane amount, but number two we did not damage anything. I paid a pet fee upon  checkin. On day 2 we were there one of the dogs had gotten sick on the flat  sheet. It only got on the flat sheet because it was kind of rolled up on
Manager Response: Due to the nature of your dog getting sick on the sheet and mattress pad. Those things need to be tossed out and can not be washed by hotel. These things are considered bio-hazard and for that reason you where charged.  We do not charge guest for reasonable stains.  thank you

Summary: I am sitting at a chair in one of the two rooms we booked here at Days Inn Maingate in Anaheim.  This room is a king and the other is two doubles.  Both of the rooms are clean and well kept.  The bedding and curtains are a little dated but clean and in good repair.  Overall the furniture is in good shape.  In this room there is a table and 2 chairs as well as a writing desk with a chair.  Also, there is a microwave, fridge, and a safe.  The tub is large and the shower is great with good pressure.  The motel service was wonderful, everyone was friendly and most helpful.  We arrived a couple hours early and they were happy to check us in.  I was a little concerned with the neighborhood initially but we had no problems whatsoever.  We booked this hotel online and got it for a great

If you need a place to just stay over at night then this is the place. If you need anything extra then stay away.  To start off - you need to drag your suitcases etc upstairs as there is no elevator - ok no big deal.  It is not super clean. Not even basic stuff like shampoo etc is in the room, you need to ask the front desk. The rooms smell of smoke. Even though it is all non smoking, we had to become passive smokers as folks next door or down below were smoking. Called the front desk and the man said he could do nothing about it. It was totally uncomfortable. The bathroom tub had an ugly torn mat. We stayed here for two days and on one of the days a wet dirty towel had been replaced for us in the bathroom by housekeeping.   Ok get past all this and head to the dining for

This hotel was excellent value for the amount we paid.  It was a newly renovated room & was kept clean.  We have no complaints, other than a brief couple of times at the breakfast (they ran out of coffee & milk but we helped ourself to the staff fridge to get a new milk.  This is probably our only complaint - staff slow to refill milk/coffee). They had fresh waffles (you make yourself), donuts, milk, coffee, juice, hand-fruit, cereal, toast/jam... for a free complimentary breakfast, not bad!   It was close to Disneyland, but not walking distance with kids.  Lots of restaurants nearby.   We rented to room for 7 nights and only paid approx. $45/night... it was well worth it.  We would definately stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great budget hotel with all the amenities!
Summary: We booked this hotel just looking for a cheap place to crash for a couple of nights near Disney, and were pleasantly surprised! This hotel is great for anyone traveling on a budget! It's within walking distance of Disneyland (about a 20 minute walk, a bit far if you're traveling with kiddos) or has an Anaheim Transit stop right out front. Has free breakfast, wi-fi, and parking. Super friendly and helpful; front desk staff is very knowledgeable about the area, offering great dining and entertainment suggestions. This is definitely a budget hotel, it's an older building with older rooms and decor, however it was clean and quiet (despite being right on Harbor Blvd). Those looking for a five star should probably keep looking, but those who just want a clean friendly place to stay:

We decided to go to Disneyland at the last minute, and this was by far the cheapest hotel ($300 for 3 nights for 5, with tax). We had good experiences with Days Inns before, and for cheap. I wish I would have picked one of the expensive hotels! When we got there, the hotel room smelled of cigarette smoke. We went down to the front desk to be moved to a nonsmoking room. It turned out that it WAS a nonsmoking room. They came in and sprayed a little Lysol to fix the problem. It made it fairly bearable. After that, we were so sick of the hotel that we drove to the parks. (Tip: Park in the Toy Story lot. It is much closer than Mickey and Friends.) When we got back, we crashed into the squeaky beds. The next morning, we woke up and went down to breakfast. We intended to eat in the

We have previously stayed at the Quality Inn on Manchester but after tromping through the park all day the walk back at night seemed extra long, plus the rooms are old, a little on the musty side and we always had issues with the TV.  Decided to try this Quality Inn, it is by no means within walking distance of the park, but taking the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) buses was actually nicer than being within walking distance.  Our room was large, bright, well-maintained, EXCEPT the carpet was unbelievably dirty.  Just walking across the room left your socks filthy, and it seemed odd since the hotel looked rather clean.  You can pay double for a room along Harbor because it's closer but those facades can be deceiving whey you open the door to your room and find it hasn't been

Me and my family went recently to disneyland and decided to stay in this hotel everything looked well until i took off my shoes and the carpet made them dirty really dirty carpet and also the house keepers where trying to butt into my life asking my family questions and talking about every little move me and my husband would make they dont know me nor my family i guess they dont have anything better to do than find out peoples lives they should get goin and do their job... Other than that it was ok.

Summary Heading: Have stayed here 3 times and never have a problem
Summary: Quality Inn Maingate  is great for the value! We have stayed at this site 3 times and are going back for Spring Break in 2 weeks. I travel here with my husband, 4 kids and in~laws. We always get 2 rooms and we have never got a bad room. My in~laws have stayed here at least 2 more times than we have. So a totally of at least 5 different stays with 8 different rooms and not 1 bad 1, I think is saying a lot. The staff is always super friendly and polite. Everytime we get there, they great us like we are family and get us into a room quickly. The rooms are clean, and comfy. They are not 5 star but if you are booking here then obviously you are looking for a bargain not luxury! I only have 1 complaint, but it is not the staffs fault. The floors could be a little cleaner but what do

I arrived at Quality Inn Maingate around 4 pm and found the doors locked.  I had to wait for someone to show up, about five minutes.  The room was a good size, wireless was fast and had no issues with.  Seemed clean enough.  Shower pressure was good, bed was comfortable.  Not sure of TV channels as I never turned it on once.  Breakfast wasnt all that good and is in the back of the office in some tiny little room.  Coffee was wretched.  But all in all, a good stay for the money, cost me under $50 bucks and was very close to Disneyland, although I was there for other reasons.  Also not sure of what restuarants are nearby since I just grabbed a bit at the Jack In The Box next door after a concert.

I was very scared to book after reading all the not so hot reviews. This was especially because I was seeking a quiet, clean and comfortable place to recover from surgery. A place right next to Disneyland would not be the ideal place for this but due to an unexpected last minute change from my doctor I was left with little options. I was VERY, VERY, VERY pleased with everything I recieved! My surgery was scheduled later in the afternoon and I was glad they kindly allowed for an early check-in. I asked for a quiet room NOT near too many families with children (I thought they'd laugh in my face), ALOT of extra pillows and with a sincere, friendly smile they went above and beyond. Im very appreciative, Im sure you will be too. Give em a shot!

Summary Heading: Cheap, clean, but definitely not a place I would go again.
Summary: This hotel is no where near the Maingate of Disney.  It is at least 10 minutes by car.  The "deluxe" continental breakfast featured soggy powdered sugar donuts, bread, corn flakes, regular cheerios, bruised fruit, and, yes, waffles.  The "heated" pool was freezing, the hot tub dirty.  The pool furniture consisted of one plastic table, 2 plastic chairs, one of which was broken, and two of the filthiest chaise lounges I have ever seen.  The room was clean, no microwave or fridge, but there is a safe that they add to your bill, and you must request that the charge be removed from your bill.  The blankets on the bed are so rough it is like sleeping with steel wool.  I planned this trip for a long time with my daughter and grandchildren, and was grossly disappointed in the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write about your experience here at our hotel.  We certainly appreciate all comments good or bad for it lets us know what area's we need to improve in and others we are doing well in.  I will certainly bring up all your comments to the General Manager so we can work on them.  My housekeeping department will be happy to hear you complimented their work in the rooms as being clean.  Thank you for that and for your honesty.  Karen front desk manager

Summary Heading: OK for a very short stay
Summary: Our stay here was OK. We did get a great rate and it was close enough to Disneyland for us. The staff was friendly and there were no problems with checking in or out.  However, we didn't like the fact that our door didn't shut completely even with the deadbolt and latch  in place. Also, my husband found a crawlspace/attic entrance into our room, above the bathroom area, which made us both feel uneasy. Our sheets were also a little torn and we were not sure if they were really clean or not.  Overall, it was a cheap place for us to rest our heads at night after a long day at Disneyland. I definitely wouldn't recommend this place to a family with children, though as we didn't really feel safe here.
Manager Response: Sorry to hear you had trouble working the door latch and that you felt unsafe during your stay with us.  We always have somebody in the office 24/7 you may always call and ask to have someone look at the problem or we can always move you to a different room if you prefer.   Either way I'm sorry you felt unsafe. I do apprreciate the good comments regarding our pricing and our staff being friendly.  Thank you again for your feedback. Manager

Summary: I originally chose this hotel for the price and location, but was concerned that it may not be the best choice based on past experiences with hotels close to Disneyland. I was pleasantly surprised! The room was not huge, but it was clean, comfortable, and quiet, and a real bargain for what I paid. We walked to Disneyland one day, which took about 10 minutes, but saved $12 in parking fees. I wouldn't recommend doing so on a really hot day though. Overall, great value for the money, and I would definitely return.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such kind words about your stay with us.  Our goal is to provide clean and comfortable rooms for all our guests, and stay within economy pricing.  So it's nice to hear when guests are satisfied and do go the extra mile and write about it.  My staff will really appreciate your kind words as if giving them a pat on the back.  Thank you again, Karen, front desk manager

Summary: Don't ever, ever, ever stay here. I was given a non smoking room but it was obviously was a smoking room. I paid a deposit and never stayed five minutes in the room. It was dirty and gross. The manager tried to tell me it was a non smoking room and it was not. It smelled like urine too. We paid $80 to this hotel for nothing. I was scared to sleep there. My kids told me they did not want to stay there either. I stayed at the Doubletree on City Drive for almost the same price and it was great. I was never offered any of my money back. There were people partying running up and down the hallways and I knew right then that staying here was a huge mistake.
Manager Response: Sorry for your bad experience.  Unfortunately some guests might smoke in a non-smoking room and we cannot control what guests do in the room.  Our maids do ionize and have special sprays for that.  We try our best to accomodate each and every guest and if any guests are being loud we certainly try to limit the noise when made aware of it.  Thank you for your input.  Front Desk Manager

Summary: Ok,  we reserved our room before and after reading all reviews and decided to wait till we get there. Fist we liked the location it is Close to Disneyland and the public bus and bus for Disneyland were just out from of our store. Luckily we were able to find Free parking close to the Disneyland so we loved the location.   Ok when we booked the Hotel/Motel we expected lower Quality as it was 2 stars. so in our minds we were ready for a place to put our heads at night. (also we traveled with our 2 Pugs) . when we checked in we were greeted by the weekend desk manager and they were expecting us as we call ahead and talked to the manager and asked questions. they were all very helpful and we got our keys quickly. we went to our room to see it. it was very big and clean very clean
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind input.  I enjoyed reading everything you wrote and I do remember your sweet pugs, especially their morning walks with both of you.  We look forward to seeing you again if you are ever in the Anaheim area.  Thank you again,   Front Desk Manager

Summary Heading: Good, Beautiful & Cheap (bueno, bonito y barato)
Summary: I booked some days for a convention, I traveled with colleagues. Good services, kind people, no troubles; clean and cheap. About the meals at breakfast I think could be better. Dailly was the same, but in general overview I recommend for those who want make a short trip to Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words describing your stay at Quality Inn Maingate.  We certainly appreciate you taking the time to say such nice things.  So many people will take the time to write negative things, but not so many take time to write such nice things.  So from every staff member here, we "Thank you." Front Desk Manager

Summary: We booked the reservation on the net, and cashed in points for the stay. We didn't know what to expect from a freebie.   The checking in and out process was painless. We got our keys and found our room. The room looked and smelled clean, so we were pleasantly surprised. The next day was another issue.  We had asked for extra towels but didn't get any. In the morning, we asked the maid for some. She refused until we gave her our used ones, which was fine. We waited for her to bring new ones but never came back. When we finally found her, she made us wait, and then gave us towels. They were still wet! At first, we thought she just took them out too soon but then I noticed my make-up stain! All she did was throw our old ones into the dryer! Talk about major ick factor!  We went to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay.   Our housekeeping procedures is to inform the front desk staff  of your request and the housekeeping supervisor will make sure your request is met.  Sorry you encountered a bad experience, Front Desk Manager

Summary: The room had a HOLE in the bathroom wall, and a crack in the floor tile that insects were coming through. When I wanted to leave and go someplace else and get a refund the manager seemed unconcerned and told us that the "guarantee" was only a guarantee to "make it right" by giving us another room. The next room had NO towel racks and cracks in the shower tiles and NO soap dish in the bathtub!! I complained again but have not gotton a refund or any satisfaction!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to inform us about your stay.  I am sorry you encountered these problems.  When informed of such things, our front desk staff creates work orders and we certainly try daily to have all things fixed.  Thanks again for your input, Front Desk Manager

Summary: I booked through orbitz, ordered a non smoking room we drove 7 hours to get there when we arrived manager said he had no non smoking rooms, i told him i had ordered one and he said sorry there is a convention in town, also a/c unit held up with a 2x4, next morning ironing familys clothes iron leaked water out of bottom of iron, could not iron clothes, bathroom had stucco falling off ceiling called orbitz to complain said go ahead and leave, quality inn did not want to credit for the 3 days i was not staying, hotel staff are shady hotel is a  dump picure looks good online don't let that fool you...finally  recieved credit from orbitz, quality still did not give orbitz credit. that room smelled so bad of smoke me and family could barely breath and we smelled like smoke the next

Summary Heading: Stay here ONLY if upi absolute can't find anything else
Summary: Made a last minute decision to stay here. Knew it was a mistake as soon as we drove in. This place is sadly overused and neglected. The front desk clerk gave us misinformation. Went to our room and there was NO WAY I would let my bare feet touch the floor. It was covered in stains, sticky to the touch and not vacuumed. The rest of the room felt like I would pick up some incurable disease. Took one look at the pool and hot tub and wanted to be sick. The water was YELLOW. There was no way I would put any of my body in there, much less let my child touch the water, much to her dismay. We only stayed because there was no place else. Took the kids to Disneyland and the next morning went to the complimentary breakfast. It was NOTHING like the picture on the website. All day old (or

Although the room was clean and the beds somewhat comfortable, this hotel is a mess.  Trash, litter and cigarette butts are strewn all over the outside.  It's very apparant this property is not well maintained.  The "breakfast" was awful.  Breads, cold cereal and store bought apples.  Thats all.  Upon check in we were informed the pool was heated.  Not sure how the hotel defines heated, but we experienced a deeply frigid pool.  Not sure how they came up with "Maingate" in the name:  it's well over a mile and a half to Disneyland.  Parking next to rooms is very limited.  Adjacent parking lots are not well lit.  Though the front desk staff was not rude or discouteous, they were completely indifferent and apathetic to questions and concerns (could not get an outside line to make a

We had originally booked our room for two nights, but decided to leave after one. The furniture and beds weren't in terrible condition, but you can tell the rooms haven't been renovated in a while. The biggest problem I encountered in the room was that very few of the electrical outlets had covers. There were exposed wires sticking out of the holes in the wall. I felt extremely uncomfortable letting my two year old daughter walk around in the room. I ended up having to use the chairs in the room to block her from going near the exposed outlets.

We were rebooked at the Quality Inn Maingate through Expedia, after getting cancelled due to overbooking at another hotel, The staff was helpful and friendly, the room clean and roomy. While the "Maingate" part of the name was a bit of a stretch, it was about a 20 minute walk to Disney's maingate, the Anaheim Resort Trolley stop was directly in front of the hotel.  Big perk there. The only thing that kept it from being perfect was a coffee pot that had the wrong lid. Partially brewed coffee went everywhere because of the wrong lid. (It didn't push the stopper up to allow the brewed coffee to flow into the pot. It ran out of the basket instead.) I broke the pot in the melee and it was replaced, again with the wrong top, again with an overflow mess. Thank goodness for the

You want the truth here it is.  If your expectations are average, and your not used to five star hotels this place is fine.  We just got back.  The beds are comfortable, that does not mean plush and cozy, but it means we all slept fine during our 5 night stay.  The matteress were fine. The towels were not thin, as I read in a earlier description, now if your used to plush thick towels you might think so, but realisticly they are fine. Water was always warm. The housekeeping will leave extra towels if you ask them, we left them 2.00 a day and the room was always clean and ready.  The rooms are clean, the breakfast was not as described, that would probably be our biggest complaint, the waffles were generic egos, and the danishes were a bit to be desired, so don't let the breakfast

I chose to stay at this hotel mainly because it was a mile from Disneyland. I was traveling with family (wife + 5 year old + 3 month old).  I specifically reserved a room with a refrigerator and microwave (paying $10 more than the same room without the fridge and microwave)  only because of the convenience it offered to a family with small kids. But the moment I checked in (around 10 PM) I noticed that the microwave and fridge were missing! I immediately complained but was told that the best they could do at that time was offer the fridge and microwave of the lobby.  But that was not acceptable to us for various reasons and we declined that offer. So not only did the milk that we got along with us go to waste, I had to make a couple of trips to the grocery store in the middle of

Summary Heading: Not the Ritz, but good value
Summary: Good rate over the internet.  Rooms were clean.  Beds slightly uncomfortable.  Breakfast good: waffles, milk, juice, etc.  (better then most on the stip--if you don't like it you can skip over to Jack-in-the-box)  Sink area is somewhat small.  Paper in the morning is nice.  Helpful staff.  Parking is very near the rooms--safer but could be noisy.  Overall, good place to stay if you are on a budget.

Being from across the country, we were really nervous about choosing a hotel.  The military rate was great for this hotel.  We got there and found it a little worn down but the staff was very kind.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The trolley to Disney picked up right out front, the tickets were sold right in the lobby for just a dollar, kids rode free.  Breakfast was great, waffles, juice, cereal, toast, muffins and lots of coffee.  I am glad we stayed here.

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel with a great breakfast
Summary: We stayed at the Quality Inn Maingate for two nights and loved it. The room was very clean and spacious with a comfy bed. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was excellent with a good selection of food (including waffles) and a morning paper. We enjoyed a quiet soak in the spa pool and made use of the convenient laundry facilities. This was above the quality you might expect for such a reasonable rate and we would definitely stay there again.
